meta.name: Rise, Rapture, Rise Campaign Expansion
meta.description:
"In recent months, reports have surfaced of children - exclusively little girls - being abducted by a sea monster with a single glowing red eye. Has the tainted water of Innsmouth beget a new abominiation? Or has this creature migrated from even greater depths?"

Rise, Rapture, Rise is a custom campaign for Arkham Horror: The Card Game set in the Bioshock Universe.
meta.author: DozensOfDonuts

cards.name: Big Sister
cards.text: Forced - When targeted, if you are a... - Little Sister, do nothing. - Big Daddy, spawn Big Sister engaged with you. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase, Big Sister disengages from each investigator and is placed above their current location.

cards.flavor: Mattresses on metal frames. An absence of light.
cards.name: Dormitory
cards.text: Forced - When you reveal Dormitory: Shuffle a [[Task]] treachery in your threat area into the encounter deck, setting aside any spawned cards. If you cannot, draw the top card of the Little Sister deck. Each [[Believer]] or [[Chosen]] investigator gains: Ignore the forced ability above.

cards.flavor:
"The Little Sister's Orphanage: In troubled times, give your little girl the life that she deserves. Boarding and education free of charge! After all, children ARE the future of Rapture."
― Public Address Advertisement
cards.name: Little Sister's Orphanage

cards.flavor: It loomed like a beacon, guarded by two imposing Greek statues. The final stop before ascension.
cards.name: Bathysphere Station
cards.text: [action]: Resign. There, the bathysphere station!

cards.name: Rolling Hills
cards.text: Forced - At the end of the round, if a [[Surveillance]] treachery is targeting this location, take 1 horror, which can only be assigned to you or an [[Ally]] asset. Each investigator who has a blossom from a rose gains: Ignore the forced ability above.

cards.flavor: An amnesiac detective, ain't that a quandary. Nevertheless, there must be evidence nearby that could shock some sense into DeWitt. Just need to keep a low profile. If that's even possible in a city such as this.
cards.name: Searching In Shadows
cards.text: Forced - After you defeat a [[Syndicate]] enemy: Place 1 resource next to this act. Then, after 3 resources are placed, take control of the set-aside Missing Poster story asset. Objective - If all 3 story assets are under the control of investigators at DeWitt Investigations, immediately advance.

cards.name: Remember The Name
cards.text:
A discarded missing poster not meant for prying eyes, a ragged doll peeking out from underneath a pillow, and a lottery ticket scratched relentlessly. That was enough to wake Booker DeWitt from his drunken stupor. "You shouldn't be here," he pants uncontrollably. "It's eternal damnation, this Rapture! The children... the little girls... they're not human anymore. Their bellies..." he shudders for a moment before snapping out of it. "There's no time to explain, we have to leave. Tenenbaum, she can help."
Choose an investigator to take control of the set-aside Booker DeWitt asset. He does not take up an ally slot for the duration of this scenario. Players may exchange [[Evidence]] assets.

cards.name: Gardner Delux Modern
cards.text:
Gardner Delux Modern gets -1 shroud value for each time it has moved this round.
[reaction] After you successfully investigate Gardner Delux Modern, spend 2 resources: Swap this location with another [[Lower Level]] location. (Group limit once per round).

cards.flavor: Upholstered chairs lie overturned and rotting furniture litters the floor.
cards.name: Gardner Delux Modern
cards.text: The path leading to Gardner Delux Modern is blocked. As an additional cost for you to enter Gardner Delux Modern, investigators must spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group.

cards.flavor: "The damn thing's crawling on the ceiling!"
cards.name: Spider Splicer
cards.text: Spawn - Above the act deck, out of play. Forced - After any investigator discovers 2 clues during a single turn, if Spider Splicer is ready: Spawn, or move, it to their location. While Spider Splicer is out of play it can be attacked by any investigator at any location using a [[Firearm]], [[Ranged]], or [[Spell]] card.

cards.flavor: "Sonic Boom -- when push comes to shove."
cards.name: Sonic Boom
cards.text: Uses (3 Eve). [action]: Evade. You may use [willpower] instead of [agility] for this evasion attempt. If you succeed, exhaust Sonic Boom and spend X eve: If that enemy is non-[[Elite]], move that enemy X locations away from you, and deal them X damage.

cards.name: Call to Arms
cards.text: Revelation - Put Call to Arms into play in the center of the map. Forced - When doom is placed on Sofia Lamb: Place 1 doom on Call to Arms. Then, when 3 doom is on this card, place 1 horror token on Atlas, exhaust Sofia Lamb, and place this card on the bottom of the deck attached to Civil Disobedience.

cards.flavor:
""Memories and possibilities are ever more hideous than realities."
-- H.P. Lovecraft
cards.name: Shattered Memories
cards.text: Forced - During the mythos phase, each investigator at an [[Extradimensional]] location must draw the top card of their Past Haunts deck. If no effect would trigger after resolving that card, that card gains surge.

cards.name: The Walls
cards.text: [free]: Move. Move to a revealed The Walls location. Big Daddies and [[Humanoid]] enemies cannot enter The Walls. When placed or spawned here, place Big Daddy investigators and [[Humanoid]] enemies on the nearest [[Facility]] location, instead.

cards.flavor: A funhouse of colors and steel line the inner-walls of Point Prometheus, granting access to the little ones via their art deco hidey-holes.
cards.name: The Walls
cards.text: The Walls is inaccessible to Big Daddies. Only Little Sister's at a connected [[Altered]] location may enter The Walls.

cards.flavor: Though you refrain to admit it, Dyer's plan to happen upon a key in the vastness of this trench seems far-fetched.
cards.name: "Just a little deeper..." (v. I)
cards.text: Forced - While not in a vehicle, as an additional cost to move up or down, spend X actions, where X is the row you will be moving from (max 3). Forced - At the start of the round: Perform a shifting test. Objective - At the end of the round, if each investigator is at the same [[Ruins]] location, they may spend the requisite number of clues, as a group, to advance.

cards.name: The Key to the Castle
cards.text:
"There!," Dyer yelled, "what's that?" Tenenbaum approached, insisting it was a sea slug. However, her body language soon told a much different story. It was a statue depicting an eldritch being, covered in moss and algae, humming ever so gently, illuminating a green pulse. "Cthulhu," Dyer gasped.
Check Campaign Log. - If the investigators won over the populace or desecrated the utopia, read Truculent Totem 1 in the Scenario Interlude: Truculent Totem in the Campaign Guide. - If Lamb's flock has ascended, read Truculent Totem 1 in the Scenario Interlude: Truculent Totem in the Campaign Guide. - If Ryan rules with an iron fist, read Truculent Totem 2 in the Scenario Interlude: Truculent Totem in the Campaign Guide.

cards.flavor:
"Another utopia built on broken backs."
-- Dr. Brigid Tenenbaum
cards.name: Shantytown
cards.text: Shantytown gets +X shroud, where X is the highest [combat] value amongst investigators at this location. If you contemplated utopia, choose the lowest [combat] instead.

cards.name: Apollo Square
cards.text:
[reaction] After you enter Apollo Square: Move 1 card from either your True side to your Mirror side, or vice versa.
[reaction] After you succeed at a skill test while investigating Apollo Square: Move 1 card from your True hand to your Mirror hand.

cards.back_flavor:
"Specimen is small. Malnourished appearance but biologically stable. Skin pale, waxen. Eyes: large, luminescent, unnatural. Signs of extensive cognitive conditioning evident. Responds to auditory triggers ("Mr. Bubbles," "Angel") with immediate behavioral shifts. Social patterns limited. Displays strong imprinting response to assigned Protector (Big Daddy). Severe distress upon separation.
Conclusion: Subject functional. Ethical concerns irrelevant. Program success."
--- Excerpt from the lab notes of one Dr. Yi Suchong
cards.back_text: Deck Size: What it used to be, when you were human. Deckbuilding Options: Little Sister's can't build decks. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Do you remember...?
cards.name: Little Sister
cards.text: You begin the game with Syringe in play, and cannot play [[Item]] or [[Ally]] assets. You get +1 skill value for each matching icon on cards attached to Little Sister. [action]: Attach a card to Little Sister (paying its cost). Then, draw 1 card. [elder_sign] +2. You may attach a card to Little Sister (paying its cost).

cards.flavor: ~~ "We'll go down with our sinking paradise" ~~
cards.name: 7-Inch Record
cards.text: [action] Exhaust 7-Inch Record: Parley. Test [willpower] (X), where X is the number of enemies in play. If you succeed, reduce each enemies fight and evade values by 1 for the remainder of the round (2 if there were 4 or more enemies in play).

cards.flavor: With your vision impaired and your body inert, you can only hope the presence lurking above is one of good, not evil. It is your only chance at escaping. That, or you wait for the ice to thaw.
cards.name: Sculpted in Frost (v. I)
cards.text: Objective - After an investigator engages a non-weakness enemy, immediately advance.

cards.name: Curiouser and Curiouser!
cards.text:
The sound of footsteps have come to a halt just outside your ice block. A moment of silence. Then, a spotlight gleams down from above, striking a painted face staring right into yours. The man, with his pencil moustache and dead eyes, smiling eerily into your soul. "Ah! The critics have arrived at last, how splendid!" His cadence is shrill and unhinged. "Here to see The March Hare? It is my latest masterpiece. Though it's missing its STARRRRRR!" The man's rousing scream shatters the ice surrounding you. You are now free. In a mad, mad world.
Move each [[Lower Level]] location in play so that they form the "inner ring" around The Atrium (see "Location Placement for The March Hare" on page 41 of the Campaign Guide). Attach the set-aside Spotlight to The Atrium, facing any location. Discard the copy of Frozen in Ice attached to The Atrium if you have not yet done so.

cards.name: Knowledge is Power
cards.text: Revelation - Test [intellect] (X), where X is the number of cards in your hand. If you fail, discard all cards from your hand that do not have a [intellect] skill icon (to a maximum of 3).

cards.name: Larva Nests
cards.text:
Larva Nests gets +[per_investigator] shroud. Reduce the shroud of Larva Nests by X, where X is the amount of clues on it.
[reaction] After you discover any amount of clues from Larva Nests: Place 1 resource on it, as a vision.
[free] If Larva Nests has 2 visions: Reveal the attached story asset and add it to any investigator's hand.

cards.flavor:
"This little Sea Slug has come along and glued together all the crazy ideas I've had since the war. It doesn't just heal damaged cells, it… resurrects them. I can bend the double helix. Black can be reborn white, tall, short, weak, strong…"
--- Brigid Tenenbaum
cards.name: Larva Nests

cards.flavor: "Foes coming out of deep freeze? Make sure they stay on ice with Winter Blast!"
cards.name: Winter Blast
cards.text:
Uses (3 Eve).
[free] After revealing tokens during a skill test on a [[Firearm]] or [[Melee]] asset, exhaust Winter Blast and spend 1 eve: You get -2 skill value for this test. If you succeed, this attack deals +2 damage.

cards.name: Shattered Shield
cards.text: Revelation - Put Shattered Shield into play in your threat area. Treat the text box of each [[ADAM]] asset you control (including permanents) as blank. [action][action]: Discard Shattered Shield.

cards.name: Alpha Series
cards.text: Each enemy at this location gets -1 evade. [reaction] At the end of the enemy phase: Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, Alpha Series deals 1 damage to an enemy at this location. If you fail, flip Alpha Series over. Any investigator at this location may perform this test. Forced - If there are no investigators at this location: Flip Alpha Series over.

cards.name: Alpha Series
cards.text: Forced - After an investigator fails a test while attempting to evade at any location, if Alpha Series is ready: Move Alpha Series once towards that location. [action] If Alpha Series is exhausted: Parley. Test [agility] (3) to hypnotize the Big Daddy. If you succeed, flip over Alpha Series (keeping all tokens) and attach it to your location.

cards.name: Missing Poster
cards.text:
If Missing Poster was acquired via the act's forced effect, read the following:
Tucked away in the vest pocket of one of Sullivan's guards, you find a missing poster. Details are sparse, with nothing more than a picture, name, and age. But something about this girl tugs at you. Is it a coincidence, or is this Arkham's own?
If an investigator had a crumpled poster, read the following:
You instinctively search for the crumpled poster you discovered at the records office back in Arkham, and sure enough, it's a match. Not the printed sheet itself, but the girl. No doubt it's Annabelle Peaslee. Not this "Ellen, age 5." Who took her? Why'd they change her name? And where is she now? Missing in Arkham, missing in Rapture. Poor little thing.
Flip this card over.

cards.name: Missing Poster
cards.text: Forced - When you gain control of Missing Poster, flip it over and resolve its text. [free] If you are at a location with an [[Obstacle]] treachery, exhaust Missing Poster and Parley: Test [intellect] (3) to question the patrons. If you succeed, discard that treachery.

cards.flavor: A pungent, musty odor wafts off each record crudely thrown on rotting shelves.
cards.name: Rapture Records
cards.text:
[free] Take 1 damage: Move to The Atrium.
[action]: Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, attach a [[Pact]] treachery in your hand or under your control to Sander Cohen.

cards.flavor: Here lies a frozen tomb of decadence, where boutiques and lifeless mannequins stand in eerie silence.
cards.name: Poseidon Plaza
cards.text: The path leading to Poseidon Plaza is blocked. As an additional cost for you to enter Poseidon Plaza, investigators must spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group.

cards.flavor: "The one in the dark! It wants to play!"
cards.name: Ring Around The Rosie
cards.text: Revelation - Put Ring Around The Rosie into play in your threat area. Move into each [[Sanctum]] location during your turn, ending on the location you began at. Forced - If you succeed, place Ring Around The Rosie next to the scenario reference card.

cards.name: The Sight
cards.text:
Uses (3 charges).
[action] Spend 1 charge: Discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until a treachery is discarded, and draw it. After resolving that treachery, search your discard pile for an event and add it to your hand.

cards.name: The Walls
cards.text: [free]: Move. Move to a revealed The Walls location. Big Daddies and [[Humanoid]] enemies cannot enter The Walls. When placed or spawned here, place Big Daddy investigators and [[Humanoid]] enemies on the nearest [[Facility]] location, instead.

cards.flavor: A funhouse of colors and steel line the inner-walls of Point Prometheus, granting access to the little ones via their art deco hidey-holes.
cards.name: The Walls
cards.text: The Walls is inaccessible to Big Daddies. Only Little Sister's at a connected [[Altered]] location may enter The Walls.

cards.name: Bad Intel
cards.text: Revelation - Attach Bad Intel to any non-[[Elite]] enemy (hunter or elusive, if able). If there is no enemy in play, search the encounter deck and discard pile for one and draw it, attaching Bad Intel to it (shuffle the encounter deck). Clues cannot be discovered from the attached enemy's location.

cards.flavor: "A man chooses, a slave obeys."
cards.name: Ryan's Henchman
cards.text: While you control Ryan's Henchman, you may take an additional action during your turn, which can only be used to fight [[Splicer]] enemies.

cards.name: Brain Hemorrhage
cards.text: Revelation - Put Brain Hemorrhage into play in your threat area. You get -3 [willpower]. Forced - At the end of your turn: Test [willpower] (2). If you succeed, discard Brain Hemorrhage.

cards.flavor: "There's more than one way to fry an egg."
cards.name: Atlas
cards.text: Aloof. Elusive. Patrol (nearest [[Center]] location with 1 or fewer horror tokens on it). Forced - At the end of the enemy phase, if Atlas is ready, has a horror token on him, and is at a [[Center]] location: Place that token on his current location.

cards.name: Betrayed By Oneself
cards.text: Revelation - Put Betrayed By Oneself into play in your threat area. Forced - Each time you gain any amount of resources via a card effect, take that much damage. [action]: Gain 1-3 resources. Then, discard Betrayed By Oneself. Only [[Criminal]] investigators may trigger the above ability.

cards.name: Sea Slug
cards.text: Swarming 2. Forced - Sea Slug cannot be disengaged. Forced - When Sea Slug attacks you: Instead of damage, lose X resources or discard X cards from your hand, where X is the number of Sea Slug enemies (including swarm cards).

cards.name: The Master Key
cards.text:
<family "Linux Libertine">Create a separate bag consisting of the following tokens: </family>+1, 0, -1, and -2. This is the lockdown bag, and these are lockdown tokens. They are not chaos tokens.
Some abilities will instruct the players to make a lockdown test. A lockdown test may cause locations to move. When locations move, all investigators, enemies, tokens, and attachments at that location remain at that location, but move with it.
To perform a lockdown test, resolve the effects of all lockdown tokens on locations as indicated on the other side of this card, starting with the highest-numbered token (+1, then 0, then -1, then -2). After resolving all effects, return all tokens to the lockdown bag.
Flip this card over and place it next to the scenario reference card.

cards.name: Lockdown Procedures
cards.text: Hard / Expert

cards.flavor:
The knotted wood looms large over you, mocking your confinement. In Arcadia, in Rapture. Time is running out.
No.
Time is but an illusion.
cards.name: Dim Visions
cards.text: Forced - After you fail a skill test while targeted by a [[Surveillance]] treachery: Add 1 resource token (from the resource pool) to that treachery. Forced - When an enemy would move via a keyword or card effect and cannot, they instead explore and move to the location drawn.

cards.name: Lying In The Poppies
cards.text:
If an investigator has the [[Silver Twilight]] or [[Sorcerer]] trait, read the following:
Not so fast! Ph'nglui n'gha, mgn'ghft! Ph'nglui mgn'ghft, n'gha!
Increase Oxygen Deficit by 1 [per_investigator]. Reset the agenda deck to agenda 3a. This can only be performed once per game.
Otherwise:
Despite your best efforts to reach the bathysphere station, the power of the poison and those out to get you is too much to overcome. You stumble, teetering on the brink of exhaustion.
(→R4)

cards.flavor: A leaking statue of Poseidon acts as the centerpiece to the Saturnine's base of operations.
cards.name: The Mausoleum
cards.text: You cannot investigate The Mausoleum if a [[Sorcerer]] enemy is at this location. If there are no clues on The Mausoleum, remember that you found honeybee spit.

cards.name: Rolling Hills
cards.text: Forced - At the end of the round, reduce Oxygen Deficit by 1 [per_investigator] if you are targeted by a [[Surveillance]] treachery. Each investigator who has a macabre twig mask gains: Ignore the forced ability above.

cards.name: Tear in the Cosmos
cards.text: Easy / Standard [skull]: -1 (-3 instead if you are at a Sunken location). [cultist]: Reveal X additional tokens, where X is half the amount of doom on the current agenda (rounded up). [tablet]: -2. Flip (or rotate) the nearest [[Surveillance]] enemy. If you fail, flip each [[Surveillance]] enemy. [elder_thing]: -3. If you fail, remove the top card of your default deck from the game.

cards.name: Tear in the Cosmos
cards.text: Hard / Expert [skull]: -2 (-4 instead if you are at a Sunken location). [cultist]: Reveal X additional tokens, where X is the amount of doom on the current agenda. [tablet]: -3. Flip (or rotate) the nearest [[Surveillance]] enemy. If you fail, the nearest [[Surveillance]] enemy attacks you. [elder_thing]: -5. If you fail, remove the top X cards of your default deck from the game, where X is the amount you failed by.

cards.name: The Walls
cards.text: [free]: Move. Move to a revealed The Walls location. Big Daddies and [[Humanoid]] enemies cannot enter The Walls. When placed or spawned here, place Big Daddy investigators and [[Humanoid]] enemies on the nearest [[Facility]] location, instead.

cards.flavor: A funhouse of colors and steel line the inner-walls of Point Prometheus, granting access to the little ones via their art deco hidey-holes.
cards.name: The Walls
cards.text: The Walls is inaccessible to Big Daddies. Only Little Sister's at a connected [[Altered]] location may enter The Walls.

cards.flavor: Thousands congregate in the Grand Hall to witness the grand, impromptu assembly, trampling over one another, dangling off bannisters to catch a glimpse of Ryan, Atlas, or Lamb. Now, more than ever, is your opportunity to seize the moment, right the wrongs of this doomed city, and gather support from the groundswell of citizens to prevent Rapture from collapsing in on itself.
cards.name: Gathering of the Minds
Twin Flames
cards.text:
The momentum of the masses seems to be in your favor. However, as nefarious plans unfolded in every corner of the atrium, the sound of a hulking protector emerged from beyond. You prayed someone would step in. And apparently it was a set of twins, walking, in lockstep, through a tear in the very fabric of reality. Baffled, Dyer remarked, "it must be the work of the waking Gods! The cosmos is fragmenting." The left twin spoke first. "The cosmos, fragmenting? Just like Rapture, it seems." Then the right. "Yes, indeed! A grand farce, really." To the left. "Chaos is boring now." And to the right. "Let's hope for a better show!"
Spawn a random, set aside [[Big Daddy]] enemy at the location farthest from all investigators, and attach a random, set aside [[Mood]] treachery to it. Put the set-aside Lutece Twins story asset into play, in the center of all locations, with its surveillance arrows facing The People's Court side. Put the Lutece Twins Reference card into play, next to the scenario reference card.

cards.name: Lower Concourse
cards.text: [free] During your turn, spend 3 resources: Increase Oxygen Deficit by 1 [per_investigator]. (Group limit once per round.) Lower Concourse is connected to Upper Concourse for all [[Sorcerer]] enemies, or investigators with a macabre twig mask.

cards.name: Rolling Hills
cards.text: Forced - At the end of the round, reduce Oxygen Deficit by 1 [per_investigator] if you are targeted by a [[Surveillance]] treachery. Each investigator who has a macabre twig mask gains: Ignore the forced ability above.

cards.name: Prison Cell
cards.text: Clues on Prison Cell cannot be discovered except by the below ability. [action]: Parley. Test [willpower] (2) to pray for help. If you succeed, discover a clue at this location. If you fail, you may take 1 horror to reduce this test's difficulty by 1 for the remainder of your turn.

cards.flavor:
"I bet against Andy Ryan's vision o' harmony in Rapture -- offered him a quiet place to send anybody who wasn't workin' out. And now I'm sittin' on my own private think tank."
-- Augustus Sinclair
cards.name: Prison Cell
cards.text: Prison Cell is under lock and key. You cannot enter Prison Cell.

cards.name: Fountain of Youth
cards.text: Permanent. Limit 1 per deck. Forced - You have -2 maximum health and -2 maximum sanity. [reaction] At the end of your turn, spend 1 resource: Heal 1 damage or 1 horror from an investigator or [[Ally]] asset at your location.

cards.flavor:
"A garden built on blind faith."
-- Dr. Brigid Tenenbaum
cards.name: Garden of New Eden
cards.text: Garden of New Eden gets +X shroud, where X is the highest [willpower] value amongst investigators at this location. If you studied the disciples, choose the lowest [willpower] instead.

cards.name: Fort Frolic
cards.text:
[reaction] After you enter Fort Frolic: Move 1 card from either your True side to your Mirror side, or vice versa.
[reaction] After you succeed at a skill test while investigating Fort Frolic: Move 1 card from the top of your True deck to the top of your Mirror deck.

cards.name: Thalassophobia
cards.text: Revelation - Put Thalassophobia into play in your threat area. You cannot play events. Forced - At the end of the round, test [willpower] (2) (3 if at a [[Sunken]] location). If you succeed, discard Thalassophobia. If you fail, discard Thalassophobia and each event from your hand.

cards.flavor: Now leading the charge, you follow Booker back into Market Street one final time. "Keep your head down, and blend in with the crowd," he urges. "We don't want any heat." You sift through hordes of curious gawkers, clueless as to where this stranger's leading you. Anywhere but here sounds good right about now.
cards.name: A Train To Catch
cards.text: Forced - Each investigator must resign at the same location. Objective - If each undefeated investigator has resigned, advance.

cards.name: Into The Unknown
cards.text:
If investigators resigned at Atlantic Express Depot:
Out of breath and nearly out of time, you catch the train as it screeches out of the station. An industry of darkness engulfs you, lit only by sparks ricocheting off the tunnel walls. Booker reclines in his chair, sifting through his pockets for a lighter. He flicks the ignition button. "Hell of a day to sober up."
(→R1)
If investigators resigned at Smuggler's Hideout:
"In all my time here, investigating nooks and crannies of the esteemed and the destitute, never have I seen this." Booker nods approvingly. "Don't know how you found it, but good job. Looks like Neptune's Bounty's up this way, we can catch the metro there." The aroma of cigarette smoke and charred rubble contend with boxes labelled "contraband" overflowing with household items, including holy bibles. It's the only thing righteous down here.
(→R2)

cards.flavor:
"The Great Will Not Be Constrained By The Small."
― Seen on a banner, outside Point Prometheus
cards.name: Bathysphere Station
cards.text: You can only perform the resign ability below if an investigator controls Ellen. [action]: Resign. "The bathysphere's this way!"

cards.flavor: A musty smell emanates from the derelict Bathysphere Station, its ceiling riddled with holes letting in waterfalls of water.
cards.name: Bathysphere Station

cards.flavor: "A flick of the wrist, a vortex of destruction!"
cards.name: Gravity Well
cards.text:
Uses (3 Eve).
[free] During your turn, exhaust Gravity Well and spend 1 eve: Move up to 2 clues from connecting locations to your location. Then, for the remainder of your turn, reduce the shroud value of your location by X, where X is the number of clues moved by this effect.

cards.name: Gates of R'lyeh
cards.text: You cannot flip this location except by the below ability. [free] If it is act 2a, spend 5 resources, as a group: Flip this location. (Group limit once per game.) [action]: Parley. You may take 2 additional actions during your turn, which can only be used on the True side.

cards.flavor: "There's always a lighthouse. There's always a man. There's always a city."
cards.name: The Lighthouse
cards.text:
You cannot flip this location.
[action] If it is act 3a - A Space Between Worlds, spend 3 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Replace an empty location with a set-aside [[Extradimensional]] location.

cards.flavor: "One thing I've learned: if you don't draw first, you don't get to draw at all."
cards.name: Booker DeWitt
cards.text:
You get +1 [combat] and +1 [intellect].
[reaction] When you would fail a skill test, exhaust Booker DeWitt and draw 1 card: You may commit that card to this skill test.

cards.flavor: The aura inside looms in stark contrast to anything you've seen before; be it in Rapture or Arkham.
cards.name: Little Wonders Educational Facility
cards.text: Forced - After you enter Little Wonders Educational Facility: Test [willpower] (3). If you fail, take 1 horror for each point you failed by. [free] Spend 1 [per_investigator] clues: Take control of the set-aside Damaged Doll story asset.

cards.flavor: "I had all of these visions before coming down here, of utopia. Every man with his hand on the Great Chain, the wheel of progress turning -- every cliché you can imagine. And what is the first thing that happens when I open up shop? Petty thievery."
cards.name: Business Sector
cards.text: Business Sector is connected to each revealed [[Market Street]] location.

cards.flavor: "...Parasite?" Quite the welcome for a newcomer. Seems this party wasn't accepting invitations. You need to find this DeWitt character, and fast. He'll have the answers. You hope.
cards.name: Behind Red Tape
cards.text: Forced - After you defeat a [[Syndicate]] enemy: Place 1 resource next to this act. Then, after 3 resources are placed, take control of the set-aside Missing Poster story asset. Objective - When you enter DeWitt Investigations, immediately advance.

cards.name: Memory Management
cards.text:
After a few, futile knocks you pry open the door and find an unconscious man sunken into a meager mahogany desk, gripping a bottle with the engraving: Old Tom Whiskey. Attempts to wake the inebriated man fall short. Discordant groans and mumbles is all that can be mustered. Memories are a fickle thing for drunkards, but this one seems especially amnesic. Perhaps something around here can force these memories to come flooding back.
Check your supplies. If an investigator has a crumpled poster, that investigator takes control of the set-aside Missing Poster story asset if they haven't already done so. If investigators are in control of the Damaged Doll, Lotto Voucher, and Missing Poster story assets, advance to Act 3b. Otherwise, advance to Act 3a.

cards.name: The Walls
cards.text: [free]: Move. Move to a revealed The Walls location. Big Daddies and [[Humanoid]] enemies cannot enter The Walls. When placed or spawned here, place Big Daddy investigators and [[Humanoid]] enemies on the nearest [[Facility]] location, instead.

cards.flavor: A funhouse of colors and steel line the inner-walls of Point Prometheus, granting access to the little ones via their art deco hidey-holes.
cards.name: The Walls
cards.text: The Walls is inaccessible to Big Daddies. Only Little Sister's at a connected [[Altered]] location may enter The Walls.

cards.name: Cell Block B
cards.text:
While Cell Block B is targeted by a [[Surveillance]] treachery, increase its shroud by 2.
[reaction] After you discover the last clue from Cell Block B: Look at the unrevealed side of a connecting [[Inner Persephone]] location.

cards.name: Cell Block B
cards.text: Cell Block B is under lock and key. You cannot enter Cell Block B unless you have escaped your cage. [action]: Move. Test [agility] (5). Reduce the difficulty of this test by 2 for each clue discovered this turn. If you succeed, remove the barrier at this location and move to Command Center.

cards.name: Command Center
cards.text: [free] Investigators in the Command Center spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Reveal a Prison Cell location. [action]: Parley. Test [combat] or [intellect] (4) to mess with the security camera. If you succeed, rotate an attached [[Surveillance]] treachery once clockwise. If you succeed by 2 or more, discard it.

cards.flavor: A slapdash assortment of wires, control systems, and surveillance monitors line the guard post walls.
cards.name: Command Center
cards.text: [action]: Move. Test [willpower] (1). This test gets +1 difficulty for each [[Prison]] location with clues on it. If you succeed, remove any barrier at this location and move to that connecting location.

cards.flavor: Amidst the crowd, a bevy of smugglers unfold a plan of death and destruction. In the name of Atlas, in the name of revolution.
cards.name: Civil Disobedience
cards.text: Forced - At the end of the mythos phase, if Atlas is in play: Choose an investigator to draw the top card attached to Civil Disobedience and resolve its revelation ability. Then, place it on the bottom of the attached deck. Forced - If each [[Center]] location has 2 horror tokens on it, immediately advance.

cards.name: A Grand Detonation!
cards.text: With enough time to organize his insurgents and rig the Grand Hall to blow, Atlas sprints out of the atrium to the sound of bombs bursting behind him. Let chaos reign! Proceed to (→R4).

cards.name: Costly Mistake
cards.text: Revelation - Attach Costly Mistake to the nearest location without a copy of Costly Mistake attached. As an additional cost to enter or leave attached location, investigators must spend 1 resource. [action]: Attach Costly Mistake to a connecting location.

cards.flavor: "Is it really you, Daddy? I missed you!"
cards.name: "Found You!"
cards.text: Revelation - Place Hide n' Seek next to the scenario reference card and remove "Found You!" from the game. If "Found You!" was drawn from the encounter deck, it gains surge.

cards.flavor: First DeWitt, now Tenenbaum. It seems the morally just of Rapture are confined to the shadows. Living in hovels, protecting the defenseless. But why?
cards.name: Search & Rescue
cards.text: Objective - At the end of the round, if each undefeated investigator is at the Elevator Shaft, and possess the requisite number of clues, they may advance. (Hint: You may want to please as many Little Sisters as you can along the way.)

cards.name: These Walls See All
cards.text:
With a discordant shrill, the elevator ascends; slow and tumultuous. It wobbles as the cables send sparks into the air, descending on the floor you now look down upon. Above, another you eagerly dread.
Remove the 4 [[Sanctum]] locations in play from the game (discarding all attachments, clues, tokens, and enemies). Then, draw the top 4 cards of the Orphanage deck and place them above, below, to the left, and to the right of Elevator Shaft, unrevealed side face-up. Set either Train Platform or Metro Station aside, out of play.
If any investigator has the [[Socialite]] trait, read the following:
In a brief moment of respite from the mechanical racket you fill the air as only you can. "Whew. Being in an elevator sure has its ups and downs." The cabin remained silent.
Take 1 direct horror.

cards.flavor: The elevator halts on the third and final floor with a disquieting thud. The doors hiss along the inlay. A faint sound of rushing water emanates from the lobby.
cards.name: Cabin Fever
cards.text: This agenda only flips by the forced effect below, not at the start of the mythos phase. Forced - At the end of the round, if each undefeated investigator is at Elevator Shaft, flip this agenda and place any excess doom on the scenario reference card (including those on player cards).

cards.name: Elevator Collapse!
cards.text: Revelation - Flip Elevator Shaft to its Broken side. Remove all other locations from the game, randomly placing the four [[Basement]] locations around Elevator Shaft. Spawn the ADAM Abomination enemy at a random location. Lose all of your clues.

cards.name: Herd Mentality
cards.text: Revelation - Place 2 doom on Sofia Lamb. Then, trigger her patrol keyword and forced effect X number of times, where X is either the amount of [[Devotee]] enemies in play or the amount of investigators in play (whichever is higher).

cards.flavor: "Scientists to the last -- what had they done that we would not have done in their place?"
cards.name: William Dyer
cards.text:
You get +1 [willpower].
[reaction] When a treachery would cause you to suffer, or add, an additional effect on a [[Sunken]] location, exhaust William Dyer: Ignore that effect.

cards.name: Hallway Vent
cards.text: [action]: Knock. Search the encounter deck and discard pile for an enemy and spawn it. Then, move the Little Sister mini-card attached to the nearest The Walls location to this location. Forced - After you defeat the spawned enemy: Reveal the Little Sister attached to Hallway Vent.

cards.name: Hallway Vent
cards.text: Forced - At the round of the round, each Big Daddy investigator at this location must discard one card beneath their investigator card. [free] If this location is [[Sunken]]: Move. Move to a connecting, [[Sunken]] location.

cards.name: No Earthly Possessions
cards.text: Revelation - Put No Earthly Possessions into play in your threat area. Forced - When you would draw a card, instead place 1 resource (from the token pool) on No Earthly Possessions. Forced - If there are a total of 3 resources on No Earthly Possessions, discard it.

cards.name: Cell Block A
cards.text:
While Cell Block A is targeted by a [[Surveillance]] treachery, increase its shroud by 2.
[reaction] After you discover the last clue from Cell Block A: Look at the unrevealed side of a connecting [[Inner Persephone]] location.

cards.name: Cell Block A
cards.text: Cell Block A is under lock and key. You cannot enter Cell Block A unless you have escaped your cage. [action]: Move. Test [combat] (5). Reduce the difficulty of this test by 2 for each clue discovered this turn. If you succeed, remove the barrier at this location and move to Command Center.

cards.name: Wild Hunt
cards.text: Revelation - Attach Wild Hunt to the nearest non-[[Elite]] enemy. If there is no enemy in play, search the encounter deck and discard pile for one and draw it, attaching Wild Hunt to it (shuffle the encounter deck). Forced - When attached enemy is defeated, instead heal all damage from it and discard Wild Hunt.

cards.flavor: The moment you step out onto the metal walkway, the sound of an alarm blares alongside a pattern of flashing red lights. Lamb's onto you. You need to get out.
cards.name: Code Red (v. II)
cards.text: You cannot move between locations with a barrier between them. Forced - At the end of your turn: Restore each barrier removed during your turn. Objective - If each undefeated investigator has resigned, immediately advance. (Hint: The scenario may not end here...)

cards.name: Ewe-Turn
cards.text:
"Oh. Now, now, now..." a voice echoes out from within your skull, "where do you think you're going?" Just then, you see a red light in the ocean dash out of view, behind the very elevator you're so precariously trapped in. A moment of quiet and then, an explosive force launches out back out the door you came, sending you reeling to the cold, hard floor. "Let us recommence," Lamb says. "The Family awaits."
Each investigator loses each of their clues. Remove each barrier from the game. Place clues on Cell Block A and Cell Block B until each has clues equal to its clue value. Put the set-aside Operating Room, Simulation Room, Larva Nests, and Playroom locations into play. Locate the four set-aside story assets and shuffle them, attaching one facedown to each of the above locations.

cards.flavor: I can't go on much longer...
cards.name: Vertiginous Aura
cards.text: Revelation - Test [agility] (2). This tests gets +1 difficulty for each [[Surveillance]] treachery targeting your location. If you fail, reduce Oxygen Deficit by 2 [per_investigator]. If you succeed, and control any [[ADAM]] assets, add 2 [per_investigator] instead.

cards.flavor: "Everyone's a crook of some kind or anotha'."
cards.name: Playboy Lackey
cards.text: Alert. [action] Spend 1 resource: Parley. Playboy Lackey disengages from you and gains Aloof until the end of your turn. [action] Spend 2 resources: Parley. Move Playboy Lackey once to a connecting location.

cards.flavor:
"A dreamer is one who can only find his way by moonlight, and his punishment is that he sees the dawn before the rest of the world."
-- Oscar Wilde
cards.name: ...Reality Mending
cards.text: [free] Spend X clues: Move X cards from one side to another. (Limit once per round.) Forced - After the last clue is discovered at a [[R'lyeh]] or [[Columbia]] location: Flip it over and remove each connecting barrier. Objective - At the end of the round, if each undefeated investigator is at The Lighthouse, you must immediately advance.

cards.name: Constants & Variables
cards.text:
"What's down is up, what's up is down. What's down is up, what's up is... what?" Tenenbaum, caught in her own loop, was the first to notice the door at the end of the endless staircase. Misshapen by her memories, having already forgotten DeWitt's fate, she rushed for the comfort of the handle and swung the door open madly. Without time to warn her, you closed your eyes and prayed.
As a group, choose an investigator to test [willpower] or [intellect] (4). If you succeed, search each deck (including the one attached to Cthulhu) for Brigid Tenenbaum. Any investigator may play her (at no cost). If you fail, search each deck for Brigid Tenenbaum and remove her from the game. Read Scenario Interlude: A Sea of Doors (page 65).

cards.flavor: If two competing kingpins weren't enough, Arcadia just had to go and throw a third, enigmatic force into the mix. Things capable of flickering in and out of existence, or a delusion brought on by the poison. Whatever the answer, it only detracts from the goal at hand.
cards.name: Saturnine Dreams
cards.text: Forced - After you fail a skill test while targeted by a [[Surveillance]] treachery: Add 1 resource token (from the resource pool) to that treachery. Forced - When an enemy would move via a keyword or card effect and cannot, they instead explore and move to the location drawn.

cards.name: Poison Oak
cards.text:
"Madness! This place is just madness." Booker says, his throat shriveling up from within. The poison has taken on new shapes, both inside of you and out. Your vision is blurry, your light is drawing thin. New colors emerge, colors indescribable. Like that of a horrific interstellar borealis. "We need to find the bathysphere," Booker urges, waving away vapours in front of his face. "I..., we, gotta get out of here."
Decrease Oxygen Deficit by 2 [per_investigator]. If any investigator has the [[Medic]] or [[Blessed]] trait, decrease it by 1 [per_investigator], instead. Add 1 resource token (from the token pool) to each [[Surveillance]] treachery in play.

cards.name: Grand Lobby
cards.text: [free] If this location is [[Sunken]]: Move. Move to a connecting, [[Sunken]] location. [action] Choose and discard 1 card attached to your investigator: Move up to 3 times, so long as each location you move to is [[Sunken]].

cards.name: Grand Lobby
cards.text: [free] If this location is [[Sunken]]: Move. Move to a connecting, [[Sunken]] location. [action] Choose and discard 1 card attached to your investigator: Move up to 3 times, so long as each location you move to is [[Sunken]].

cards.flavor: "Now look, I don't make the laws here, I just enforce them."
cards.name: Sullivan
cards.text:
Hunter. Retaliate.
Sullivan ignores [[Obstacle]] treacheries.
Sullivan cannot be attacked while another ready, [[Syndicate]] enemy is at his location.

cards.flavor: You're welcomed to Ryan's court to a barrage of gunfire careening down from the balcony above.
cards.name: Ryan's Court
cards.text: [free] Take 2 damage: Remove a token from any location in this court. (Group limit once per round).

cards.name: Ryan's Court
cards.text: Forced - After you fail a skill test at this location: Place 1 horror token on Andrew Ryan. [free] [[Miskatonic]], [[Police]], or [[Warden]] investigators at this location, take 2 horror: Either flip this location over or remove 2 horror tokens from Andrew Ryan. (Group limit once per round.)

cards.flavor: An avian monstrosity unlike anything you've seen before swoops in and around the observatory, its steel plating as intimidating as its movements are graceful. You must reach into this strange fantasy with its horrors all too real.
cards.name: Wings of the Warden
cards.text: Forced - At the end of the round: Remove all memories from each story asset in play.

cards.name: Ascension
cards.text:
Try as you might, the convergence of realities bore too great a fight. A morass of prison rooms, each with their own horrors, and a bird cage with its steel keeper intent on protecting its territory, muddled your mind, body, and soul to mush. In an effort to rid yourself of the present moment, you curled into the fetal position, a baby begging for its mother's womb. Instead, a kaleidoscope of brilliant, blue butterflies formed in the space above you, fluttering in unison, glistening off the tears from another reality and the tears streaming down Eleanor's face.
(→R2)

cards.flavor:
"'Would you kindly'... powerful phrase."
-- Andrew Ryan
cards.name: Trigger Phase
cards.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). If you fail, take 1 damage and 1 horror for each connecting location with clues on it. If you failed, and no damage and horror was taken by this effect, place 2 of your clues on your location.

cards.name: Metro Station
cards.text: Metro Station is connected to the location above it. [action]: Test [combat] or [agility] (4) to smash the leaking window. If you succeed, remember that you let the water flow. During Act 1a, each investigator may take an additional action during their turn, which can only be used to move. [free] If you are a [[Criminal]], take 1 horror to steal from the busker: Gain 3 resources. (Limit once per game.)

cards.flavor: Flickering lights reflect on waterlogged marble as cracked art deco pillars loom overhead. The sound of distorted jazz emits from a broken speaker, swooning no one in particular.
cards.name: Metro Station
Black Lake
cards.text: The first [[True]] encounter card drawn during the mythos phase by an investigator at this location gains surge. Black Lake gets +X shroud, where X is the highest [agility] value amongst investigators at this location. If you walked atop water, choose the lowest [agility] instead.

cards.name: Apollo Square
cards.text: [reaction] After you enter Apollo Square: Move 1 card from your True side to your Mirror side. Forced - After you fail a skill test while investigating Apollo Square: Move 1 card from your Mirror hand to your True hand.

cards.flavor:
"What is the soul? An ineffable spark of continuity, living within us, yet beyond us."
--- Sofia Lamb, Unity & Metamorphosis
cards.name: Drowned Memories
cards.text: Revelation - Attach Drowned Memories to either the current agenda or the current act. Limit 1 per agenda/act. Increase the difficulty to parley on [[Possession]] assets by 1.

cards.flavor: "I see angels, Mr. B!"
cards.name: Drawing Signs
cards.text: Revelation - Draw X cards from the encounter deck, where X is 1 + half the total number of [[Task]] treacheries next to the scenario reference card (rounded up). Then, place Drawing Signs next to the scenario reference card.

cards.name: Fleet Hall
cards.text:
Fleet Hall gets +1 shroud value for each [[Splicer]] enemy at this location and any connecting locations.
[reaction] After you successfully investigate Fleet Hall by 2 or more: Rotate the Spotlight once clockwise.

cards.flavor: The stage is a decaying relic, with frayed curtains and splintered seats staring blankly at a vacant spotlight.
cards.name: Fleet Hall
cards.text: The path leading to Fleet Hall is blocked. As an additional cost for you to enter Fleet Hall, investigators must spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group.

cards.name: Headhunter
cards.text: Permanent. Limit 1 per deck. You get +1 [willpower] and +1 [combat] for every 2 trophies on Headhunter. [reaction] Would you would defeat a non-[[Elite]] enemy without a trophy token on it: Heal all damage from it, engage it, and place 1 resource on it, as a trophy. Forced - After you defeat an enemy with a trophy token on it, place that trophy on Headhunter.

cards.name: Medical Expert
cards.text:
Permanent. Limit 1 per deck.
[reaction] After you heal damage and/or horror from an investigator or [[Ally]] asset at your location, place 1 charge or secret on an asset you control. (Limit once per round.)

cards.flavor: "Send yourself high into the air with a blast of water!"
cards.name: Geyser Trap
cards.text:
Uses (3 Eve).
[reaction] When you enter a [[Sunken]] location, exhaust Geyser Trap: Move again. You may then spend 1 eve to move a non-[[Elite]] enemy at either entered location to a connecting location.

cards.flavor: "Rapture's no place if you ain't got no scratch."
cards.name: Penniless & Spent
cards.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (8). Reduce the skill value of this test by X, where X is the amount of resources you have. If you fail, lose half your resources (rounded up).

cards.name: ADAM Abomination
cards.text: Hunter. ADAM Abomination gains X health, where X is the amount of doom on the scenario reference card. Forced - At the end of the round, if ADAM Abomination is at Elevator Shaft, add 1 clue (from the token pool) to Elevator Shaft.

cards.flavor: Deep in the bowels of Persephone, you panic, plead, and probe for a quick escape. Your wings flap madly.
cards.name: Bird in a Cage (v. II)
cards.text: Forced - After a [[Big Daddy]] spawns: Attach a random, set aside [[Mood]] treachery to it. [free] If you are at a Prison Cell location with no clues on it: Draw the bottom card attached to it. If it is an enemy, spawn it exhausted. If it is an [[Ally]], add it to that investigator's hand (and shuffle any set-aside copy into their deck). (Group limit three times per round.) Objective - After each [[Resident]] ally is revealed, you may advance.

cards.name: From one Cage to another
cards.text:
A sigh of relief mounts as you find your allies safe and sound. Their minds reeling as much as yours, you scramble to escape your frigid cage before Lamb catches on to your impromptu plan.
Each investigator loses each of their clues. Place 1 resource between each Command Center connection, as a barrier. (1 to Cell Block A, 1 to Cell Block B, and 1 to Security Checkpoint.) Each investigator tests X (1), where X is the skill indicated on the Parley action on their respective Prison Cell location. If you succeed, remember that you escaped your cage. If you fail, either take 1 damage, 1 horror, discard 1 card from your hand, or spend 1 resource, and perform the test again. (You must do this until you succeed.)

cards.name: Spawn of Zoth-Ommog
cards.text: True. Retaliate. Spawn - True side's [[Central]] location. Forced - When Spawn of Zoth-Ommog would take any amount of damage: Reduce that amount by X, where X is the amount of [[Columbia]] enemy-locations in play.

cards.name: Damage Overload
cards.text:
Check your supplies. If an investigator has a Repair Kit, read the following:
As the final abrasions tore through the vehicle's hull, you reached for the repair kit you've been lugging along this entire time. With the help of the crew, you restored the cabin to working order. For now.
Flip this card over and remove all damage from it. You may only read this section once.
Otherwise:
With the immense pressures thousands of feet underwater, it seemed almost inevitable that the bathysphere wouldn't last. With one final puncture, it imploded, sending you reeling out into the great expanse, as the pieces of the vehicle glided to their final resting place.
Remove Bathysphere from the game. Place each investigator in Bathysphere on the nearest [[Ruins]] location.

cards.name: Bathysphere
cards.text: While you are in this vehicle, ignore the bottom-most forced effect on the current agenda and the top movement restriction on all Abyssal Currents locations. Bathysphere may be assigned damage dealt to investigators at its location. [action]: Move Bathysphere to a connecting location. Forced - After Bathysphere is defeated: Flip it over.

cards.flavor: "Mind over matter."
cards.name: Telekinesis
cards.text:
Uses (3 Eve).
[action] Exhaust Telekinesis and spend 1 eve: Move up to 2 clues from your location to a connecting location with an enemy. Deal X damage to that enemy, where X is the amount of clues moved.

cards.flavor: "Warning: not all friendships are made to last!"
cards.name: Hypnotize
cards.text: Uses (3 Eve). [free]: Parley. Test [agility] (X). If you succeed, exhaust Hypnotize, spend 1 eve and add the evade value from an enemy at your location to all skill tests you perform this round (max +3). X is that enemy's evade value.

cards.flavor: "I'll exterminate all you damn alley rats!"
cards.name: Enraged Constable
cards.text: Prey - Highest [combat]. Hunter. Forced - After Enraged Constable is successfully attacked, he immediately attacks all other enemies, investigators, and [[Ally]] assets at his location.

cards.name: Civic Duty
cards.text: Revelation - Test [intellect] (2). For this skill test, you cannot commit cards or exhaust assets. If you fail, you must either lose X resources or take X damage and/or horror, or any combination thereof, where X is the amount of assets you control.

cards.name: Big Daddy Doll
cards.text: Fast. Cannot be discarded. You get +1 [agility]. [action]: Parley. Test [agility] (4). Reduce the difficulty of this test by 2 for each other [[Possession]] asset in play with a memory on it. If you succeed, place a resource on Big Daddy Doll, as a memory.

cards.name: Tidal Erosion
cards.text: Revelation - Attach to the nearest location without a copy of Tidal Erosion attached. Forced - After you fail an attack or evasion attempt while at the attached location: Place 1 of your clues on your location. If you cannot, take 1 damage, instead. If attached location is [[Sunken]], it gets +1 shroud.

cards.flavor: Got any ADAM on ya?"
cards.name: Thuggish Splicer
cards.text: Retaliate. Elusive. Forced - When Thuggish Splicer attacks: Attach an [[Item]] asset you control to him. If you cannot, attach 2 random cards from your hand, instead. Forced - When Thuggish Splicer is defeated: Return all attached cards to their investigator's hand.

cards.flavor: Pockets of global elite gather, toasting to a city known only to the depths. Free spirits; bubbling and intoxicated. The roar of laughter spills out of the atrium, trapped by insulated windows withstanding magnitudes of immense water pressure. Inside, however, there’s only comfort. Somewhere in this crowd you expect to find one Booker DeWitt. But where?
cards.name: Life Of The Party
cards.text: Objective - Only investigators at a location connected to Market Street may spend the requisite number of clues, as a group, to advance.

cards.name: Into The Unknown
cards.text:
During your search you discovered advertisements for a DeWitt Investigations, printed in strewn-about newspapers and crudely stapled to bulletin boards. They all point to an address on Market Street, a location outside of the confines of the banquet. Taking your chances, you step beyond the proverbial red tape. Moments later, a screech blares out over the speaker system with that all-too familiar voice. "Citizens of Rapture, we have a parasite in our midst." The fierce bravado chills you. The voice carries on. "Please report any suspicious activity to security. The parasite is a leech that must be exterminated."
The blockade has been avoided. Reveal Market Street. Shuffle the set-aside Ryan Security encounter set into the encounter deck if you haven't already done so. Shuffle the 5 set-aside Business Sector locations, and randomly put each into play unrevealed.

cards.name: Little Sisters Educational Facility
cards.text: Forced - At the end of the round, each Little Sister investigator at this location must discard one card beneath their investigator card. [reaction] After you defeat at enemy while at Little Sisters Educational Facility: Either play a non-[[Item]] or [[Ally]] card (at no cost) or attach a card to your investigator (at no cost).

cards.name: Little Sisters Educational Facility
cards.text: [action]: Test [willpower] (2). If you succeed, place 1 resource (from the token pool) on Little Sisters Educational Facility. For each resource on Little Sisters Educational Facility, lower the difficulty to perform any tests on Optimized Eugenics by 2. Forced - If Little Sisters Educational Facility is flipped over, remove all resource tokens on this card.

cards.flavor: With the help of a strange, spliced-up artist, Ryan's henchmen have dispersed for the time being. Unbound and ungagged, you begin the perhaps futile attempt at breaking out of the iron grip locking Fort Frolic down. Something this virtuoso seems keen on happening too.
cards.name: Art of Freedom (v. II)
cards.text: Objective - After the three "inner ring" locations are revealed, immediately advance.

cards.name: Master Manipulator
cards.text:
"Why lookie here, little moth." The man's skittish behavior has had you perpetually on edge, as if at any moment he might snap. "The breadcrumbs! They've left them for us to snack on." Cohen's bony arm reaches through the latticed metal gate, seemingly unconcerned with the electric current riding through him, producing a rudimentary mechanical object. "It's an MKS!" DeWitt interjects. You shake your head confused. "A master key system. It's used to change area-wide access in prisons. Unlock some doors while locking down others." "Ooh ooh, a game," Cohen says bemusingly, "how fun!"
Draw the set-aside The Master Key story card and resolve its text. Shuffle both copies of the set aside Eternal Captivity treachery into the encounter deck.

cards.name: The Atrium
cards.text:
The Atrium is connected to each "inner ring" location, and vice versa, and gets -1 shroud for each revealed location connected to it.
[action]: Put The Rabbit Mask into play under the control of another investigator at this location. Only investigators with The Rabbit Mask may trigger this ability. (Limit once per game).

cards.flavor: The atrium’s vibrant colors fade in the dim light. Artifacts of joy lie scattered, lost in the darkness.
cards.name: The Atrium
cards.text: The Atrium is connected to each "inner ring" location, and vice versa, and gets -1 shroud for each revealed location connected to it.

cards.name: Brain Rot
cards.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3), then [willpower] (2), then [willpower] (1). For each of these skill tests you fail, take 1 damage or 1 horror. Card effects or abilities cannot alter your base skill value for this test.

cards.flavor: "Evade your enemies with a burst of speed!"
cards.name: Aero Dash
cards.text: Uses (3 Eve). [action] Exhaust Aero Dash and spend 1 eve: Evade. Automatically evade a non-[[Elite]] enemy. Then, you may move to a connecting location.

cards.name: Medical Pavilion Ruins
cards.text: Forced - After you enter Medical Pavilion Ruins, if you did so by moving through 2 or more [[Ocean]] locations: Take 2 damage. [reaction] When investigating Medical Pavilion Ruins, increase its shroud by X: If you succeed, heal X horror (max 3). (Group limit once per round.)

cards.flavor: Surgical lights flicker and die beneath the murky water, casting shadows over rusted operating tables. Bloodied scalpels drift aimlessly, while faded posters promise an unachievable beauty - now and then.
cards.name: Medical Pavilion Ruins

cards.flavor:
You are battered and bruised, bloodied and brutalized. The hope of finding Annabelle here seems lost. All that matters now is escaping with your life.
In this dimly-lit limbo, the black waters that were once still now ebb and flow in response to the crashing cabin.
cards.name: No Refunds, No Returns
cards.text: Forced - After you resign: Return all clues you control to the token pool. Objective - If each undefeated investigator has resigned, advance.

cards.name: Blasted Elevator
cards.text:
You look down at your chest at a large scar bleeding across your heart. Wounded, but alive, you clamber out of the elevator shaft and seek answers someplace else. As you walk through the lobby, the circus tune chirping ever-so irritatingly in the waiting area, a voice laced in a thick Russian accent whispers from the second floor balcony. "Did you come for me?" The voice asks, weary and frightful. "My name is Brigid Tenenbaum. You aren't with Fontaine... are you?" After exchanging cautionary pleasantries, recounting your story of how you came to Rapture, and for what purpose, Tenenbaum agrees to help guide you to the potential whereabouts of Annabelle Peaslee.
(→R2)

cards.name: Search & Destroy
cards.text: Revelation - Attach to the nearest location with clues on it. Limit 1 per location. The attached location cannot be investigated. Forced - After you successfully investigate another location: Discard Search & Destroy.

cards.flavor: Risque objects float in the water as a filthy aroma of perfume, liquor, and sweat fills the room.
cards.name: Eve's Garden
cards.text:
[free] Take 1 damage: Move to The Atrium.
[action]: Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, attach a [[Pact]] treachery in your hand or under your control to Sander Cohen.

cards.flavor: Here lies a frozen tomb of decadence, where boutiques and lifeless mannequins stand in eerie silence.
cards.name: Poseidon Plaza
cards.text: The path leading to Poseidon Plaza is blocked. As an additional cost for you to enter Poseidon Plaza, investigators must spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group.

cards.flavor: "Constable! The thief's thataway."
cards.name: Guards!
cards.text: Revelation - If there are no [[Syndicate]] enemies in play, Guards! gains surge. Otherwise, move the nearest [[Syndicate]] enemy in play once towards you. If they are engaged, or would become engaged, test [agility] (3). For each point you fail by, lose 1 resource or place 1 clue on your location.

cards.name: Vending Expert
cards.text:
Permanent. Limit 1 per deck.
Your assets with "Uses (supplies)" enter play with 1 additional supply on them.

cards.flavor:
"I am not a liberator. Liberators do not exist. These people will liberate themselves."
-- Atlas
cards.name: Break the Chain
cards.text: Revelation - Test [combat] (6). This test gets -1 difficulty for each [[Center]] location with a horror token on it. If you fail, place 1 horror token on Atlas.

cards.name: The Bedrock Banquet
cards.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -1 for each [[Syndicate]] enemy in play.
[cultist]: -1. Reveal another token. If you fail, take 1 horror.
[elder_thing]: -X. X is the number of locations away from your starting location that you are.

cards.name: The Bedrock Banquet
cards.text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -1 for each [[Syndicate]] enemy in play. If you fail, the enemy with the most damage heals 1 damage.
[cultist]: -2. Reveal another token. If you fail, take 1 damage and 1 horror.
[elder_thing]: -X, where X is the number of locations away from your starting location that you are. Reveal another token.

cards.name: Prison Cell
cards.text: Clues on Prison Cell cannot be discovered except by the below ability [action]: Parley. Test [agility] (2) to pick the lock. If you succeed, discover a clue at this location. If you fail, you may discard 1 card from your hand to to reduce this test's difficulty by 1 for the remainder of your turn.

cards.flavor:
"I bet against Andy Ryan's vision o' harmony in Rapture -- offered him a quiet place to send anybody who wasn't workin' out. And now I'm sittin' on my own private think tank."
-- Augustus Sinclair
cards.name: Prison Cell
cards.text: Prison Cell is under lock and key. You cannot enter Prison Cell.

cards.name: The Lazarus Vector
cards.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -2. If you fail, decrease Oxygen Deficit by 1 [per_investigator].
[tablet]: Reveal another token. If you fail, the nearest enemy moves once towards your location.
[elder_thing]: -1 for each [[Surveillance]] treachery in play.

cards.name: The Lazarus Vector
cards.text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -3. If you fail, decrease Oxygen Deficit by 1 [per_investigator].
[tablet]: -1. Reveal another token. If you fail, the nearest enemy moves once towards your location.
[elder_thing]: -2 for each [[Surveillance]] treachery in play.

cards.name: March Hare / Black Dream
cards.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -1 (-3 instead if there is a treachery in your hand or threat area).
[cultist]: -1 for each location away from a [[Central]] location you are.
[tablet]: -2. If you fail, and a [[Surveillance]] treachery is in play, rotate it once.
[elder_thing]: -2. If you fail, discard 1 asset you control.

cards.name: March Hare / Black Dream
cards.text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -2 (-4 instead if there is a treachery in your hand or threat area).
[cultist]: -2 for each location away from a [[Central]] location you are.
[tablet]: -3. If a [[Surveillance]] treachery is in play, rotate it once.
[elder_thing]: -3. If you fail, discard 1 asset you control and 1 asset from your hand.

cards.flavor: "They keep crawling out of the woodwork!"
cards.name: Splicer Swarm
cards.text: Spawn - Farthest location from you. Hunter. Swarming 2. Forced - When Splicer Swarm attacks: Discard X cards from the top of your deck, where X is the number of [[Splicer]] enemies at this location (including swarm cards).

cards.name: Adonis Luxury Resort Ruins
cards.text: Forced - After you enter Adonis Luxury Resort Ruins, if you did so by moving through 2 or more [[Ocean]] locations: Take 2 damage. [reaction]: After you successfully investigate Adonis Luxury Resort Ruins: Heal X damage, where X is the amount you succeeded by (max 3). (Group limit once per round.)

cards.flavor: Grand staircases crumble beneath drifting sand, while chandeliers sway gently in the current. Ornate hallways, once filled with laughter, now echo only suffocating whispers.
cards.name: Adonis Luxury Resort Ruins

cards.flavor:
"Investigations into Matters Both Public & Private"
-- Sign on the front door
cards.name: DeWitt Investigations
cards.text: [action]: Investigate. If you succeed, instead of discovering clues, place a resource token on any other [[Market Street]] location. For each token placed by this effect, reduce that location's shroud value by 1.

cards.flavor: "I had all of these visions before coming down here, of utopia. Every man with his hand on the Great Chain, the wheel of progress turning -- every cliché you can imagine. And what is the first thing that happens when I open up shop? Petty thievery."
cards.name: Business Sector
cards.text: Business Sector is connected to each revealed [[Market Street]] location.

cards.name: Optimized Eugenics
cards.text: Forced - At the end of the round, each Little Sister investigator at this location must discard one card beneath their investigator card. [action]: Test [combat] (9). If you succeed, remember that you found the Big Daddy antidote.

cards.flavor: "Mr. Bubbles, Mr. Bubbles, are you there? Are you there? Come and give me lollies, come and bring me toffees. Teddy bears… teddy bears."
cards.name: Optimized Eugenics
cards.text: [free] Spend 2 [per_investigator] clues: Either play a non-[[Item]] or [[Ally]] card (at no cost) or attach a card to your investigator (at no cost). (Limit once per round.)

cards.name: Spawn of Ghatanothoa
cards.text:
True. Retaliate. Hunter. Swarming 2.
Spawn of Ghatanothoa gets +X fight, where X is the amount of swarm cards under Spawn of Ghatanothoa.
[reaction] After the Spawn of Ghatanothoa swarm attacks you, add 1 swarm card to Spawn of Ghatanothoa: Cancel all attacks.

cards.name: Baby Jane
cards.text: Hunter. Elusive. Forced - After Baby Jane engages or attacks you: Attach a random card from your hand to her. Baby Jane gets +1 fight and +1 evade for each card attached to her. Forced - When Baby Jane is defeated: Return all attached cards to their investigator's hand.

cards.flavor: "Trick the security system!"
cards.name: Security Bullseye
cards.text:
Uses (3 Eve).
[reaction] When a [[Surveillance]] treachery would target an investigator at any location, exhaust Security Bullseye and spend 1 eve: Cancel that target.

cards.name: The Color Beckons
cards.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). If you fail, either place 1 doom on an asset you control, or 2 doom on an enemy in play with full health. If you can do neither, place 1 doom on the current agenda. This can cause the current agenda to advance.

cards.flavor: Undecided patrons look on at the three figureheads, postulating on their future in this failing city.
cards.name: The People's Court
cards.text:
While at this location, you get +2 skill value while performing a skill test on a [[Scheme]] treachery.
[action][action]: Remove a token from any location in this court. (Group limit once per round).

cards.name: The People's Court
cards.text:
As an additional cost for you to enter this location, test [agility] (2). If you fail, either cancel the effects of the move or spend an additional action.
[free] [[Chosen]], [[Civic]], or [[Socialite]] investigators at this location, lose 4 resources: Either flip this location over or remove 2 tokens from any [[Elite]] enemy in play. (Group limit once per round.)

cards.name: Basement
cards.text: [action]: Test [willpower] (3) to decipher the elevator's mechanical box. If you succeed, place 1 resource (from the token pool) next to Elevator Shaft. (Group limit one success per game.) Forced - If you kept the water at bay, reduce the difficulty of the above skill test by 1. Otherwise, if you let the water flow, increase it by 1 instead.

cards.flavor:
"Stronger arm and sharper brain - that's why the future is Fontaine!"
- Fontaine Futuristics Jingle
cards.name: Basement

cards.flavor: Inhuman wails echo down from the rafters like a cacophony from the bowels of Hell.
cards.name: Atlas' Court
cards.text: [free]: Draw the top card of the encounter deck: Remove a token from any location in this court. (Group limit once per round).

cards.name: Atlas' Court
cards.text: Forced - After you fail a skill test at this location: Place 1 horror token on Atlas. [free] [[Criminal]], [[Believer]], or [[Performer]] investigators at this location, search the discard pile for an enemy and draw it: Either flip this location over or remove 2 horror tokens from Atlas. (Group limit once per round.)

cards.flavor: "When in doubt - Scout it out!"
cards.name: Scout
cards.text: Uses (3 Eve). [action] Exhaust Scout and spend 1 eve: Move. Move to a connecting location. Then, an investigator at your current or previous location may draw 1 card (2 instead if there is an enemy at your current location).

cards.flavor: A sprawling antechamber with nowhere to hide.
cards.name: Arcadia Glens
cards.text:
[action][action]: Increase Oxygen Deficit by 2 [per_investigator]. (Group limit once per round.)
If you are targeted by a [[Surveillance]] treachery while at Arcadia Glens, take 1 damage, 1 horror, and decrease Oxygen Deficit by 2 [per_investigator].

cards.name: Rolling Hills
cards.text: Forced - At the end of the round, if a [[Surveillance]] treachery is targeting this location, take 1 damage, which can only be assigned to you or an [[Ally]] asset. Each investigator who has a blossom from a rose gains: Ignore the forced ability above.

cards.flavor: "Nothing clears a room like swarms of stinging bees."
cards.name: Insect Swarm
cards.text:
Uses (3 Eve).
[reaction] When a non-[[Elite]] enemy would spawn engaged with you, exhaust Insect Swarm and spend X eve: Spawn that enemy X locations away.

cards.flavor:
"I'm introducing lot 44 now. We've codenamed Lot 44 "Enrage" because of its tendency to."
-- Yi Suchong
cards.name: Enraged
cards.text: Attached enemy gets +1 [per_investigator] health. Forced - After the attached enemy flips over: Flip Enraged over. If it is defeated, remove Enraged from the game.

cards.name: Docile
cards.text: [reaction] After you leave this location: Test [agility] (3). If you succeed, move the attached enemy to your location. If you fail, flip the attached enemy over. Any investigator at this location may perform this test. Forced - After the attached enemy flips over: Flip Enraged over.

cards.flavor: "Why can't I go home? I wanna go home!"
cards.name: Catatonic State
cards.text: Surge. Revelation - Flip each [[Facility]] location so that its [[Abandoned]] side is face-up.

cards.name: Audio Diary
cards.text: Fast. Cannot be discarded. You get +1 [intellect]. [action]: Parley. Test [intellect] (4). Reduce the difficulty of this test by 2 for each other [[Possession]] asset in play with a memory on it. If you succeed, place a resource on Audio Diary, as a memory.

cards.name: Songbird
cards.text: Massive. Forced - When targeted, Songbird attacks the targeted investigator. Forced - After Songbird rotates, move clues on the targeted location to Songbird (to a maximum of 4). [reaction] After you deal damage to Songbird, move one clue on Songbird to any location.

cards.name: Saturnine Disciple
cards.text: Hunter. Elusive. Spawn - Farthest location from you. If tie, choose a [[Sunken]] location, if able. While Saturnine Disciple is moving, each [[Sunken]] location is connected to one another. When Saturnine Disciple leaves a [[Sunken]] location, place 1 doom on Saturnine Disciple.

cards.name: Social Contagion
cards.text: Revelation - Put Social Contagion into play in your threat area. Forced - At the end of the round, each investigator at your location takes 1 damage and 1 horror. You can spend X resources to ignore X instances of this effect. [action][action]: Discard Social Contagion.

cards.name: Medical Pavilion Ruins
cards.text: Forced - After you enter Medical Pavilion Ruins, if you did so by moving through 2 or more [[Ocean]] locations: Take 2 damage. [reaction] When investigating Medical Pavilion Ruins, increase its shroud by X: If you succeed, heal X damage (max 3). (Group limit once per round.)

cards.flavor: Surgical lights flicker and die beneath the murky water, casting shadows over rusted operating tables. Bloodied scalpels drift aimlessly, while faded posters promise an unachievable beauty - now and then.
cards.name: Medical Pavilion Ruins

cards.flavor: While Ryan still rules Rapture with an iron fist, his grip on the Great Chain has been steadily slipping away. As Atlas' riffraff and Lamb's flock close in, it is here and now where the fate of Rapture is decided.
cards.name: Justice Served
cards.text: [reaction] If there is 1 investigator in the game, after you discover the last clue at your location: Move. (Limit once per round.) Forced - At the end of the round, if there is doom or a horror token on a location: Flip it to its [[Controlled]] side. Only doom on this card counts towards this agenda's doom threshold.

cards.name: An Abomination Rises From The Depths!
cards.text: With a deafening roar, a many-tentacled beast shatters through the Grand Hall's opulent stained glass windows, sending thousands of poor unfortunate souls - yours included - into the depths below. Proceed to (→R6).

cards.name: Siliceous Ooze
cards.text: Revelation - Put Siliceous Ooze into play in your threat area if there is no copy of it in your threat area. Otherwise, this card gains surge. Forced - When you would draw a card that matches the title of a card in your hand or play area: Discard both copies of that card. [action][action]: Discard Siliceous Ooze.

cards.flavor: "It's luring me... that beautiful, bobbing light."
cards.name: Anglerfish
cards.text: Spawn - Nearest empty [[Ocean]] location. Hunter. Anglerfish cannot enter [[Ruins]] locations. Each investigator at a connecting location gets -2 skill value while fighting or investigating.

cards.name: The Walls
cards.text: [free]: Move. Move to a revealed The Walls location. Big Daddies and [[Humanoid]] enemies cannot enter The Walls. When placed or spawned here, place Big Daddy investigators and [[Humanoid]] enemies on the nearest [[Facility]] location, instead.

cards.flavor: A funhouse of colors and steel line the inner-walls of Point Prometheus, granting access to the little ones via their art deco hidey-holes.
cards.name: The Walls
cards.text: The Walls is inaccessible to Big Daddies. Only Little Sister's at a connected [[Altered]] location may enter The Walls.

cards.flavor: Throngs of guests dressed to the nine's mill about the hotel's gaudy statues.
cards.name: Andalusian Arms
cards.text: Forced - After you fail a skill test while investigating Andalusian Arms: Discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until a [[Syndicate]] enemy is revealed and draw it.

cards.flavor: "I had all of these visions before coming down here, of utopia. Every man with his hand on the Great Chain, the wheel of progress turning -- every cliché you can imagine. And what is the first thing that happens when I open up shop? Petty thievery."
cards.name: Business Sector
cards.text: Business Sector is connected to each revealed [[Market Street]] location.

cards.name: Hide n' Seek
cards.text: Revelation - Shuffle the set aside "Found You!" treachery into the encounter deck, along with the encounter discard pile. [free] Spend 1 [per_investigator] resources: Discard X cards from the top of the encounter deck, where X is 1 + the number of cards in the Little Sisters deck. Forced - If "Found You!" is discarded via the above ability, resolve its revelation ability instead.

cards.flavor:
"This little Sea Slug has come along and glued together all the crazy ideas I've had since the war..."
-- Brigid Tenenbaum
cards.name: Sea Slug
cards.text: [reaction] After Sea Slug enters play: Place 1 eve on each [[Plasmid]] asset at your location.

cards.back_flavor:
Massive. Armored. Environmental diving suit repurposed for combat and labor; rusted, dented, but functional. Cognitive function minimal. Limited autonomy outside assigned task. Primary directive: protect ADAM-induced youth variant ("Little Sister"). Imprinting absolute; any perceived threat met with immediate, overwhelming force. Behavior outside protection duty minimal. No curiosity. Exists solely to guard, repair, and kill.
Conclusion: Protector unit highly effective. Conditioning irreversible. Ethical concerns irrelevant. Program success.
--- Excerpt from the lab notes of one Dr. Yi Suchong
cards.back_text: Deck Size: What it used to be, when you were human. Deckbuilding Options: Big Daddy's can't build decks. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Do you remember...?
cards.name: Big Daddy
cards.text: You begin the game with Drill in play, and cannot play [[Item]] or [[Ally]] assets. You get +1 skill value for each matching icon on cards attached to Big Daddy. [action]: Attach a card to Big Daddy (paying its cost). Then, draw 1 card. [elder_sign] +2. You may attach a card to Big Daddy (paying its cost).

cards.flavor: Three floors of banisters enclose the entire orphanage in a dense, concrete bubble. There's nary a peep, as if even those dwelling here prefer to hide in the walls.
cards.name: Derelict Care
cards.text: This agenda only flips by the forced effect below, not at the start of the mythos phase. Forced - When you would advance the current act, before doing so, check the doom threshold. If it has been reached, flip this agenda and place any excess doom on the scenario reference card (including those on player cards). Otherwise, do not.

cards.name: Elevator Collapse!
cards.text: Revelation - Flip Elevator Shaft to its Broken side. Remove all other locations from the game, randomly placing the four [[Basement]] locations around Elevator Shaft. Spawn the ADAM Abomination enemy at a random location. Lose all of your clues. Advance to agenda 3a and act 5a.

cards.name: A Man Chooses
cards.text:
