Beyond the threshold, a city of iron and glass clings stubbornly to the ocean floor, its neon glow flickering like a dying star. Statues of Andrew Ryan loom over the drowned avenues, his voice — calm, resolute — still whispering through crackling speakers, extolling the virtues of a broken dream. The streets are empty but for shadows that scuttle between the wreckage, the last remnants of a paradise built upon the bones of men.
- Spawn the set-aside Enraged Constable enemy at The Lighthouse. - Place 1 set-aside [skull] token on the current act. Then, if the act has 3 matching symbols, you may perform the resign ability below. - Flip this card back over.
[free]: Resign. You step through the door. Do not flip over this card. It is not considered empty.

cards.name: Sea of Doors
cards.text: [action]: Test [willpower] (6). Reduce the difficulty of this skill test by X, where X is the number of [[Extradimensional]] locations without clues on them. If you succeed, flip this card over.

cards.name: Clever Inventor
cards.text:
Permanent. Limit 1 per deck.
[reaction] After you play an [[Insight]] event: Reduce the resource cost of the next [[Tool]] or [[Science]] card you play this round by 2.

cards.flavor: As the crowd gathers, packing themselves like sardines around the atrium, Ryan has dispatched his henchmen to lock the Grand Hall - and all of Rapture - down.
cards.name: Lockdown Protocols
cards.text: Forced - At the end of the mythos phase, if Andrew Ryan is in play: Choose an investigator to draw the top card attached to Lockdown Protocols and resolve its revelation ability. Then, place it on the bottom of the attached deck. Forced - If each [[Left]] location and [[Right]] location has a horror token on it, immediately advance.

cards.name: A Sanctuary Turned Prison!
cards.text: Ordering his henchmen around like a leader with clenched fists, Andrew Ryan successfully locks down the Grand Hall, forever oppressing all under his tyrannical rule. Proceed to (→R3).

cards.name: Hallway Vent
cards.text: [action]: Knock. Search the encounter deck and discard pile for an enemy and spawn it. Then, move the Little Sister mini-card attached to the nearest The Walls location to this location. Forced - After you defeat the spawned enemy: Reveal the Little Sister attached to Hallway Vent.

cards.name: Hallway Vent
cards.text: Forced - At the round of the round, each Big Daddy investigator at this location must discard one card beneath their investigator card. [free] If this location is [[Sunken]]: Move. Move to a connecting, [[Sunken]] location.

cards.flavor: "I've never known a problem that can't be solved with the right kind of party."
cards.name: "A Toast!"
cards.text: Revelation - You must either (choose one): - Lose 1 action and 1 resource. - Remember that you gained the ire of the gala's elite.

cards.flavor: Time is running out. This motley mafia knows these streets, these shops, these people. You feel as though you're trapped as the walls close in. A vast ocean exists around you. There's no one - but all these delirious folk - for thousands of miles. You need to get out of here undetected, or at least unharmed. Courtesies won't last long.
cards.name: The Goon Squad
cards.text: Forced - At the end of the round: Move each unengaged [[Syndicate]] enemy one location towards the nearest [[Leader]] enemy.

cards.name: The Goon Squad
cards.text:
You do all you can to blend in, but eventually, Sullivan and his riffraff catch you. The sight is not pleasant. Rapture's citizens laugh jovially as the handcuffs come out, smiling gleefully at a "parasite" being apprehended. You even hear faint cheers coming from the back. Held up by two large bodyguards, your feet dragging along the marble stone, a sense of shame overwhelms you, as you're carried, by force, to parts unknown.
(→R3)
Each investigator who gained the ire of the gala's elite suffers 1 mental trauma.

cards.flavor: "Excuse me, pardon me, coming through."
cards.name: Raucous Crowds
cards.text: Revelation - Attach to the nearest location without a copy of Raucous Crowds attached. Each [[Syndicate]] enemy disengages from each investigator at this location. Investigators at this location may not discover clues, attack enemies, or resign. [[Syndicate]] enemies at this location may not engage investigators. [action]: Parley. Test [combat] (2) or [agility] (2). If you succeed, move Raucous Crowds to a connecting location.

cards.flavor:
"I have seen lost civilizations, none so cruel as this."
-- Professor Emeritus William Dyer
cards.name: Fink Manufacturing
cards.text: [reaction] After you discover a clue from The Great Pyramid: Reduce the shroud value of Fink Manufacturing by 2 for the remainder of your turn. If you beheld the Great Chain, reduce it by 3 instead.

cards.name: The Grand Hall
cards.text: The Grand Hall gets +2 shroud if C T H U L H U is targeting it. [reaction] After you enter The Grand Hall: Move 2 cards from either your True side to your Mirror side, or vice versa.

cards.name: Simulation Room
cards.text:
Simulation Room gets +[per_investigator] shroud. Reduce the shroud of Simulation Room by X, where X is the amount of clues on it.
[reaction] After you discover any amount of clues from Simulation Room: Place 1 resource on it, as a vision.
[free] If Simulation Room has 2 visions: Reveal the attached story asset and add it to any investigator's hand.

cards.flavor:
"We put our eldest Sister through a new regimen of physical and mental conditioning, and suited her up with modified Protector equipment of my design. The younger ones have dubbed her a "Big Sister.""
--- Gilbert Alexander
cards.name: Simulation Room
Prison Cell
cards.text: Clues on Prison Cell cannot be discovered except by the below ability. [action]: Parley. Test [intellect] (2) to analyze the situation. If you succeed, discover a clue at this location. If you fail, you may spend 1 resource to reduce this test's difficulty by 1 for the remainder of your turn.

cards.flavor:
"I bet against Andy Ryan's vision o' harmony in Rapture -- offered him a quiet place to send anybody who wasn't workin' out. And now I'm sittin' on my own private think tank."
-- Augustus Sinclair
cards.name: Prison Cell
cards.text: Prison Cell is under lock and key. You cannot enter Prison Cell.

cards.flavor: The barnacle-encrusted exterior of Persephone sits on the precipice of a fathomless trench, providing prisoners with no means of escape.
cards.name: Gates of Persephone
cards.text: Gates of Persephone gets -1 shroud for each clue on it. [action]: Resign. "This is our way in!"

cards.flavor:
"Utopia shouldn't have much use for a political prison, now, should it?"
― Augustus Sinclair
cards.name: Gates of Persephone
Fontaine Futuristics Ruins
cards.text: Forced - After you enter Fontaine Futuristics Ruins, if you did so by moving through 2 or more [[Ocean]] locations: Take 2 damage. [reaction] After you deal damage to an enemy at your location or a connecting location: Heal that much horror (max 3). (Group limit once per round.)

cards.flavor: Rusting assembly lines sit motionless, their plasmid vats cracked and leaking glowing residue into the water. Faded propaganda posters peel from the walls, promises of a brighter future swallowed by the deep.
cards.name: Fontaine Futuristics Ruins
Shantytown
cards.text: The first [[Mirror]] encounter card drawn during the mythos phase by an investigator at this location gains surge. Shantytown gets +X shroud, where X is the highest [combat] value amongst investigators at this location. If you contemplated utopia, choose the lowest [combat] instead.

cards.name: Apollo Square
cards.text:
[reaction] After you enter Apollo Square: Move 1 card from either your True side to your Mirror side, or vice versa.
[reaction] After you succeed at a skill test while investigating Apollo Square: Move 1 card from your True hand to your Mirror hand.

cards.flavor: Though Cohen is playing the part of ruse, Ryan's henchmen aren't letting you off easy. Any and all hidden cargo has been confiscated, leaving you with little opportunity to find a way out that doesn't involve brute force.
cards.name: Lock, Stock, and Barrel (v. II)
cards.text: Forced - After a non-weakness treachery attaches to Sander Cohen: Place him at The Atrium. Then, if there are 1 [per_investigator] non-weakness treacheries attached to Sander Cohen, flip him over.

cards.name: Invasion of Privacy
cards.text:
The game of cat and mouse within Fort Frolic's walls continue, as Cohen's deranged patrons and Ryan's bumbling lackeys do everything in their power to prevent you from escaping. And to make matters worse, a guttural groan just rattled down the corridor.
Spawn a random, set aside [[Big Daddy]] enemy at the location farthest from all investigators, and attach a random, set aside [[Mood]] treachery to it.
Check your supplies. If an investigator has a Holy Bible, that investigator must silently read the following:
Amidst all your belongings, the distracted goons were unable to find your bible. You find a secluded nook to pray, using the words to center you as inspiration comes rushing in.
You may attach your copy of Eminent Domain to Sander Cohen. If you do, each other investigator must move one asset or event on the left of their copy of Eminent Domain to the right. If you don't, draw 2 cards.

cards.flavor: The branches... they took root in us all.
cards.name: Branching Calcification
cards.text: Peril. Revelation - As a group, lose X actions, where X is the number of doom on enemies in play. You must decide which investigators lose actions (spread out however you like).

cards.flavor:
Sludge seeps down from concrete pillars holding 
the city aloft.
cards.name: Crash Site
cards.text: Forced - When your turn begins, if you are at this location: Reveal a random token from the chaos bag. If you reveal a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail], take 1 horror.

cards.flavor: An illuminated cavern fills an empty void underneath Rapture's towering edifices. Sea slugs never seen by outsiders wander aimlessly, glowing with a deep and powerful blue hue.
cards.name: Crash Site
Drill
cards.text: Drill cannot leave play. [action]: Fight. Fight with [combat] or [agility]. Instead of its standard damage, this attack deals X damage, where X is the amount you succeeded by. If you fail, either exhaust Drill or discard a card attached to Big Daddy.

cards.name: Electric Malfunction
cards.text: Revelation - Attach Electric Malfunction to the location with the most clues. Limit 1 per location. To investigate attached location, you must use [agility] instead of the skill indicated by the investigation attempt. If attached location is [[Sunken]], take 1 damage or 1 horror if you fail an investigation. [action][action]: Discard Electric Malfunction.

cards.flavor: As the currents roar, jet streams shooting off in a myriad of directions, you need to seek safety in the crumbling remains of Rapture while also seeking entrance into the forbidden facility below.
cards.name: Beneath the Waves (v. I)
cards.text: Forced - While not in a vehicle, as an additional cost to move up or down, spend X actions, where X is the row you will be moving from (max 3). Forced - At the start of the round: Perform a shifting test.

cards.name: Gameplans
cards.text:
As you fight through the surging currents and erratic jet streams, it feels, despite your efforts, that progress is futile. The closer you get to the trench, the harder reality fights back. The ruins of Rapture aren't just falling around you, they're shifting. As if to block passage through the gut of this ever-narrowing ravine. "This water," Dyer pondered in fits of breathes, "it's not natural. Something's controlling it, moving us this way and that. We have to find the source. It'll be the key towards getting us down there. "Nonsense," Tenenbaum rebuked. "There won't be a key. They'll be a trap."
If you are a [[Believer]], [[Clairvoyant]] or [[Sorcerer]], you may perform a shifting test, choosing the [[Ruins]] location, rather than selecting one at random (max once per game).

cards.flavor: "A man chooses. A slave obeys."
cards.name: Andrew Ryan
cards.text: Aloof. Elusive. Patrol (nearest [[Left]] or [[Right]] location with no horror token on it). Forced - At the end of the enemy phase, if Andrew Ryan is ready, has a horror token on him, and is at a [[Left]] or [[Right]] location: Place that token on his current location.

cards.flavor: Despite your mental capacity reduced to cinders, Annabelle's illuminated eyes fill you with hope and wonder. With the little one by your side, it's finally time to head home. All that's left between you and salvation are some flooding halls and the antidote.
cards.name: Finding Yourself
cards.text: Forced - When a Big Daddy enters a location, flip it to its [[Abandoned]] side. When a Little Sister enters a location, flip it to its [[Altered]] side. Objective - If the investigators found the "Big Daddy antidote" and the "Little Sister antidote," immediately advance.

cards.name: Alive and... Well?
cards.text:
As if directed by an unseen force, you discovered the antidotes exactly where they've always been; next to the diving suit assembly line and stuffed inside a glowing teddy bear. A swig is all it took to reverse the strengthening effects of your psychosis, snapping you out of whatever twisted reverie you found yourself in.
Heal all damage and horror from your investigator. Remove all versions of Drill and Syringe from the game. Replace each Big Daddy and Little Sister with each players' true investigator. Add all attached player cards to each investigator's hand, then take X direct damage and/or horror, where X is the amount of cards added to your hand. If this would cause you to be defeated, reduce the damage and/or horror until you have exactly 1 health and/or sanity remaining.

cards.flavor: "Y'ha-nthlei, n’ghat, sh'lith v'khul."
cards.name: Star-Spawn of C T H U L H U
cards.text: Forced - When targeted, Star-Spawn of C T H U L H U attacks the targeted investigator. Then, that investigator tests [willpower] (3). For each point you fail by, shuffle the top card of your True deck into the deck attached to C T H U L H U.

cards.flavor: "N’ghath, v’tharn, y’thir sh'ghul."
cards.name: Star-Spawn of C T H U L H U
cards.text: Forced - When targeted, Star-Spawn of C T H U L H U attacks the targeted investigator. Then, that investigator tests [willpower] (3). For each point you fail by, shuffle the top card of your Mirror deck into the deck attached to C T H U L H U.

cards.name: A Tattered Tear
cards.text: Revelation - Attach A Tattered Tear to your Mirror location. Investigators cannot trigger [action], [reaction], or [free] actions or abilities on this location or connecting locations (excluding the [action] below). [action]: Test [willpower] or [intellect] (4): If you succeed, discard A Tattered Tear.

cards.flavor: "Daddy's mad, and you'll be sorry!"
cards.name: The Bouncer
cards.text: Prey - Bearer of Eyes of the Protector. Retaliate. Hunter. The Bouncer gains +X fight and +X evade, where X is the total number of resource tokens on [[Task]] treacheries in play.

cards.name: Wrath Of The Deep Ones
cards.text: Revelation - Take X horror, where X is the amount of [[ADAM]] assets you control (including permanents). If you took 1 or fewer horror by this effect, shuffle Wrath Of The Deep Ones back into your deck.

cards.flavor: Murmurings from within sects of assembly-goers is drowned out by the discourse of the three leaders.
cards.name: The People's Court
cards.text:
While at this location, you get +2 skill value while performing a skill test on a [[Scheme]] treachery.
[action][action]: Remove a token from any location in this court. (Group limit once per round).

cards.name: The People's Court
cards.text:
As an additional cost for you to enter this location, test [agility] (2). If you fail, either cancel the effects of the move or spend an additional action.
[free] [[Chosen]], [[Civic]], or [[Socialite]] investigators at this location, lose two actions: Either flip this location over or remove 2 tokens from any [[Elite]] enemy in play. (Group limit once per round.)

cards.flavor: "Don't be a softie -- use Armored Shell now!"
cards.name: Armored Shell
cards.text:
Permanent. Limit 1 per deck.
[reaction] After a [[Plasmid]] asset enters play: Place a health or sanity token on it.
You get +1 maximum health for each damage token and +1 maximum sanity for each horror token on a [[Plasmid]] asset you control.

cards.name: Deep One Skimmer
cards.text: Spawn - Farthest [[Ocean]] location. Hunter. Alert. Retaliate. Forced - After Deep One Skimmer moves via its hunter keyword, if it is unengaged: Resolve its hunter keyword again. (Limit once per round.) Forced - After Deep One Skimmer engages you: Move to the nearest [[Ocean]] location.

cards.name: The Master Key
cards.text: Create a separate bag consisting of the following tokens: +1, 0, -1, and -2. This is the lockdown bag, and these are lockdown tokens. They are not chaos tokens. Some abilities will instruct the players to make a lockdown test. A lockdown test may cause locations to move. When locations move, all investigators, enemies, tokens, and attachments at that location remain at that location, but move with it. To resolve a lockdown test, the lead investigator must first reveal a random lockdown token from the lockdown bag, and resolve the effects for that token as indicated on the other side of this card. Then, if there are any lockdown tokens on locations, resolve the effects of those tokens as indicated on the other side of this card. After resolving all effects, return all tokens to the lockdown bag. Flip this card over and place it next to the scenario reference card.

cards.name: Lockdown Procedures
cards.text: Hard / Expert

cards.flavor: The one window to the outside illuminates an otherwise drab room of faded furniture and wood panelling.
cards.name: Living Room
cards.text: Forced - Living Room gains X shroud, where X is the number of [[Task]] treacheries in your threat area. Each [[Warden]] investigator gains: Ignore the forced ability above.

cards.flavor:
"The Little Sister's Orphanage: In troubled times, give your little girl the life that she deserves. Boarding and education free of charge! After all, children ARE the future of Rapture."
― Public Address Advertisement
cards.name: Little Sister's Orphanage

cards.flavor: Though quiet here, you hear the roar of patrons echoing through the nearby hallway.
cards.name: Bathysphere Station
cards.text: [action]: Investigate. If you are successful, instead of discovering clues, play an asset from your hand at -X resource cost, where X is the amount you succeeded by (Limit once per round).

cards.flavor: Decidedly cramped and ill-fitting for such a dramatic city, the Bathysphere Station hosts a quaint reception area welcoming guests to their new forever home.
cards.name: Bathysphere Station

cards.flavor: "Turn every room into… a Peepshow!"
cards.name: Peeping Tom
cards.text:
Uses (3 Eve).
[free] Exhaust Peeping Tom and spend 1 eve: Look at the top 3 cards of any player's deck. Then, add 1 card to your hand and discard the other 2, gaining X resources, where X is the highest resource cost discarded (max 5).

cards.name: Atlantic Express Depot
cards.text: [action] Spend 2 resources: Resign. You purchase tickets and board the train setting course for Apollo Square. Each [[Drifter]] investigator gains: [action]: Resign. You hitch a ride the ol' fashioned way; for free.

cards.flavor: Though still used by those travelling to popular destinations, the rust and confinement of the Atlantic Express makes it apparent the train line has seen        better days.
cards.name: Atlantic Express Depot

cards.flavor: "In today's genetic wonderland, you probably feel like there's never enough EVE at hand. With EVE Saver, your EVE will go farther than ever before!"
cards.name: Eve Saver
cards.text:
Permanent. Limit 1 per deck.
[free] Take 1 damage and 1 horror: Place 2 eve on any [[Plasmid]] asset that has 0 eve tokens remaining.

cards.flavor: Illuminated by flickering lights, creaking and rattling in position, the elevator looks functional. Barely.
cards.name: Elevator Shaft
cards.text: [action]: Test [intellect] (3) to disable the security. If you succeed, discard a [[Surveillance]] treachery attached to Elevator Shaft.

cards.name: Elevator Shaft
cards.text: Elevator Shaft gets -3 shroud for each resource next to it. [action]: Resign. You can only resign if there are no clues on Elevator Shaft. Clues on Elevator Shaft may only be discovered via successful investigation attempts at Elevator Shaft.

cards.name: Ritual Gone Wrong
cards.text: Revelation - Put Ritual Gone Wrong into play in your threat area. You cannot cancel or ignore card effects or game effects, and must resolve the negative effects of failing a treachery twice. [action]: Discard 1 random card under your control (attached to your investigator, if able). Then, discard Ritual Gone Wrong.

cards.flavor: Langford's sure the ingredients necessary to devise a formula to save Arcadia can be found if we just search for them. She calls it the Lazarus Vector. The elements are all but foreign to you. All that you do know is that the time's ticking.
cards.name: Rosa Gallica
cards.text: Objective - If the investigators found a "rose blossom," "vial of chlorophyll," "distilled water," and "honeybee spit," immediately advance.

cards.name: Clear Skies
cards.text:
"That should do it!" While assembling her concoction, Langford makes a mad dash to her office. You stare, eyes bleary and watering, as she evaporates into the mist. Moments later, the once-green spray falling across Arcadia turns into the most relieving translucent liquid. "That's it, you see it!" Langford's voice echoes out from the intercom system. "Now go, get the little one outta here! I got work to do."
Remove Julie Langford from the game. Remove all [[Surveillance]] treacheries from the game (including those in the encounter deck and discard pile), and increase Oxygen Deficit by 2 [per_investigator]. Remember that the investigators saved Arcadia.

cards.flavor:
"Rapture's Daughter, Eleanor, shall be our vessel, in her we shall be reborn!"
― Father Wales
cards.name: Zealotry
cards.text: Revelation - Test [intellect] (2). Increase the difficulty of this test by 1 for each [[Devotee]] enemy in play. If you fail, flip the 2 clues nearest to you to their doom side. Doom flipped by this effect can be discovered as if it were a clue.

cards.flavor: A voice rings out in your head. The calming sound of a therapist trying to quell your concerns.
cards.name: Lamb's Court
cards.text: [free] Discard 2 assets from your hand: Remove a token from any location in this court. (Group limit once per round).

cards.name: Lamb's Court
cards.text: Forced - After you fail a skill test at this location: Place 2 doom on Sofia Lamb. [free] [[Artist]], [[Assistant]], or [[Silver Twilight]] investigators at this location, discard 2 skills from your hand: Either flip this location over or remove 4 doom from Sofia Lamb. (Group limit once per round.)

cards.name: Opiate of the Masses
cards.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -1 (-3 instead if you are at a [[Controlled]] location).
[cultist]: -2. If you fail, draw the top card attached to the Conversion Therapy agenda.
[tablet]: -2. If you fail, draw the top card attached to the Lockdown Protocols agenda.
[elder_thing]: -2. If you fail, draw the top card attached to the Civil Disobedience agenda.

cards.name: Opiate of the Masses
cards.text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -2 (-4 instead if you are at a [[Controlled]] location).
[cultist]: -4. If you fail, draw the top card attached to the Conversion Therapy agenda.
[tablet]: -4. If you fail, draw the top card attached to the Lockdown Protocols agenda.
[elder_thing]: -4 If you fail, draw the top card attached to the Civil Disobedience agenda.

cards.flavor: "The water... I'm becoming one with the water..."
cards.name: Grasp of the Deep
cards.text: Revelation - Put Grasp of the Deep into play in your threat area. Forced - After you enter a [[Sunken]] location: Take 1 damage or 1 horror. [action][action]: Discard Grasp of the Deep.

cards.name: All Are One
cards.text:
Beyond the door, Rapture stands eerily intact, its steel bones untouched by war or ruin. The people move in slow, dreamlike procession, their eyes vacant, their lips murmuring prayers to a cause long since hollowed out. Pale blue butterflies drift through the damp air, perching on shoulders and outstretched hands — silent witnesses to a city where all are one, and none are truly alive.
- Spawn the set-aside Blue Morpho enemy at any empty location, with clues if able. - Place 1 set-aside [cultist] token on the current act. Then, if the act has 3 matching symbols, you may perform the resign ability below. - Flip this card back over.
[free]: Resign. You step through the door. Do not flip over this card. It is not considered empty.

cards.name: Sea of Doors
cards.text: [action]: Test [combat] (6). Reduce the difficulty of this skill test by X, where X is the number of [[Extradimensional]] locations without clues on them. If you succeed, flip this card over.

cards.name: Gasping for Air
cards.text:
Check your supplies. If you have a Repair Kit, read the following:
You knew the repair kit you've been lugging along this entire time would come in handy. In quick work and with quick hands, you seal the abrasions tearing through the diving suit, restoring it to the acceptable condition it came in. For now.
Flip this card over and remove all damage from it. You may only read this section once.
Otherwise:
The pressures this deep underwater proved too challenging for this cheap diving suit to bear. First went the outer lining, and then the boots. Before long, the faceplate itself was torn asunder.
Remove Diving Suit from the game. Place your investigator on the nearest [[Ruins]] location.

cards.name: Diving Suit
cards.text: Diving Suit can be assigned direct damage and/or horror dealt to you. [reaction] When moving up or down, deal 1 damage and 1 horror to Diving Suit: Reduce the action cost by 1 (to a minimum of 1). Forced - After Diving Suit is defeated: Flip it over.

cards.flavor: Cracks in Arcadia's abandoned corridors have led to rooms lost to the depths.
cards.name: Sunken Dead End
cards.text: Sunken Dead End is only connected to the location an investigator or enemy explored from. Forced - After you enter Sunken Dead End: End your turn. Then, decrease Oxygen Deficit by 1 [per_investigator].

cards.name: Dead End
cards.text: Dead End is only connected to the Rolling Hills location an investigator explored from. Forced - After you enter Dead End: End your turn. Each [[Agency]] or [[Wayfarer]] investigator gains: Ignore the forced ability above and take an immediate action at no cost.

cards.flavor:
"A record of something vast, something waiting, something inevitable."
 -- Professor Emeritus William Dyer
cards.name: Hall of Carvings
cards.text: Hall of Carvings gets +X shroud, where X is the highest [intellect] value amongst investigators at this location. If you witnessed time unfurling, choose the lowest [intellect] instead.

cards.name: Fort Frolic
cards.text: [reaction] After you enter Fort Frolic: Move 1 card from your True side to your Mirror side. Forced - After you fail a skill test while investigating Fort Frolic: Move 1 card from the top of your Mirror deck to the top of your True deck.

cards.flavor: With the way out torn asunder via that stalking Big Sister, these hidden rooms that lay deeper in the heart of Persephone may be your only retreat. Perhaps Lamb's girl's around here somewhere.
cards.name: In Search of the Baby Lamb (v. I)
cards.text: [free]: Move 1 clue from one location to a connecting location. (Limit once per phase.) Objective - After Eleanor Lamb is revealed, immediately advance.

cards.name: The Headless Lambwoman
cards.text:
It was only a matter of time before that machine outside caught wind of your whereabouts in the inner-workings of Persephone. The red light beamed directly through a nearby window, intensifying with luminance as it saw you. Rather than burst through the window, it dashed out of sight. For a moment, the room was quiet. Then a loud crash emanated from down the hall as footsteps rushed wildly in your direction. You readied your weapon as the thing rounded the corner. "Wait! Don't shoot!" Tenenbaum cried. "It's her!"
Read Scenario Interlude: Lamb's Calling (page 48).

cards.flavor: "Hide yourself in plain sight. Turn invisible to the naked eye!"
cards.name: Houdini
cards.text:
Uses (3 Eve).
[reaction] When you draw an encounter card or a [[Surveillance]] treachery would target you, exhaust Houdini and spend 1 eve: Choose another investigator. That investigator is considered to have drawn that card. If the treachery has the [[Surveillance]] trait, ignore the effects of the treachery instead.

cards.flavor: With a newfangled doohickey in your possession, it's time for you to become the maestro of this maze. You need to find a way to rid yourself of Ryan's clutches.
cards.name: Behind Closed Doors (v. II)
cards.text: [reaction] After you succeed at a skill test by 2 or more: Draw a random token from the lockdown bag and place it on any [[Lower Level]] location. (Group limit twice per round.) Forced - At the end of the round: Perform a lockdown test. Objective - If each undefeated investigator has resigned, advance.

cards.name: Out of the Cage
cards.text:
If Sander Cohen is alive:
Through a melodramatic whimper, Cohen's voice echoes throughout Fort Frolic. "My... my... WILD BUNNY'S leaving me?!" As sirens blare, and the final barricade recoils up and into the ceiling, you make a mad dash for the train station, hoping to be forever rid of Ryan's rule and Cohen's lunacy.
(→R1)
If Sander Cohen is defeated:
As sirens blare, and the final barricade recoils up and into the ceiling, you make a mad dash for the train station, hoping to be forever rid of Ryan's rule and Cohen's lunacy.
(→R1)

cards.name: Recursive Reflexivity
cards.text: Revelation - Test [agility] (6). This test gets -1 difficulty for each [[ADAM]] asset in your hand and play area (including permanents). For each point you fail by, remove 1 eve from among assets you control. For each one you cannot, discard 1 card from your hand.

cards.name: Security Bot
cards.text: Bonded (Security Camera). Hunter. Prey - Targeted investigator. Forced - When Security Bot (Flying Rocketeer) attacks you: Discard an asset from your hand. If you cannot, it deals +1 horror. Forced - After Security Bot is defeated: Set it aside, out of play.

cards.flavor: Somewhere on these upper levels you hope to find an exit. The man's vitriol is reaching its breaking point. It's clear the play is coming to a crescendo.
cards.name: Like a Moth to the Flame  (v. I)
cards.text: [action] If you are at a [[Lower Level]] location, discard 2 cards at random from your hand: Swap your current location with another on the same "ring." (Group limit once per round). Objective - If each undefeated investigator has resigned, advance.

cards.name: Shattering the Looking Glass
cards.text:
If Sander Cohen is alive:
After a tumultuous time in Fort Frolic's many-roomed maze, you finally find your way out. Whilst looking for a train line to take you far away, a now-somber voice rings out over the speakers. "Well, I'll be. The little moth turned into the most beautiful butterfly." Cohen's voice now suddenly serene. "Fly away, my little moth. Fly, fly away..."
(→R1)
If Sander Cohen is defeated:
Breaking out through Poseidon Plaza, you breathe a sigh of relief. Rid of that madman, you seek a path to elsewhere in Rapture, knowing the chances of finding another like Cohen are slim. But not none.
(→R1)

cards.name: Abyssal Currents
cards.text: You cannot enter Abyssal Currents from the location to its left. Forced - After you enter Abyssal Currents, but before enemies here engage you, if the location to the left is a [[Ruins]] or [[Left]] location: Immediately move to that location.

cards.name: Abyssal Currents
cards.text: You cannot enter Abyssal Currents from the location to its right. Forced - After you enter Abyssal Currents, but before enemies here engage you, if the location to the right is a [[Ruins]] or [[Right]] location: Immediately move to that location.

cards.name: Shock Emitter
cards.text: Revelation - Attach Shock Emitter to your location Treat the printed text box of each [[Firearm]], [[Tool]], or [[Science]] asset you control as if it were blank. [action]: Parley. Test [agility] (2) to deactivate the device. If you succeed, discard Shock Emitter. If attached location is [[Sunken]], the above ability requires one additional action to complete.

cards.name: Adonis Luxury Resort Ruins
cards.text: Forced - After you enter Adonis Luxury Resort Ruins, if you did so by moving through 2 or more [[Ocean]] locations: Take 2 damage. [reaction]: After you successfully investigate Adonis Luxury Resort Ruins: Heal X horror, where X is the amount you succeeded by (max 3). (Group limit once per round.)

cards.flavor: Grand staircases crumble beneath drifting sand, while chandeliers sway gently in the current. Ornate hallways, once filled with laughter, now echo only suffocating whispers.
cards.name: Adonis Luxury Resort Ruins
Prison Cell
cards.text: Clues on Prison Cell cannot be discovered except by the below ability. [action]: Parley. Test [combat] (2) to break the door down. If you succeed, discover a clue at this location. If you fail, you may take 1 damage to reduce this test's difficulty by 1 for the remainder of your turn.

cards.flavor:
"I bet against Andy Ryan's vision o' harmony in Rapture -- offered him a quiet place to send anybody who wasn't workin' out. And now I'm sittin' on my own private think tank."
-- Augustus Sinclair
cards.name: Prison Cell
cards.text: Prison Cell is under lock and key. You cannot enter Prison Cell.

cards.flavor: Somewhere in the fog you hope to find the botanist; Julie Langford. Her office must be near. There, you can deactivate the defoliation system. Hopefully before someone else beats you to it.
cards.name: Saint Lazarus
cards.text: [action] If you are at a [[Rolling Hills]] location: Explore. Draw the bottom card of the exploration deck. If it is a connecting location, put it into play and move to it. Objective - If each undefeated investigator is in Langford's Office, investigators may spend the requisite number of clues, as a group, to advance.

cards.name: Saving Grace
cards.text:
By now, violence has erupted across the arboretum, seeping blood into its artificial soil. After stumbling over stones, sticks, and corpses, you happen to stumble upon a set of double doors, resting on them to catch your breathe. Just then, you fall backwards as the doors swing open behind you with force, closing just as swiftly. Tenenbaum looks down at you, relieved. Before you even hit your head on the hardwood floor, the botanist has already begun to speak, through fits of coughing and anger. "The pieces are gone, Ryan rigged it all! Damnit!" Langford paces her room, struggling to stand upright. "The Lazarus Vector, it's our one hope to survive." She rushes to a dormant console awaiting input. "Help me out, will ya! I can stabilize the flowrate. It should buy us some time."
Spawn the set-aside Julie Langford story asset at Langford's Office. Read Scenario Interlude: A Dire Predicament (page 20) in the Campaign Guide.

cards.flavor: You emerge from the bathysphere, confused and awe-struck. A damp odor resides over extravagant regalia draped from the rafters. A foreboding, perpetual darkness looms outside, as a whale song rattles the structure to its core. Though the patrons seem welcoming at first, the guards on patrol feel much less so.
cards.name: Uncharted Waters
cards.text: Each [[Syndicate]] enemy gains Aloof. Forced - If an investigator deals damage to a [[Syndicate]] enemy: Immediately advance.

cards.name: Spilled Blood or Side Eyes
cards.text:
If the investigators forced the agenda to advance:
What was once a pleasant, albeit discomforting gala has quickly turned into pandemonium. Blood spills as the topside intruders wage war on a party not meant for them.
Search the encounter deck for a [[Syndicate]] enemy and spawn it engaged with the lead investigator. Shuffle the set-aside Ryan Security encounter set into the encounter deck if you have not already done so.
Otherwise:
Patrons have begun noticing your presence, looking over their shoulder, talking behind your back. For now, they observe. The judgemental air rich and haughty. Chatter yammers on as the liquor starts to overflow, yet no one seems all that helpful. It seems as though finding this Mr. DeWitt will lie solely on your detective work.

cards.name: Chain of Command
cards.text: Revelation - Trigger Andrew Ryan's patrol keyword and forced effect, then put Chain of Command into play in the center of the map. Forced - After a horror token is placed on Atlas: Place 1 horror token on Andrew Ryan, exhaust Atlas, and place this card on the bottom of the deck attached to Lockdown Protocols.

cards.flavor: You come to almost immediately. Purely for survival. For a roar so deafening echoes through a basement you didn't know existed. Something big has awoken.
cards.name: Abomination Of Desolation
cards.text: Each [[Agency]] or [[Hunter]] investigator may play a [[Weapon]] asset from their hand, at no cost. (Limit once per game per investigator.)

cards.name: Sunken Remains
cards.text:
The last thing you heard was the guttural moans of the beast that bellowed like the horns at the gates to Hell. Now, you sit at the station, reclining against a lamppost with makeshift bandages covering your exposed midriff. DeWitt and Tenenbaum attend to your wounds as a few gawkers look on with morbid curiosity. "You ain't lookin' too hot kiddo," Booker says, nursing a wound of his own. Blood is strewn across the landing. "You're one to talk," Tenenbaum mutters. "We've got to get out of here, the men'll be here any minute. Ryan's or Fontaine's, it doesn't matter."
- If the lead investigator is in control of Ellen: (→R1). - Otherwise: (→R2).

cards.flavor:
"Would you kindly lower that weapon for a moment?"
-- Atlas
cards.name: "Would you kindly?"
cards.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (2). Increase the difficulty of this test by 2 if you are targeted by a [[Surveillance]] card. If you fail, you must either discard a [[Weapon]] asset you control or take 1 damage or 1 horror for each point you failed by.

cards.name: The Curtain Falls
cards.text:
The air hums with the discordant swell of a distant orchestra, golden floodlights bathing a grand, ruined theater, its velvet curtains swaying though there is no breeze. A single figure waits at center stage, arms outstretched, his painted grin splitting too wide. "Ah, my little moth! You've come at last!" Cohen coos, gliding forward, with a porcelain Rabbit Mask in each trembling hand.
- The lead investigator must take control of the set-aside Rabbit Mask treachery. For the remainder of this scenario, each investigator is considered to have this card in their threat area. - Place 1 set-aside [elder_thing] token on the current act. Then, if the act has 3 matching symbols, you may perform the resign ability below. - Flip this card back over.
[free]: Resign. You step through the door. Do not flip over this card. It is not considered empty.

cards.name: Sea of Doors
cards.text: [action]: Test [combat] (6). Reduce the difficulty of this skill test by X, where X is the number of [[Extradimensional]] locations without clues on them. If you succeed, flip this card over.

cards.name: Sir Prize
cards.text: [free] Take 1 damage: Move to The Atrium. [action]: Resign. You escape through a collapsed wall. You cannot resign while a non-weakness treachery is in your hand or under your control. While there are no clues on Sir Prize, reduce the shroud value of each [[Upper Level]] location by 3.

cards.flavor: Here lies a frozen tomb of decadence, where boutiques and lifeless mannequins stand in eerie silence.
cards.name: Poseidon Plaza
cards.text: The path leading to Poseidon Plaza is blocked. As an additional cost for you to enter Poseidon Plaza, investigators must spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group.

cards.name: Golf Club
cards.text: Forced - When Golf Club enters play, choose how many hand slots it takes up. [action] Exhaust Golf Club: Fight. Add your [agility] value to your skill value for this test. This attack deals +1 damage. If you succeed, automatically evade the attacked enemy. If Golf Club takes up 2 hand slots, this attack may target a non-[[Elite]] enemy at a connecting location.

cards.name: The Sky Burns
cards.text:
The sky is alight with fire. Towering zeppelins drift through the clouds, their golden cherubs grinning as they rain destruction upon the grounds below. The skyline of New York City is broken, its streets choked with flame and falling embers, while the distant echoes of a triumphant hymn carry over the screams. High above, Columbia soars untouchable, its banners snapping in the wind, a kingdom of heaven built upon the ashes of the world.
- Spawn the set-aside Siren enemy at The Lighthouse. - Place 1 set-aside [cultist] token on the current act. Then, if the act has 3 matching symbols, you may perform the resign ability below. - Flip this card back over.
[free]: Resign. You step through the door. Do not flip over this card. It is not considered empty.

cards.name: Sea of Doors
cards.text: [action]: Test [willpower] (6). Reduce the difficulty of this skill test by X, where X is the number of [[Extradimensional]] locations without clues on them. If you succeed, flip this card over.

cards.name: Dionysus Park Ruins
cards.text: Forced - After you enter Dionysus Park Ruins, if you did so by moving through 2 or more [[Ocean]] locations: Take 2 damage. [action][action]: Heal 3 damage. (Group limit once per round.)

cards.flavor: Flooded galleries lie in eerie silence, their murals peeling beneath drifting schools of fish. Bent carousel horses loom in the murk, awaiting passengers who will never come.
cards.name: Dionysus Park Ruins
Basement
cards.text: [action]: Test [combat] (3) to clear the debris surrounding the elevator cabin. If you succeed, place 1 resource (from the token pool) next to Elevator Shaft. (Group limit one success per game.) Forced - If you kept the water at bay, reduce the difficulty of the above skill test by 1. Otherwise, if you let the water flow, increase it by 1 instead.

cards.flavor:
"Stronger arm and sharper brain - that's why the future is Fontaine!"
- Fontaine Futuristics Jingle
cards.name: Basement
The People's Court
cards.text: [action]: Check your supplies. If you have a walkie-talkie, search your deck for an [[Ally]] asset and draw it. (Limit once per game). [action]: Test [agility] (4). If you succeed, remove a token placed on Lamb's Court ([[Center]]).

cards.name: The People's Court
cards.text:
As an additional cost for you to exit this location, test [agility] (2). If you fail, either cancel the effects of the move or lose 2 resources.
[free] [[Chosen]], [[Civic]], or [[Socialite]] investigators at this location, discard two assets you control: Either flip this location over or remove 2 tokens from any [[Elite]] enemy in play. (Group limit once per round.)

cards.name: Thälassárïth
cards.text: Massive. Patrol (end of current row). Instead of moving once during the enemy phase, Thälassárïth moves to the end of its current row. Forced - When targeted, Thälassárïth attacks the targeted investigator. Forced - After Thälassárïth leaves an [[Ocean]] location: Flip that location over.

cards.name: Thälassárïth
cards.text: Patrol (end of current row). Instead of moving once during the enemy phase, Thälassárïth moves to the end of its current row. Forced - When targeted, Thälassárïth attacks the targeted investigator. Forced - After Thälassárïth leaves an [[Ocean]] location: Flip that location over.

cards.flavor: Something lurks in the water's below Rapture, in the abyssal shadows it hunts. Professor Dyer theorizes that whatever it is, it's there to protect R'lyeh by guarding the entrance to its fathomless trench. You have no choice but to try and pass it.
cards.name: Into the Maw (v. I)
cards.text: Forced - At the end of your turn, if you are at an Abyssal Currents location: Take 1 direct horror.

cards.name: A Scourge Awakens
cards.text:
For a scant few minutes, as you frantically searched the ruins below Rapture, you felt as if whatever lurked beneath the rubble wouldn't surface. A fool's belief to have, given the viridian hue emanating from deep within the trench illuminating more vividly with each move you made. As if by a divine force, you, Dyer, DeWitt, and Tenenbaum all instinctively raised your hands to your ears, cupping them in preparation of something. And that something did not take long to manifest. A deafening shriek rattled your cage and your core. It pierced your innards, making stew of your senses. Scanning the darkness, you still saw nothing. Until. A shadow. Deep below.
Spawn the set-aside Thälassárïth enemy at the bottom-right location with its [[Surveillance]] arrows pointing left, and shuffle both copies of Deep One Offspring and all 3 copies of The Tide Turns into the encounter deck.

cards.flavor: Your body shivers and convulses thanks to Persephone's inhospitable surroundings. This penal colony welcomes no one. It is the coffin of Rapture, the resting grounds for the maniacal many whose influences stem not from the lofty ambitions of the city's leaders, but rather the cravings of what lies deep, deep, deep below.
cards.name: Mother's Keeper (v. II)
cards.text: Forced - At the end of the round: Place clues on each Prison Cell location until it has clues equal to its clue value.

cards.flavor: For The Family, it will protect.
cards.name: Big Sister
cards.text: Spawn - Security Checkpoint. Alert. Hunter. Forced - When Big Sister is defeated: Instead of discarding it, heal all damage from it, disengage it from all investigators, and exhaust it. It does not ready during the upkeep phase this round.

cards.flavor: From down here, the sun is but a dying star.
cards.name: Abyssal Plain
cards.text: Revelation - If you do not have an asset with Uses on it, Abyssal Plain gains surge. Otherwise, test [willpower] (3). For each point you fail by, remove a Use from an asset you control. If you fail and are at a [[Sunken]] location, discard an asset from your hand as well.

cards.name: Blue Morpho
cards.text: Spawn - Any empty location. Hunter. Blue Morpho gets +1 fight and +1 evade for each doom on its location, and any connecting locations. Forced - After Blue Morpho moves via its hunter keyword: Flip 1 clue nearest to it to its doom side. Doom flipped by this effect can be discovered as if it were a clue.

cards.name: Big Game Hunter
cards.text:
Permanent. Limit 1 per deck.
You deal +1 damage on attacks against enemies with the massive keyword or [[Elite]] trait.

cards.name: The Lighthouse
cards.text: You cannot flip this location except by the below ability. [free] Spend 5 resources, as a group: Flip this location. (Group limit once per game.) [action]: Parley. You may take 2 additional actions during your turn, which can only be used on the True side.

cards.name: Gates of R'lyeh
cards.text:
You cannot flip this location.
[action]: Test [combat] (2) to shatter the monoliths. If you succeed, move X cards from one side to another, where X is the amount you succeeded by. (Limit one success per round.)

cards.name: Hallway Vent
cards.text: [action]: Knock. Search the encounter deck and discard pile for an enemy and spawn it. Then, move the Little Sister mini-card attached to the nearest The Walls location to this location. Forced - After you defeat the spawned enemy: Reveal the Little Sister attached to Hallway Vent.

cards.name: Hallway Vent
cards.text: Forced - At the round of the round, each Big Daddy investigator at this location must discard one card beneath their investigator card. [free] If this location is [[Sunken]]: Move. Move to a connecting, [[Sunken]] location.

cards.flavor: The hopeful savior is anything but, tap dancing wildly in front of your still-thawing body, unconcerned with your current state. "The name's Sander Cohen! Maybe you've heard...?"
cards.name: Caught in the Spotlight  (v. I)
cards.text: Objective - After the three "inner ring" locations are revealed, immediately advance.

cards.name: The Wild Bunny Runs
cards.text:
"Where are you going, my little moth!" Cohen's voice, deep one moment, sniveling the next, echoes through Fort Frolic's labyrinthine halls. "Don't you want to be my museeeeeee?"
Put the three set-aside [[Lower Level]] locations into play, as the "middle ring," one connected to each "inner ring" location.
Check your supplies. If an investigator has a Holy Bible, that investigator must silently read the following:
With your faith tested in this madhouse, you scurry to a secluded nook to pray. The thoughts center you as inspiration comes rushing in.
You may attach The Rabbit Mask to Sander Cohen. If you do, he gets -2 fight and deals +1 horror for the remainder of the scenario.

cards.name: Brigid Tenenbaum
cards.text:
Uses (2 eve).
[free] Spend 1 eve and exhaust Brigid Tenenbaum: Place 1 eve on an asset at your location.
[reaction] When a scenario ends, if Brigid Tenenbaum is in play, the first [[ADAM]] asset you purchase between scenarios costs 1 fewer XP.

cards.flavor: The decompression chamber can only protect you for so long. You need to make your way back into the heart of Rapture. Finding an entrance and ascending through this infinite pool will be easier said than done.
cards.name: Pressure Point (v. II)
cards.text: As an additional cost to move up or down, spend X actions, where X is the row you will be moving to (max 3). Forced - At the start of the round: Perform a shifting test.

cards.name: Hatching a Plan
cards.text:
You catch your breathe under a collapsed structure bearing the water-worn insignia of Fontaine's Department Store. In this brief moment of respite, you corral with the team on how you plan to circumvent the terrors of the deep and return to Rapture unscathed. "These currents," Dyer remarked, "it's as if they're being controlled by whatever festers below." Breathless, he carries on. "Whatever's in that corpse city must not want us down here." You look down at the glowing green trench, its colors vibrant and shimmering. "Perhaps there's something around here, in the debris, that can help us?," Tenenbaum asked. "You used those sea slugs," DeWitt interjected, "what's to say there's not something else down here for us to use?"
If you are a [[Blessed]], [[Cultist]], or [[Veteran]], you may reveal any [[Ruins]] location. (Limit one per investigator).

cards.name: Infesting Scourge
cards.text: Revelation - Put Infesting Scourge into play in your threat area. You get -1 health and -1 sanity. [action]: Scratch. Place 1 resource (from the resource pool) on Infesting Scourge. Forced - When Infesting Scourge has 3 resources on it, discard it.

cards.name: Toxic Sprinklers
cards.text: Revelation - Attach Toxic Sprinklers to the nearest location with at least 3 locations connected to it and no [[Surveillance]] treachery attached. If there are no such locations, Toxic Sprinklers gains surge. The targeted location gains 1+X shroud, where X is the number of resource tokens on this card.

cards.name: Terror in the Deep
cards.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X, where X is the current row (or column, in act 3) you are on.
[cultist]: Reveal another token. If you fail, and the revealed token is a [skull], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail], add 1 doom to the current agenda. This can cause the agenda to advance.
[tablet]: -2. If you fail, and a [[Surveillance]] enemy is in play, move it once along its current path.
[elder_thing]: -3. If you fail, and are on an [[Ocean]] location, end your turn.

cards.name: Terror in the Deep
cards.text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X, where X is double the current row (or column, in act 3) you are on.
[cultist]: -1. Reveal another token. If you fail, and the revealed token is a [skull], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail], add 1 doom to the current agenda. This can cause the agenda to advance.
[tablet]: -3. If a [[Surveillance]] enemy is in play, move it once along its current path.
[elder_thing]: -5. If you fail, and are on an [[Ocean]] location, end your turn.

cards.flavor: Snapped out of your stupor with a spate of vomit, you quickly come to your senses knowing the immediate danger around you. You look down with worrisome eyes as Ellen looks up with frightened ones. In a panicked state of confusion, she screams, causing a sonar screech to shatter a nearby window from the outside. You grab her and run for the exit.
cards.name: Anima Visage
cards.text: Objective - If each undefeated investigator has resigned, advance.

cards.name: Anima Visage
cards.text:
Reality bent through each doorway, their arches like rainbows emerging from behind the newly-formed waterfalls. You knew where Point Prometheus' bathysphere station was, you just needed to set your head on straight. How Annabelle could subsist in such an illusion you have no idea. To her, this world was a castle in the air. The lighthouse, now within reach, was her beacon.
(→R3)

cards.name: Marching Orders
cards.text: Revelation - Move each [[Syndicate]] enemy once towards the nearest [[Leader]] enemy. If no [[Syndicate]] enemies are moved by this effect, search the encounter deck and discard pile for a [[Syndicate]] enemy and draw it. Forced - For each enemy that engaged or disengaged you, remove 1 Use on any asset you control.

cards.name: Bloodlust
cards.text: The forced effect on the attached enemy now reads: "After an investigator fails a test while investigating, attacking, or attempting to evade..." Forced - After the attached enemy flips over: Flip Bloodlust over. If it is defeated, remove Bloodlust from the game.

cards.name: Docile
cards.text: [reaction] After you leave this location: Test [agility] (3). If you succeed, move the attached enemy to your location. If you fail, flip the attached enemy over. Any investigator at this location may perform this test. Forced - After the attached enemy flips over: Flip Bloodlust over.

cards.name: Echoes of Innocence
cards.text:
Beyond the door, Arkham endures. In the town square, a congregation gathers beneath the morning sun, hanging on the words of Mayor Thomas Peaslee as he speaks of a future built upon lessons learned. You watch on as your mind reels, for there is an unease in the air, a hush that no one dares name. At the edge of the crowd, his daughter - little miss Peaslee - stands apart. The wind tugs at her dress, but she does not shiver, does not blink. And when the light catches her face just so, her eyes shimmer: Vacant, golden, and endless.
- Attach the set-aside Shattered Memories treachery to the current act. - Place 1 set-aside [skull] token on the current act. Then, if the act has 3 matching symbols, you may perform the resign ability below. - Flip this card back over.
[free]: Resign. You step through the door. Do not flip over this card. It is not considered empty.

cards.name: Sea of Doors
cards.text: [action]: Test [agility] (6). Reduce the difficulty of this skill test by X, where X is the number of [[Extradimensional]] locations without clues on them. If you succeed, flip this card over.

cards.flavor:
"The Thing of the idols, the green, sticky spawn of the stars, had awaked to claim his own."
H.P. Lovecraft, The Call of Cthulhu
cards.name: Writhing Embrace
cards.text: Revelation - Test [agility] (3) (4 if on an Enemy-Location). For each point you fail by, shuffle the top card of your True deck into the deck attached to C T H U L H U.

cards.flavor: Your veins thrum and twitch with the kinetic energy of ADAM coursing through them.
cards.name: Vial of ADAM
cards.text: [reaction] After you spend eve from an [[ADAM]] asset you control, exhaust Vial of ADAM: Heal 1 damage and 1 horror.

cards.flavor: The entrance to Fort Frolic has been shuttered down due to Ryan's city-wide security measures, as large, grille doors trap you inside, their bars jolting with electricity. Worse yet, dangerous men patrol the halls, keen on holding you against your will.
cards.name: Under Lock and Key (v. II)
cards.text: You cannot perform the parley ability on Sander Cohen.

cards.name: Contraband Seizure
cards.text:
Without warning, the lights in your eyes goes out once more. This time, you discover moments later, from the thud of a well-placed wrench to the temple. As you regain consciousness, you hear a gruff voice from behind you start to speak. "Look here, top-sider. I don't want to be in this madhouse any longer than you do. But Ryan's got orders and I plan on following 'em. Best o' you to stay put."
Each investigator must add a set-aside copy of Eminent Domain to their hand in the left-most position). Attach the set-aside Spotlight to The Atrium, facing any location.
Just outside of your peripheral you see a puff of smoke followed by the reappearance of Sander Cohen and his manic laugh. Bullets whiz by your head from those holding you hostage, hoping to take the eccentric down, only to hit air as Cohen flashes out of existence once more, tapping you briefly on the shoulder.

cards.flavor: "Daddy's giving you stars and birdies!"
cards.name: Alpha Series
cards.text: Prey - Bearer of Guardian Spirit. Alert. Hunter. Alpha Series gains +X health, where X is the total number of resource tokens on [[Task]] treacheries in play.

cards.name: Lambs to the Slaughter
cards.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -1 (-3 instead if you are at a [[Forbidden]] location).
[cultist]: Reveal another token. If you fail, place 1 doom on the nearest enemy.
[tablet]: -2. If you fail, and a [[Surveillance]] treachery is in play, rotate it once.
[elder_thing]: -5. You may discard an asset you control to treat this token's modifier as -2, instead.

cards.name: Lambs to the Slaughter
cards.text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -2 (-4 instead if you are at a [[Forbidden]] location).
[cultist]: -1. Reveal another token. If you fail, place 1 doom on the nearest enemy.
[tablet]: -3. If a [[Surveillance]] treachery is in play, rotate it once.
[elder_thing]: -6. You may discard an asset you control to treat this token's modifier as -3, instead.

cards.name: Atlantic Express Ruins
cards.text: Forced - After you reveal Atlantic Express Ruins: Spawn a random, set aside [[Big Daddy]] enemy, exhausted. Then, attach 2 random, set aside [[Mood]] treacheries to it (1, if playing v. II). [free] Place 1 of your clues on Atlantic Express Ruins: Heal 2 damage. (Group limit once per round.)

cards.flavor: Collapsed tunnels choke the tracks with debris, while rusted train cars sit half-buried in the silt. Flickering signs point to destinations long lost, their glow fading into the endless deep.
cards.name: Atlantic Express Ruins
In the Veil of Lunacy  (v. I)
cards.text: Behind the mask, the world's disturbed. Reality fades and visions blurred. A chilling laugh, the shadows play. In the rabbit's grip, the mind decays.

cards.name: Round & Round We Go
cards.text:
"They're marvelousssss, wouldn't you all say?" A cascade of spotlights swing in position on you as Cohen eagerly dictates your every move. "Look at the bunny go hop, hop, hop! Right around the cage it doesn't know it's in. Don't be so wild!" Cohen's scream coincides with another blanket of fog descending from above, cloaking the room around you. A temporal shift rattles inside your head. Your bones screech, your ears ring, and a guttural groan rattles the corridors around you.
Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck. Draw the set-aside World Gone Mad story card and resolve its text. Spawn a random, set aside [[Big Daddy]] enemy at the location farthest from all investigators, and attach 2 random, set aside [[Mood]] treacheries to it.

cards.name: Fink Manufacturing
cards.text: The first [[Mirror]] encounter card drawn during the mythos phase by an investigator at this location gains surge. [reaction] After you discover a clue from The Great Pyramid: Reduce the shroud value of Fink Manufacturing by 2 for the remainder of your turn. If you beheld the Great Chain, reduce it by 3 instead.

cards.name: The Grand Hall
cards.text: The Grand Hall gets +2 shroud if C T H U L H U is targeting it. [reaction] After you enter The Grand Hall: Move 2 cards from either your True side to your Mirror side, or vice versa.

cards.flavor: Dolls, blocks, and glowing syringes litter the floor.
cards.name: Playroom
cards.text: Forced - When you reveal Playroom: Search the encounter deck and discard pile for an [[Injury]] treachery and resolve its revelation ability. Each [[Medic]] investigator gains: Ignore the forced ability above.

cards.flavor:
"The Little Sister's Orphanage: In troubled times, give your little girl the life that she deserves. Boarding and education free of charge! After all, children ARE the future of Rapture."
― Public Address Advertisement
cards.name: Little Sister's Orphanage
Feral Instincts
cards.text: Revelation - Place 1 + X horror tokens on Atlas, where X is the amount of [[Splicer]] enemies in play (not including swarm cards). Any investigator may remove from the game an [[ADAM]] asset in their hand or play area to reduce the amount of horror tokens placed by 1 (you may do this any number of times).

cards.flavor: It was one part playroom, one part laboratory, and one part boudoir. A Frankenstein design entirely inhabitable.
cards.name: Tenenbaum's Office
cards.text: Forced - After Tenenbaum's Office is revealed: Put the set-aside Brigid Tenenbaum story asset into play at Tenenbaum's Office.

cards.flavor:
"The Little Sister's Orphanage: In troubled times, give your little girl the life that she deserves. Boarding and education free of charge! After all, children ARE the future of Rapture."
― Public Address Advertisement
cards.name: Little Sister's Orphanage
Atlantic Express Ruins
cards.text: Forced - After you reveal Atlantic Express Ruins: Spawn a random, set aside [[Big Daddy]] enemy, exhausted. Then, attach 2 random, set aside [[Mood]] treacheries to it (1, if playing v. II). [free] Place 1 of your clues on Atlantic Express Ruins: Heal 2 horror. (Group limit once per round.)

cards.flavor: Collapsed tunnels choke the tracks with debris, while rusted train cars sit half-buried in the silt. Flickering signs point to destinations long lost, their glow fading into the endless deep.
cards.name: Atlantic Express Ruins
The Great Pyramid
cards.text: The first [[True]] encounter card drawn during the mythos phase by an investigator at this location gains surge. [reaction] After you discover a clue from Fink Manufacturing: Reduce the shroud value of The Great Pyramid by 2 for the remainder of your turn. If you scaled the tetrahedron, reduce it by 3 instead.

cards.name: The Grand Hall
cards.text: The Grand Hall gets +2 shroud if C T H U L H U is targeting it. [reaction] After you enter The Grand Hall: Move 2 cards from your True side to your Mirror side.

cards.name: Uno!
cards.text: Revelation - Put Uno! into play in your threat area. [free]: Attach 1 non-weakness card from your hand to Uno! (Limit once per phase.) Forced - When X cards are attached, discard them and place Uno! next to the scnenario reference card. X is 1 + the total number of [[Task]] treacheries next to the scenario reference card.

cards.flavor: "Don't be a dolt - use Electro Bolt!"
cards.name: Electro Bolt
cards.text: Uses (3 Eve). [action] Exhaust Electro Bolt and spend 1 eve: Fight. You may use [willpower] instead of [combat] for this attack, you get +2 skill value for this test, and deal +1 damage. If you succeed, and are at a [[Sunken]] location, this damage is dealt to all enemies and other investigators at this location.

cards.flavor: "I seen it, I swear. The March Hare!"
cards.name: Pellucid Decoy
cards.text: Aloof. Elusive. Hunter. Pellucid Decoy cannot be damaged. Forced - When an investigator would attack another enemy at Pellucid Decoy's location, they instead attack Pellucid Decoy. [action]: Parley. Test [willpower] (2). If you succeed, shuffle Pellucid Decoy back into the encounter deck.

cards.name: Wrapped Around The Finger
cards.text: Revelation - Lose X resources, where X is 2 + the amount of [[ADAM]] assets in your hand and play area (including permanents). For each resource you cannot lose, you must either take 1 damage, 1 horror, or any other investigator may lose resources until the full amount is paid.

cards.name: Iron Will
cards.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, either place 1 horror token on Andrew Ryan or put Iron Will into play in your threat area. If you fail, do both. Forced - At the end of the round: Place 1 horror token on Andrew Ryan. Then, place Iron Will on the bottom of the deck attached to Lockdown Protocols.

cards.flavor: As "Waltz of the Flowers" continues its dance across Fort Frolic's many rooms, the time to escape them is running out. Ryan's vice grip on you and Cohen's vivacious pleasure palace grows ever tighter.
cards.name: The Grand Finale (v. II)
cards.text: Forced - After a non-weakness treachery attaches to Sander Cohen: Place him at The Atrium. Then, if there are 1 [per_investigator] non-weakness treacheries attached to Sander Cohen, flip him over.

cards.name: The Last Dance
cards.text:
If Sander Cohen is alive:
"Oh, my poor WILD BUNNY. What happened to you?" Cohen's words are filled with derision and contempt. "You're of no use to me anymore. You and those buffoons Ryan's got running amok in my playpen. Tell him I've had enough fun for today. Toodle-oo!"
(→R3)
If Sander Cohen is defeated:
During your final scramble for an exit in this madhouse, Ryan's forces overwhelm you. Trapped in a corner, you have no option other than to resign to the fate you'll soon be given. Another wallop from the wrench and it's lights out, birdie.
(→R3)

cards.name: Genetics Erased
cards.text: Revelation - If you have no clues, Genetics Erased gains surge. Otherwise, test [intellect] (3). For each point you fail by, place 1 of your clues on your location. Then, test [willpower] (X), where X is the amount of clues placed. For each point you fail by, flip 1 clue to its doom side. Doom flipped by this effect can be discovered as if it were a clue.

cards.flavor: A gap between structures, blown apart from the wreckage, provides an entry back into the city.
cards.name: Gates of Rapture
cards.text: Gates of Rapture gets -1 shroud for each clue on it. [action]: Resign. "This is our way in!"

cards.flavor:
"I chose the impossible. I chose... Rapture!"
― Andrew Ryan, founder of Rapture
cards.name: Gates of Rapture

cards.flavor: "The tentacles came for me, slithering out of tears and into structures incomprehensible to my eye."
cards.name: Geometric Impossibilities
cards.text: Revelation - If your Mirror location has no clues on it, Geometric Impossibilities gains surge. Otherwise, test [agility] (2) (3 if on an Enemy-Location). If you fail, move each clue from your Mirror location to your True location.

cards.name: Death Trap
cards.text:
Permanent. Limit 1 per deck.
[reaction] After an asset you control with a health or sanity value is defeated: Deal 1 damage to an enemy at your location.

cards.flavor: A single wilting tree covers the Tea Garden in an active state of decay.
cards.name: Tea Garden
cards.text: You cannot investigate Tea Garden if a [[Sorcerer]] enemy is at this location. If there are no clues on Tea Garden, remember that you found a rose blossom.

cards.name: Rolling Hills
cards.text: Forced - At the end of the round, reduce Oxygen Deficit by 1 [per_investigator] if you are targeted by a [[Surveillance]] treachery. Each investigator who has a macabre twig mask gains: Ignore the forced ability above.

cards.name: Truculent Totem
cards.text:
Truculent Totem cannot leave play.
[action]: Test any skill (X), where X is the amount of [[Ocean]] locations in a single row to your right. For each point you succeed by, flip over an [[Ocean]] location in any row up to Y columns to your left or right, where Y is the amount you succeeded by.

cards.flavor:
"I can't seem to get the damn Big Daddies to imprint on the little brats. The protection bond is just not forming."
-- Yi Suchong
cards.name: Frenzied
cards.text: Attached enemy gains Retaliate and Alert. Forced - After the attached enemy flips over: Flip Frenzied over. If it is defeated, remove Frenzied from the game.

cards.name: Docile
cards.text: [reaction] After you leave this location: Test [agility] (3). If you succeed, move the attached enemy to your location. If you fail, flip the attached enemy over. Any investigator at this location may perform this test. Forced - After the attached enemy flips over: Flip Frenzied over.

cards.name: Fontaine Futuristics Ruins
cards.text: Forced - After you enter Fontaine Futuristics Ruins, if you did so by moving through 2 or more [[Ocean]] locations: Take 2 damage. [reaction] After you deal damage to an enemy at your location or a connecting location: Heal that much damage (max 3). (Group limit once per round.)

cards.flavor: Rusting assembly lines sit motionless, their plasmid vats cracked and leaking glowing residue into the water. Faded propaganda posters peel from the walls, promises of a brighter future swallowed by the deep.
cards.name: Fontaine Futuristics Ruins

cards.flavor: By sheer luck, it seems you've been aided by a fragment of divine intervention. The surge of citizens hearing the calls of Rapture's leaders doesn't seem to affect these two curious transplants in the slightest. It seems, to them, order must be restored.
cards.name: A Grand Ol' Farce
cards.text: Each [[Elite]] enemy gets +3 [per_investigator] health. Objective - If each [[Elite]] enemy is defeated, immediately advance. Objective - If the investigators possess the requisite number of clues at the end of the round, advance.

cards.name: Revolution Nights
cards.text:
If you advanced by spending the requisite number of clues:
Group by group, person by person, despite the best efforts of Ryan, Atlas, and Lamb, you quell the rising tide of the populace and begin to convince them of a threat far greater than any their so-called figureheads pose. For now, a crisis has been abated. And the twins are nowhere to be found.
(→R1)
If you advanced by defeating each [[Elite]] enemy:
Riots erupt all across the Grand Hall, as splicers descend from the rafters, bullets fly into the air, and crazed lunatics chant invocations in the name of The Family. The figureheads have been slain, their city torn asunder. And the twins, nowhere to be found.
(→R2)

cards.name: That Sinking Feeling
cards.text: Revelation - Attach That Sinking Feeling to a non-permanent asset you control without That Sinking Feeling attached. If you cannot, this card gains surge. Treat attached asset's text box as if it were blank (except for [[Traits]]). Forced - At the end of the round: Test [willpower] (3) (4 if at a [[Sunken]] location). If you succeed, discard That Sinking Feeling.

cards.flavor: By now, your appearance in Rapture at this most inopportune time has garnered the talk of the town. Every passerby has something to whisper; about you and to those in charge. All this elegance and suspicion has turned a once-fashionable event into a whodunit bacchanal.
cards.name: Hunting For Parasites
cards.text: Forced - When a [[Surveillance]] treachery spots an investigator, move all [[Syndicate]] enemies one location towards that investigator.

cards.name: Lost in the Crowd
cards.text:
Unbeknownst to you, the train just arrived at the Welcome Center. With it, fashionably late patrons attempt to make their grand entrance to the Bedrock Banquet, as others depart with their night - "or is it day?" - still intact. One such traveller has plans to do neither.
Put the set-aside Atlantic Express Depot location into play, and spawn the set-aside Sullivan enemy there.
If any investigator has the [[Clairvoyant]], [[Cursed]], or [[Dreamer]] trait, read the following:
You have a premonition of wicked deeds and foul odors, rotting wood and urchin infestations. A place in the shadows where seafarers have gone mad with delirium after consuming moribund sea slugs because the caviar and crab gets shipped elsewhere. There, you can escape.
Put the set-aside Smuggler's Hideout location into play, if it is not already in play, and reveal it.

cards.name: Market Street
cards.text: Forced - After an [[Obstacle]] or [[Surveillance]] treachery is attached to Market Street: Add 1 clue to it. Forced - If you gained the ire of the gala's elite, you must spend 1 resource or discard 1 card from your hand to enter any other [[Market Street]] location.

cards.flavor: With a picturesque seaside view and spotless veneer, Market Street clearly caters to Rapture's upper class. Shops, services, and residential plazas make this a luxurious stay.
cards.name: Market Street
cards.text: The entrance to Market Street is cordoned off. You cannot move into Market Street.

cards.flavor:
"Ph'nglui mglw'nafh Cthulhu R'lyeh wgah'nagl fhtagn"
-- H. P. Lovecraft, "The Call of Cthulhu"
cards.name: Visions of a Sunken City
cards.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). If you fail, take X horror, where X is the number of [[Sunken]] locations in play (to a maximum of 3).

cards.name: Reality Shifts
cards.text:
Shuffle the five set-aside [[Ruins]] locations and draw one at random. Draw tokens from the shifting bag until you reveal one symbol token and one number token. Ignore subsequent drawings of each. Then, move the selected location X spaces, swapping places with each location along the way, according to the result below. X is the number token drawn. If moving the selected location would result in it reaching the end of the map, it instead does not move. [reaction] After a location moves: Flip this card over.
Symbols [skull] - Move left. [cultist] - Move right. [tablet] - Move up. [elder_thing] - Move down.

cards.name: Lost & Found
cards.text:
If the location that moved was...<hr>- ...Adonis Luxury Resorts, and you are an [[Artist]] or [[Socialite]], during your next turn, reduce the cost to play [rogue] or neutral events by 1.
- ...Atlantic Express, and you are a [[Civic]] or [[Entrepreneur]], during your next turn, gain 1 resource each time you perform a move action.
- ...Dionysus Park, and you are a [[Performer]] or [[Silver Twilight]], during your next turn, played assets enter play with 1 additional use.
- ...Fontaine Futuristics, and you are a [[Detective]] or [[Reporter]], search the top 9 cards of your deck for an [[Insight]] event and draw it.
- ...Medical Pavilion, and you are an [[Assistant]] or [[Police]], during your next turn, heal 1 additional damage or horror each time you heal damage and/or horror.<hr>After resolving all above abilities, flip this card back over.

cards.name: Playroom
cards.text:
Playroom gets +[per_investigator] shroud. Reduce the shroud of Playroom by X, where X is the amount of clues on it.
[reaction] After you discover any amount of clues from Playroom: Place 1 resource on it, as a vision.
[free] If Playroom has 2 visions: Reveal the attached story asset and add it to any investigator's hand.

cards.flavor:
"Mother found a way to rehabilitate me psychologically, but she can't remove this... this thing inside my body. I look in the mirror, and I see a freak. I remember very little -- just an artificial sense of peace and a compulsive hunger for ADAM."
--- Eleanor Lamb
cards.name: Playroom

cards.flavor: You heard stories of neglected orphanages back on the surface. But nothing like this. With Tenenbaum by your side, the strangest emotion weaves into your brain: hope.
cards.name: Precious Cargo
cards.text: Forced - After you resign: Return all clues you control to the token pool. Objective - If each undefeated investigator has resigned, advance. (Hint: You will need to descend down the elevator to do so.)

cards.name: A Diverging Path
cards.text:
If the lead investigator is in control of Ellen:
After regaining your composure you help Tenenbaum search the wreckage for Annabelle. Huddled away behind a pile of rubble you find her; crying but largely unharmed. A blessing from above. Way, way above. After using the now-functional elevator one last time, you head out the front door of the orphanage, never intending on looking back.
(→R1)
Otherwise:
You look down at your chest at a large scar bleeding across your heart. Wounded, but alive, you clamber out of the elevator shaft and seek answers someplace else. Tenenbaum trails languidly behind you.
(→R2)

cards.name: Organic Pockets
cards.text:
Permanent. Limit 1 per deck.
At the start of each scenario, you may mulligan X additional times, where X is the amount of [[Gene Tonic]] assets you control.

cards.flavor: It's nigh-on impossible to communicate over the sound of Ryan ordering his men through the loud speakers.
cards.name: Ryan's Court
cards.text: [action]: Test [willpower] (4). If you succeed, remove a token placed on Atlas' Court ([[Center]]).

cards.name: Ryan's Court
cards.text: Forced - After you fail a skill test at this location: Place 1 horror token on Andrew Ryan. [free] [[Miskatonic]], [[Police]], or [[Warden]] investigators at this location, take 1 damage and 1 horror: Either flip this location over or remove 2 horror tokens from Andrew Ryan. (Group limit once per round.)

cards.name: Sander Cohen
cards.text: Sander Cohen cannot be played. [action]: Parley. Add Sander Cohen to your hand, to the immediate left of Contraband Seizure. [reaction] After you move a card to the left of Contraband Seizure, spend 1 resource: Move an additional card.

cards.name: Sander Cohen
cards.text:
Hunter. Elusive.
Sander Cohen can only be damaged or attacked while a [[Pact]] treachery is attached to him.
Each investigator who controls a [[Pact]] treachery, or has one in their hand, cannot move while at Sander Cohen's location.

cards.flavor: From down the corridor, a screech rings out. The siren calls, the siren culls.
cards.name: Secrets in the Dark (v. II)
cards.text: If it is act 3a, Big Sister no longer deals damage, but instead gains the following text: "Forced - When Big Sister attacks you: Place 1 clue you control on your location. Then, flip it to its doom side. Doom flipped by this effect can be discovered as if it were a clue." Forced - At the end of the round: Place clues on each Prison Cell location until it has clues equal to its clue value.

cards.name: Flicker and Fade
cards.text:
Try as you might, you're unable to find your way out of Lamb's dingy gaol. Its concrete corridors calling you home. Manic cheers erupt from the throng of mindless prisoners, as metal clangs on metal, sparks and flames emitting from their cell doors. "Join us!," screams one. "Join the Family!," cries another. As the minutes and hours go by, so too does your sanity. Your delusions grow ever stronger, spurred on by a sense of overwhelming dread. Brilliant, blue butterflies appear above your head, fluttering in ever-expanding droves. Their luminescence a glitter across the room, consuming the space where you now rest in the fetal position. And as you do, the kaleidoscope of butterflies form a shimmer. A vision. A tear... Into another reality.
(→R4)

cards.flavor: "Laugh as your enemies fight each other."
cards.name: Enrage
