cards.text: Uses (3 Eve). [free] Exhaust Enrage and spend 1 eve: Chose an enemy at any location. Parley. Test [combat] (X), where X is that enemy's fight value. If you succeed, that enemy deals damage equal to its damage value to each enemy at its location (minimum 1).

cards.name: No Gods, No Kings, No Survivors
cards.text:
Through the doorway, the ruins of Rapture lie in eerie silence, its once-grand halls slick with rust and old blood. The banners of Atlas still hang in tatters, bearing slogans long since forgotten, their promises drowned alongside the corpses that litter the streets. No kings, no gods — only the hollow remnants of a city where the downtrodden rose, burned their masters, and found nothing left to rule but the dead.
- Spawn the set-aside Baby Jane enemy at The Lighthouse. - Place 1 set-aside [tablet] token on the current act. Then, if the act has 3 matching symbols, you may perform the resign ability below. - Flip this card back over.
[free]: Resign. You step through the door. Do not flip over this card. It is not considered empty.

cards.name: Sea of Doors
cards.text: [action]: Test [intellect] (6). Reduce the difficulty of this skill test by X, where X is the number of [[Extradimensional]] locations without clues on them. If you succeed, flip this card over.

cards.name: Divine Sacrilege
cards.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (4). If you fail, remove the [elder_sign] token from the token bag for the remainder of the round. If you fail by 3 or more, remove a "0" token, as well.

cards.flavor: "A gun in every home, peace on every street."
cards.name: Peacekeeper
cards.text: Forced - As an additional cost to attack Peacekeeper with an asset, either spend an action or spend a Use.

cards.flavor: A suffocating aroma quickly fills the air.
cards.name: Langford's Office
cards.text:
Investigators and enemies cannot explore from Langford's Office if it has clues on it.
[action]: Test [combat] (3) to break the window shudders. If you succeed, reduce the shroud value by 3 for the remainder of the round.

cards.name: Langford's Office
cards.text:
Langford's Office is obscured in mist. Investigators and enemies cannot enter Langford's Office, or discover clues from it, unless it is surrounded by 8 Rolling Hills locations.
[action]: Test [combat] (3) to reinforce the window shudders. If you succeed, reduce the shroud value by 3 for the remainder of the round.

cards.flavor: "Which is the true nightmare, the horrific dream that you have in your sleep or the dissatisfied reality that awaits you when you awake?"
cards.name: Past Haunts
cards.text: Revelation - Draw cards from the Past Haunts deck until you reveal one that has a trait matching one of your investigator's traits. Draw that card and shuffle each other drawn card back into the Past Haunts deck.

cards.name: Fallen Angels
cards.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -1 for each location away from Grand Lobby you are.
[cultist]: Reveal another token. If you fail, and you are at a [[Facility]] location, flip it over.
[tablet]: -2. If you fail, and a [[Surveillance]] enemy is above a location, move it once along its path.
[elder_thing]: -3. If you fail, and are a Big Daddy or Little Sister, discard a random card attached to your investigator card.

cards.name: Fallen Angels
cards.text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -1 for each location away from Bathysphere Station you are.
[cultist]: -1. Reveal another token. If you fail, and you are at a [[Facility]] location, flip it over.
[tablet]: -4. If you fail, and a [[Surveillance]] enemy is above a location, move it once along its path.
[elder_thing]: -3. If you fail, and are a Big Daddy or Little Sister, discard 2 random cards attached to your investigator card.

cards.flavor: An orphanage armed to the teeth with traps, protecting the innocent from harm, or preventing their escape? It was a thought that crossed your mind, a mind now consumed with those sickening, glowing, yellow eyes.
cards.name: Ascending Salvation
cards.text: Objective - At the end of the round, if each undefeated investigator is at the Elevator Shaft, and possess the requisite number of clues, they may advance. (Hint: You may want to please as many Little Sisters as you can along the way.)

cards.name: Third Level's The Charm
cards.text:
Another floor behind, the final yet to go. You begin to question, after bearing the brunt of all this savagery, whether or not Tenenbaum's even still alive. It's clear that, wherever they are, the inmates are running this asylum. And Fontaine's their prince of darkness.
Remove all doom from the current agenda, and replace it with Agenda 2a - Cabin Fever. Remove the 4 [[Sanctum]] locations in play from the game (discarding all attachments, clues, tokens, and enemies). Then, draw the final 4 cards of the Orphanage deck and place them above, below, to the left, and to the right of Elevator Shaft, unrevealed side face-up.
If any investigator has the [[Assistant]] or [[Medic]] trait, read the following:
During a moment of solace in this hydraulic dumbwaiter, you heal the wounds of the beaten and console the minds of the hopeless.
Each investigator heals 1 damage or 1 horror.

cards.name: Rosie
cards.text: This location gets -1 shroud. [reaction] At the end of the enemy phase: Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, Rosie deals 1 damage to an enemy at this location. If you fail, flip Rosie over. Any investigator at this location may perform this test. Forced - If there are no investigators at this location: Flip Rosie over.

cards.name: Rosie
cards.text: Forced - After an investigator fails a test while investigating at any location, if Rosie is ready: Move Rosie once towards that location. [action] If there are no clues on Rosie's location: Parley. Test [intellect] (3) to hack the Big Daddy. If you succeed, flip over Rosie (keeping all tokens) and attach it to your location.

cards.name: Le Marquis D'Epoque
cards.text:
While Le Marquis D'Epoque is in the "inner ring," reduce its shroud value by 2. While Le Marquis D'Epoque is in the "middle ring," increase its shroud value by 2.
[reaction] After you successfully investigate Le Marquis D'Epoque while in the "middle ring": Discover an additional clue at a connecting location.

cards.flavor: Torn silks hang like ghosts over cracked display cases, while the air lingers with the scent of stale cigars.
cards.name: Le Marquis D'Epoque
cards.text: The path leading to Le Marquis D'Epoque is blocked. As an additional cost for you to enter Le Marquis D'Epoque, investigators must spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group.

cards.name: Bone Tremors
cards.text: Revelation - Discard the top X cards of your deck, where X is 2 + the amount of [[ADAM]] assets in your hand and play area (including permanents). Draw each weakness discarded this way. If a [[Plasmid]] was among those discarded, take 2 damage or 2 horror.

cards.flavor: Fearful and in disarray, Eleanor is but a shell of herself. A husk made to appease an owner. Perhaps some childhood trinkets could rekindle her failing vestige.
cards.name: Quantum Memories
cards.text: [free]: Move 1 clue from Monument Tower to a connecting [[Inner Persephone]] location. (Limit once per phase.) Objective - Recover Eleanor's memories! If the investigators "recovered her memories," you may advance.

cards.name: Mother's Intuition
cards.text:
Distracted by all manner of creature both real and mechanical, in one reality and another, it takes Tenenbaum's intuition to notice Eleanor's attempts at speaking out. It seems reality caught up with her.
(→R1)

cards.name: The Lutece Twins
cards.text:
[action]: Reveal 6 chaos tokens. If a [cultist], [tablet], or [elder_thing] was revealed: Seal it on The Lutece Twins (max 1). Any investigator may trigger this ability from any location. (Group limit once per round).
[reaction] At the start of the round, release a sealed token on this card: Perform the ability listed on the Lutece Twins Reference..

cards.name: Garden of New Eden
cards.text: The first [[Mirror]] encounter card drawn during the mythos phase by an investigator at this location gains surge. Garden of New Eden gets +X shroud, where X is the highest [willpower] value amongst investigators at this location. If you studied the disciples, choose the lowest [willpower] instead.

cards.name: Fort Frolic
cards.text:
[reaction] After you enter Fort Frolic: Move 1 card from either your True side to your Mirror side, or vice versa.
[reaction] After you succeed at a skill test while investigating Fort Frolic: Move 1 card from the top of your True deck to the top of your Mirror deck.

cards.name: Irresistible Command
cards.text: Revelation - Trigger Andrew Ryan's patrol keyword and forced effect. Then, place 1 horror token on him for each ... (choose one, whichever is higher): - ... [[Syndicate]] enemy in play. - ... Ryan's Court location with no clues on it.

cards.flavor: Don't fight the inevitable. You'll run out of oxygen soon, and then you'll just go to sleep.
cards.name: Asynchronous Rotation
cards.text: Revelation - If there are no [[Surveillance]] treacheries in play, Asynchronous Rotation gains surge. Otherwise, rotate the nearest [[Surveillance]] treachery. For each investigator that was targeted, reduce Oxygen Deficit by 1 [per_investigator].

cards.flavor: As the currents rise, so too do your chances of survival. The bottom of Rapture's towers are now in sight.
cards.name: Fighting for Air (v. II)
cards.text: As an additional cost to move up or down, spend X actions, where X is the row you will be moving to (max 3). Forced - At the start of the round: Perform a shifting test. Objective - At the end of the round, if each investigator is at the same [[Ruins]] location, they may spend the requisite number of clues, as a group, to advance.

cards.name: The Guiding Light
cards.text:
"There!," Dyer yelled, "what's that?" Tenenbaum approached, insisting it was a sea slug. However, her body language soon told a much different story. It was a statue depicting an eldritch being, covered in moss and algae, humming ever so gently, illuminating a green pulse. "Cthulhu," Dyer gasped.
Check Campaign Log. - If Atlas' insurrection has begun, read Truculent Totem 3 in the Scenario Interlude: Truculent Totem in the Campaign Guide. - If a Great One has awoken, read Truculent Totem 2 in the Scenario Interlude: Truculent Totem in the Campaign Guide.

cards.flavor: "For every choice, there is an echo."
cards.name: Sofia Lamb
cards.text: Aloof. Elusive. Patrol (nearest location with no doom on it). Forced - At the end of the enemy phase, if Sofia Lamb is ready and has doom on her: Place 1 of that doom on her current location.

cards.name: The Great Dreamer Wakes
cards.text:
The sea boils, leaving a tarred black abyss. From the shattered husk of R’lyeh, titanic forms rise — C T H U L H U at their head - his unblinking eyes swallowing the last light of the world. Twisted horrors of unfathomable scale slouch forth to claim a reality that was never meant to be ours. Cities buckle beneath waves of writhing flesh, the sky splits like rotted silk, and in the final breath of man’s dominion, only one truth remains: He is awake.
- Spawn the set-aside Spawn of Ghatanothoa enemy at any Sea of Doors location, exhausted. Attach 2 random player cards removed from the game to it, as swarm cards. - Place 1 set-aside [tablet] token on the current act. Then, if the act has 3 matching symbols, you may perform the resign ability below. - Flip this card back over.
[free]: Resign. You step through the door. Do not flip over this card. It is not considered empty.

cards.name: Sea of Doors
cards.text: [action]: Test [agility] (6). Reduce the difficulty of this skill test by X, where X is the number of [[Extradimensional]] locations without clues on them. If you succeed, flip this card over.

cards.name: Train Platform
cards.text: Train Platform is connected to the location above it. [action]: Test [willpower] or [intellect] (4) to mend the leaking window. If you succeed, remember that you kept the water at bay. [free] If you are a [[Performer]], spend 1 resource to tip the busker: Play a card from your hand at no cost. (Limit once per game.)

cards.flavor: Flickering lights reflect on waterlogged marble as cracked art deco pillars loom overhead. The sound of distorted jazz emits from a broken speaker, swooning no one in particular.
cards.name: Train Platform

cards.flavor: Leftover food covers a lone table as an acrid smell protrudes from the refrigerator.
cards.name: Kitchen
cards.text: Forced - When you reveal Kitchen: Reveal a random token from the chaos bag. If you reveal a [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], [curse], or [auto_fail], end your turn or take 2 horror. Each [[Blessed]] or [[Cursed]] investigator gains: Ignore the forced ability above.

cards.flavor:
"The Little Sister's Orphanage: In troubled times, give your little girl the life that she deserves. Boarding and education free of charge! After all, children ARE the future of Rapture."
― Public Address Advertisement
cards.name: Little Sister's Orphanage
Hallway Vent
cards.text: [action]: Knock. Search the encounter deck and discard pile for an enemy and spawn it. Then, move the Little Sister mini-card attached to the nearest The Walls location to this location. Forced - After you defeat the spawned enemy: Reveal the Little Sister attached to Hallway Vent.

cards.name: Hallway Vent
cards.text: Forced - At the round of the round, each Big Daddy investigator at this location must discard one card beneath their investigator card. [free] If this location is [[Sunken]]: Move. Move to a connecting, [[Sunken]] location.

cards.name: Prolific Inventor
cards.text:
Permanent. Limit 1 per deck.
After each scenario of a campaign, reduce the experience cost of the first [[ADAM]], [[Science]], (Unidentified), or (Untranslated) card you purchase or upgrade by 2.

cards.name: The False Shepherd
cards.text: Alert. Aloof. Elusive. Prey - Highest [intellect]. Forced - At the end of the round, if The False Shepherd is ready and there is another enemy at his location, place 1 doom on that enemy. (Limit once per round.)

cards.name: Eyes of the Protector
cards.text: Revelation - Put Eyes of the Protector into play in your threat area and spawn the set-aside The Bouncer enemy. The Bouncer gets +X fight and +X evade, where X is half the total number of [[Task]] treacheries next to the scenario reference card (rounded up). Forced - When The Bouncer is defeated, place Eyes of the Protector next to the scenario reference card and set The Bouncer aside, out of play.

cards.name: Plaster Splicer
cards.text: Hunter. Alert. Spawn - Farthest empty location. Plaster Splicer can only be damaged or attacked while it is targeted by the Spotlight. While targeted by the Spotlight, Plaster Splicer cannot make attacks of opportunity. Forced - After Plaster Splicer moves from the hunter keyword: Resolve its hunter keyword again.

cards.flavor:
With the way out torn asunder via that stalking Big Sister, these hidden rooms that lay deeper in the heart of Persephone may be your only retreat. But how?
"We should split up," DeWitt exclaimed. "This place is too big to stay together."
cards.name: Exit Strategy (v. II)
cards.text: [free]: Move 1 clue from one location to a connecting location. (Limit once per phase.) Objective - After Eleanor Lamb is revealed, immediately advance.

cards.name: The Headless Lambwoman
cards.text:
Sulking from one hidden chamber to the next, it was only a matter of time before that machine caught wind of your scent. The red searchlight and anemic screech echoed down the corridor, your arm and neck hairs standing on end. It stopped. And for a brief moment, the room was quiet. Then a loud crash emanated from down the hall as footsteps rushed wildly in your direction. You readied your weapon as the thing rounded the corner. "Wait! Don't shoot!" Tenenbaum cried. "It's her!"
Read Scenario Interlude: Lamb's Calling (page 48).

cards.name: C T H U L H U
cards.text: While attempting to evade Cthulhu from a [[Central]] location, it is considered engaged with you. Forced - After you fail an evasion attempt against Cthulhu, place an asset you control on the bottom of the deck attached to it. Forced - When targeted, Cthulhu attacks the targeted investigator. Then, shuffle the top card from that investigator's True deck into the deck attached to it.

cards.name: C T H U L H U
cards.text: While attempting to evade Cthulhu from a [[Central]] location, it is considered engaged with you. Forced - After you fail an evasion attempt against Cthulhu, place an asset you control on the bottom of the deck attached to it. Forced - When targeted, Cthulhu attacks the targeted investigator. Then, shuffle the top card from that investigator's Mirror deck into the deck attached to it.

cards.name: The Seahorse
cards.text: The Seahorse gets -1 shroud for each revealed location connected to it. Forced - After you fail a skill test on a treachery while at this location: Increase this location's shroud value by 1 for the remainder of the round.

cards.flavor: The vision of a spectral ghost dances solemnly on the stage of this once haven of luxury.
cards.name: The Seahorse
cards.text: The path leading to The Seahorse is blocked. As an additional cost for you to enter The Seahorse, investigators must spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group.

cards.flavor: A foul odor and decrepit sight expose the scars under this city's seemingly-utopian veneer.
cards.name: Storage Room
cards.text: Forced - After you reveal Storage Room: Spawn a random, set aside [[Big Daddy]] enemy, exhausted.

cards.flavor: "I had all of these visions before coming down here, of utopia. Every man with his hand on the Great Chain, the wheel of progress turning -- every cliché you can imagine. And what is the first thing that happens when I open up shop? Petty thievery."
cards.name: Business Sector
cards.text: Business Sector is connected to each revealed [[Market Street]] location.

cards.name: Docile
cards.text: [reaction] After you leave this location: Test [agility] (3). If you succeed, move the attached enemy to your location. If you fail, flip the attached enemy over. Any investigator at this location may perform this test. Forced - After the attached enemy flips over: Flip Docile over.

cards.name: Botched Surgery
cards.text: Revelation - Put Botched Surgery into play in your threat area. Forced - When an investigator at your location would heal damage and/or horror: Reveal a random chaos token from the chaos bag. If it is a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [curse], or [elder_thing] token, cancel that effect. [action][action]: Discard Botched Surgery.

cards.name: Failsafe Armored Escorts
cards.text: Forced - At the end of the round, each Little Sister investigator at this location must discard one card beneath their investigator card. [reaction] After you defeat at enemy while at Failsafe Armored Escorts: Either play a non-[[Item]] or [[Ally]] card (at no cost) or attach a card to your investigator (at no cost).

cards.name: Failsafe Armored Escorts
cards.text: [action]: Test [intellect] (2). If you succeed, place 1 resource (from the token pool) on Failsafe Armored Escorts. For each resource on Failsafe Armored Escorts, lower the difficulty to perform any tests on Memorial Museum by 2. Forced - If Failsafe Armored Escorts is flipped over, remove all resource tokens on this card.

cards.name: Operating Room
cards.text:
Operating Room gets +[per_investigator] shroud. Reduce the shroud of Operating Room by X, where X is the amount of clues on it.
[reaction] After you discover any amount of clues from Operating Room: Place 1 resource on it, as a vision.
[free] If Operating Room has 2 visions: Reveal the attached story asset and add it to any investigator's hand.

cards.flavor:
"Eleanor's condition may be a blessing in disguise. Early splicing tests indicate zero genetic damage due to her condition as a Little Sister. It appears that she... is our new vessel."
--- Sofia Lamb
cards.name: Operating Room
Boy of Silence
cards.text: Mirror. Prey - Highest [intellect]. Boy of Silence gains Retaliate and Alert if there is an [[Ancient One]] enemy at its current [[True]] location. Forced - After an investigator fails a skill test while investigating: Move Boy of Silence once towards that investigator.

cards.name: Nowhere To Hide
cards.text: Revelation - Put Nowhere To Hide into play in your threat area. Each [[Splicer]] enemy gains: "Prey - You." You cannot move. Forced - At the end of the round: Discard Nowhere To Hide.

cards.flavor: Blurred vision and slurred speech.
cards.name: Gazing Into Oblivion
cards.text: Bonded (Wisdom of the Crowd). Revelation - Put Gazing Into Oblivion into play in your threat area. You get -X skill value while investigating or parleying, where X is the number of copies of Gazing Into Oblivion in your threat area.

cards.flavor: They dress up in leaves and call themselves the Saturnine. Please. They drink human blood and believe they are touched by the ancient gods. Hah.
cards.name: Julie Langford
cards.text: While you control Julie Langford, you may take an additional action during your turn, which can only be used to investigate [[Utility]] locations.

cards.name: Faulty Research
cards.text: Revelation - Discard the top X cards of your deck, where X is the number of clues you control or on your location (whichever is higher) (to a maximum of 5). Take X horror, where X is the number of cards discarded without a [willpower] or [intellect] skill icon. Shuffle each weakness discarded by this effect into your deck.

cards.flavor: It sat, as a last vestige of safety, undisturbed by the falling ruins. A concrete bunker you wish you would never leave.
cards.name: Decompression Chamber
cards.text: [action]: Search the top 9 cards of your deck for a card that "heals damage" or "heals horror" and draw it. (Limit once per round.)

cards.flavor: The chamber hums with the last remnants of life, its sterile walls scarred by the pressure of the deep. Outside, the ocean presses relentlessly against the walls, desperately trying to get in.
cards.name: Decompression Chamber

cards.flavor: Giant stone obelisks bob in the black waters, adorned with eldritch symbols beyond your comprehension.
cards.name: Gates of R'lyeh
cards.text: Gates of R'lyeh gets -1 shroud for each clue on it. [action]: Resign. "It's now or never."

cards.flavor:
"In his house at R’lyeh dead Cthulhu waits dreaming."
― H.P. Lovecraft, The Call of Cthulhu
cards.name: Gates of R'lyeh
Gluttonous Urges
cards.text: Revelation - You must either (whichever is higher): - Lose 1 resource for each asset under your control. - Lose 1 resource for each event in your hand.

cards.name: Voice of Submission
cards.text: Revelation - Trigger Sofia Lamb's patrol keyword and forced effect, then put Voice of Submission into play in the center of the map. Forced - When a horror token is placed on a [[Left]] or [[Right]] location: Place 1 doom on that location and exhaust Andrew Ryan. Then, place this card on the bottom of the deck attached to Conversion Therapy.

cards.name: Security Checkpoint
cards.text: While Security Checkpoint is targeted by a [[Surveillance]] treachery, increase its shroud by 2. Forced - After you fail a skill test at a connecting location: Spawn 1 random enemy from the Big Daddies encounter set at this location. (Group limit once per game).

cards.name: Security Checkpoint
cards.text: [action]: Resign. You enter the lone elevator, hoping it's still functional and hoping you haven't been seen. Forced - After you fail a skill test at a connecting location: Spawn 1 random enemy from the Big Daddies encounter set at this location. (Group limit once per game).

cards.flavor: Suchong's concoction has severely warped your perception on reality, much like those drawn to Lamb's metamorphosis. A farcical heaven or an exaggerated hell, whatever Point Prometheus actually is, you'll never know. Now that the sting of chemicals has subsided in your gut, what lies before you is almost impossible to discern.
cards.name: To Be Reborn
To Be Reborn
cards.text:
"Is there something I can help you find, my child?" A calm, reassuring voice - heard but not seen - whispers through your head. "Whatever it is, you will not find it here." As you continue to move through this world, in dredging boots or with dainty feet, the voice keeps insisting: "To serve the world, we must grow deaf to the self. Please..." as she carries on, a violent screech can be heard outside Point Prometheus' walls, "lay down your singular aspirations and become one with the family."
- Spawn the set-aside Big Sister enemy above Failsafe Armored Escorts or Little Sisters Educational Facility (whichever is furthest from the lead investigator). Then, place 1 resource above that location.

cards.flavor: The Bathysphere Station sits idly by, unconcerned with the horrors that lie beneath it.
cards.name: Bathysphere Station
cards.text: [action]: Search the top 9 cards of your deck for a card that "heals damage" or "heals horror" and draw it. (Llimit once per round.)

cards.flavor: A lone bathysphere sits in the dim station, its metal frame rusted but intact. The vehicles lights flicker weakly, barely holding back the deep-sea darkness pressing against the glass.
cards.name: Bathysphere Station

cards.flavor: "Oh, Wild Bunny, where have you gone?"
cards.name: Impostor Syndrome
cards.text: Surge. Revelation - Take control of The Rabbit Mask. If it was under the control of another investigator, that investigator may heal 1 horror. If it was attached to Sander Cohen, Sander Cohen immediately moves once towards your location.

cards.name: Masquerade Mask
cards.text:
Limit 1 [[Mask]] per investigator.
[reaction] After a non-[[Elite]] enemy enters your location, exhaust Masquerade Mask: Test [agility] (2). If you succeed, that enemy gains aloof for the remainder of the round.

cards.flavor: An eerie stillness overwhelms those in Lamb's court, standing in stark contrast to the pandemonium elsewhere.
cards.name: Lamb's Court
cards.text: [action]: Test [intellect] (4). If you succeed, remove a token placed on The People's Court ([[Center]]).

cards.name: Lamb's Court
cards.text: Forced - After you fail a skill test at this location: Place 2 doom on Sofia Lamb. [free] [[Artist]], [[Assistant]], or [[Silver Twilight]] investigators at this location, discard 2 assets from your hand: Either flip this location over or remove 4 doom from Sofia Lamb. (Group limit once per round.)

cards.name: Rapture Records
cards.text: [free] Take 1 damage: Move to The Atrium. [action]: Resign. You escape through the air ducts. You cannot resign while a non-weakness treachery is in your hand or under your control. While there are no clues on Rapture Records, reduce the shroud value of each [[Upper Level]] location by 3.

cards.flavor: Here lies a frozen tomb of decadence, where boutiques and lifeless mannequins stand in eerie silence.
cards.name: Poseidon Plaza
cards.text: The path leading to Poseidon Plaza is blocked. As an additional cost for you to enter Poseidon Plaza, investigators must spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group.

cards.flavor: A gate meant to never open. A city meant to forever sleep. At the bottom of the ocean, the world splits in two, a prism of realities echo across oblivion.
cards.name: Dreams Shattered...
cards.text: [reaction] After you deal damage to an enemy: Move X cards from one side to another, where X is the amount of damage dealt. Forced - After an Enemy-Location is defeated: Flip it over and remove a connecting barrier. Forced - At the start of the enemy phase: Flip each [[Surveillance]] enemy over.

cards.name: A Destiny of Doom
cards.text:
If any investigator has the [[Construct]] or [[Scion]] trait, silently read the following:
You stare into your mirror - blackness swallowing the looking glass whole - and witness time unraveling itsef.
Flip this agenda back over. (Group limit once per game.)
As your mind reels, so too does the Great Dreamer, stirred from eternal slumber to lay ruin to the world that grew around it. Cthulhu will not rest until the parasite has been eradicated. In due time, the True world will vanish, and the Mirror will be all that remains.
Place 1 horror token on this agenda. Then, if there are 4 horror tokens on this agenda, proceed to (→R1). Flip this agenda back over, adding X doom to it, where X is the amount of Enemy-Locations currently in play. Then, flip over each Persephone and Welcome Center location to its Enemy-Location side. Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck.

cards.name: Irrigation Room
cards.text: Forced - After you reveal Irrigation Room: Test [intellect] (4). - If you succeed, increase Oxygen Deficit by 1 [per_investigator]. - If you fail, decrease Oxygen Deficit by 2 [per_investigator]. If there are no clues on Irrigation Room, remember that you found distilled water.

cards.name: Rolling Hills
cards.text: Forced - At the end of the round, if a [[Surveillance]] treachery is targeting this location, take 1 horror, which can only be assigned to you or an [[Ally]] asset. Each investigator who has a blossom from a rose gains: Ignore the forced ability above.

cards.flavor: "And everywhere was white and soft so you can't get owies."
cards.name: Sleepy Time
cards.text: Surge. Revelation - Flip each [[Facility]] location so that its [[Altered]] side is face-up.

cards.flavor: Your field of vision has narrowed so much that you can't be sure if what you saw was real. A slender, humanoid figure, swimming gracefully along the palladian windows. A single red eye covering its diving helmet.
cards.name: Family Feud
cards.text: Locations with a resource token above them gain the [[Sunken]] trait. Big Sister gains Aloof and is considered to be at its current location. Forced - After a [[Surveillance]] enemy targets a location, if there is no resource token above it, place 1 resource token (from the token pool) above that location.

cards.name: Family Feud
cards.text:
If Big Daddy and Little Sister investigators were in play:
As Point Prometheus continued to crumble, your labored breaths and rushed decisions would only get you so far. As if inevitable, your host body collapsed from exhaustion. R'Lyeh saught its next victim.
(→R1)
If a true investigator was in control of Ellen:
As the siren calls grew more intense, your eyes darting around every corner, what was real could never hold. The bathysphere station was just out of reach. Even if you couldn't make it out, here's to hoping Annabelle could.
(→R2)

cards.name: Gates of R'lyeh
cards.text:
[free]: Look at the back of this location. Then, you may choose to flip this location.
[action]: Test [intellect] (2) to decipher the stones. If you succeed, move X cards from one side to another, where X is the amount you succeeded by. (Limit one success per round.)

cards.flavor:
"Even now, in waking hours, I see them — spiraling, shifting, beckoning."
 -- Professor Emeritus William Dyer
cards.name: Staircase to Oblivion
cards.text: [action]: Parley. You may take 2 additional actions during your turn, which can only be used on the Mirror side.

cards.name: Syringe
cards.text: Syringe cannot leave play. [action]: Investigate. Investigate with [intellect] or [willpower]. If you succeed, discover X clues at your location, where X is the amount you succeeded by. If you fail, either exhaust Syringe or discard a card attached to Little Sister.

cards.name: Judicial Murder
cards.text: Revelation - Test [combat] (3). This test gets +2 difficulty if you do not control at least 2 assets with health and/or sanity values. For each point you fail by, deal 1 damage to a player card at your location.

cards.flavor: "Now you see me, now you don't!"
cards.name: Houdini Splicer
cards.text: Spawn - Out of play. Forced - After a location is revealed: Spawn Houdini Splicer at that location. Forced - After an attack against Houdini Splicer ends in which he is not defeated: Set him aside, out of play. Then, heal all damage from him.

cards.name: Crumbling Foundation
cards.text: Revelation - Attach to the nearest location without a copy of Crumbling Foundation attached. As an additional cost for you to leave attached location (and enter, if [[Sunken]]), test [agility] (1). If you fail, place 1 of your clues on this location. If you cannot, take 1 damage, instead.

cards.flavor: After a moment, your mind stops spinning. But the room doesn't. In fact, the whole place is shifting around you. Tesselated structures, impossible spaces. "Non-Euclidean!," Dyer shouts. You have to find a way out, or else you'll be locked in this madhouse forever.
cards.name: Madness Nears...  (v. I)
cards.text: Forced - After a [[Splicer]] enemy attacks you: Take control of The Rabbit Mask. Forced - At the end of the mythos phase: Make a labyrinth test.

cards.name: The Eternal Cage
cards.text:
If Sander Cohen is alive:
"Oh, why, look at you." Cohen's sarcastic whine seems to emanate from the spotlight hovering over you. "Life has been cruel to the WILD BUNNY. But, here's a carrot for your troubles. Do be on your way." With that, one last blanket of fog sends you off. Not to another room, not to neverland, but to the train station, where you sit dazed and confused.
(→R2)
If Sander Cohen is defeated:
After ridding Rapture of its mad savant, the room's surrounding you have gone quiet. Eerily so. And then, as if by routine, a last blanket of fog sends you off. Not to another room, not to neverland, but to the train station, where you - the WILD BUNNY - sit dazed and confused.
(→R2)

cards.flavor: "Ryan's got me pullin' double duty. First, theater snobs. Now this?
cards.name: Roaming Officer
cards.text:
Aloof. Patrol (Footlight Theater).
Retaliate. Alert.
[action] Spend 3 resources to pull some strings: Discover a clue at your location.

cards.flavor: Finding Annabelle as a foreigner to Rapture was hard enough. Finding her in a foreign body may prove futile. Somewhere in these walls, hiding from evil, awaiting a familiar face, is a girl whose home is eons away.
cards.name: Real Fantasy
cards.text: [reaction] After you discover the last clue at a Walls location: Reveal the attached Little Sister. Forced - When a Big Daddy enters a location, flip it to its [[Abandoned]] side. When a Little Sister enters a location, flip it to its [[Altered]] side. Objective - When an investigator reveals Ellen, immediately advance.

cards.name: Lost in the Walls
cards.text:
If a Big Daddy investigator revealed Ellen:
Inside your suit, your mind has become a vacant palace, barely coherent to your surroundings, guided only by a single desire: Protect a little sister. After searching every nook and cranny, you found her. A happy and hulking whale sound emits from your breathing regulator as she grabs hold of your hand.
Take control of Ellen, and remove each other Little Sister mini-card from the game.
If a Little Sister investigator revealed Ellen:
"Ellen, ellen!" You cry out, with a smile so large it could be seen, nay felt, for miles. "Follow me! We're going to see the sunshine!"
Take control of Ellen, and remove each other Little Sister mini-card from the game.

cards.name: Guardian Spirit
cards.text: Revelation - Put Guardian Spirit into play in your threat area and spawn the set-aside Alpha Series enemy. Alpha Series gains +X health, where X is half the total number of [[Task]] treacheries next to the scenario reference card (rounded up). Forced - When Alpha Series is defeated, place Guardian Spirit next to the scenario reference card and set Alpha Series aside, out of play.

cards.flavor: The Family beckons.
cards.name: Visions of Ruin
cards.text: Revelation - If there are no visions in play, Visions of Ruin gains surge. Otherwise, test [willpower] (0). Increase the difficulty of this test for each vision in play. If you fail, move the X nearest clues to a [[Central]] location, where X is the amount you failed by.

cards.flavor: The waking dream now but a futile nightmare. Somewhere - somewhen - you must become whole again.
cards.name: ...Reality Broken
cards.text: [free] Spend X clues: Move X cards from one side to another. (Limit once per round.) Forced - After the last clue is discovered at a [[R'lyeh]] or [[Columbia]] location: Flip it over and remove each connecting barrier. Objective - At the end of the round, if each undefeated investigator is at the Gates of R'lyeh (ǝɯoH ɹoɹɹᴉꟽ sʇI), you must immediately advance.

cards.name: Two Becomes One
cards.text:
Upon ascending the endless stairs of R'lyeh you come to a door strikingly modern. You reach for it, opening the handle to a blinding sunset across the ocean's horizon. "It's the Lighthouse!," DeWitt exclaims, senselessly rushing to the exit. In one reality, the sea wind captures his immense relief. In the other however, he goes careening off the final crumbling step. In a rush, you instinctively reach out over the edge hoping to grab hold of his flailing arms.
As a group, choose an investigator to test [combat] or [agility] (4). If you succeed, search each deck (including the one attached to C T H U L H U) for Booker DeWitt. Any investigator may play him (at no cost). If you fail, search each deck for Booker DeWitt and remove him from the game. Replenish each removed barrier. Then, remove each barrier between the top-most True location and its 2 connections and place those 2 barriers between the bottom-most location and its 2 connections.

cards.flavor: Poison descends upon Rapture's heart as an egomaniac cuts off its circulation. Arcadia is shrouded in green mist, making an already foreign land even more unknown.
cards.name: Lost in the Mist
cards.text: Forced - When any Rolling Hills location would have 3 locations connected to it, attach a set-aside Toxic Sprinklers to it, facing Langford's Office. Forced - When an enemy would move via a keyword or card effect and cannot, they instead explore and move to the location drawn.

cards.name: Out Of Body, Out Of Mind
cards.text:
Disoriented from Arcadia's many rooms, and the poison slowly filling them all, you can't be sure if what you saw was real or purely an hallucination. A shadowy figure, dawning a bloodied robe and twig mask, flashing in and out of existence. As the minutes pass, the frequency and severity of the hallucination grows. Always in your peripheral, always gone in an instant. Flicker like that of flame.
Shuffle the set aside Saturnine encounter set into the encounter deck, along with the encounter discard pile. Decrease Oxygen Deficit by 1 [per_investigator]. Add 1 resource token (from the token pool) to each [[Surveillance]] treachery in play.

cards.name: Security Bot
cards.text: Bonded (Security Camera). Hunter. Prey - Targeted investigator. Forced - After Security Bot (Judge, Jury, & Executioner) attacks you: Test [willpower] (2). For each point you fail by, lose 1 action next turn. Forced - After Security Bot is defeated: Set it aside, out of play.

cards.name: Eleanor Lamb
cards.text: Fast. Cannot be discarded. [action]: Parley. Test [willpower] (2). If you succeed, remember that Eleanor "recovered her memories." You can only perform this action if all 3 [[Possession]] assets have a memory on them. (If playing true solo, the above action is a [free] action that exhausts).

cards.name: Helping Hands
cards.text: Easy / Standard [skull]: -X, where X is half the number of [[Task]] treacheries next to this card (rounded up). [cultist]: Reveal another token. If you fail, place 1 doom on the scenario reference card (it does not count towards the doom threshold). [tablet]: -2. If you fail, rotate the nearest [[Surveillance]] treachery. [elder_thing]: -2 (-4 if you are at a [[Sunken]] location).

cards.name: Helping Hands
cards.text: Hard / Expert [skull]: -1 for each [[Task]] treachery next to this card. [cultist]: -1. Reveal another token. If you fail, place 1 doom on the scenario reference card (it does not count towards the doom threshold). [tablet]: -3. If you fail, rotate the nearest [[Surveillance]] treachery. [elder_thing]: -3 (-5 if you are at a [[Sunken]] location).

cards.name: Eminent Domain
cards.text:
Eminent Domain cannot leave your hand, unless explicitly instructed.
You cannot play assets or events to the right of Eminent Domain.
[reaction] After you succeed at a skill test while investigating, fighting, or evading: Move one card on the right of Eminent Domain to the left. (Limit once per round).

cards.name: World Gone Mad
cards.text:
As the dense fog evaporates, so too does your mind, unsure as to where you previously were and where you currently are.
Create a separate bag consisting of the following tokens: [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing]. This is the labyrinth bag, and these are labyrinth tokens. They are not chaos tokens. Some abilities will instruct the players to make a labyrinth test. A labyrinth test may cause locations to move. When locations move, all investigators, enemies, tokens, and attachments at that location remain at that location, but move with it. To resolve a labyrinth test, the lead investigator must reveal a random labyrinth token from the labyrinth bag, and resolve the effects for that token as indicated on the other side of this card. Flip this card over and place it next to the scenario reference card.

cards.name: The Labyrinth Stirs
cards.text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: <family "Linux Libertine">Move all locations in your current ring clockwise.</family>
[cultist]: <family "Linux Libertine">Move all locations in your current ring counter-clockwise.</family>
[tablet]: <family "Linux Libertine">Swap each "inner ring" location with the "middle ring" location it is connected to.</family>
[elder_thing]: <family "Linux Libertine">Swap two random "inner" or "middle" ring locations.</family>

cards.name: Security Camera
cards.text: Revelation - Attach Security Camera to the nearest [[Central]] location with no [[Surveillance]] treachery attached, facing the location nearest to its arrows. Forced - When targeted, search your bonded cards for a random set-aside Security Bot and spawn it at the targeted location.

cards.flavor: Throngs of spectators at Footlight Theater turn simple ambling into a delicate dance.
cards.name: Footlight Theater
cards.text: Forced - After you fail an investigation attempt at Footlight Theater: Lower the shroud value by 2 until the end of your turn.

cards.flavor: Signage for upcoming performances such as "Happy Chappy" and "Patrick & Moira" adorn the embroidered walls as stifled laughter emits from the playhouse.
cards.name: Footlight Theater
Siren
cards.text: Mirror. Aloof. You cannot use [[ADAM]] assets while at Siren's location or any connecting locations. Forced - At the end of the round: Remove 1 use from an asset at Siren's location or a connecting location.

cards.name: Arms Race
cards.text:
Permanent. Limit 1 per deck.
[reaction] After the last ammo is spent from a [[Firearm]] asset you control: Play a [[Firearm]] asset from your hand, reducing its cost by 1.

cards.name: True Self, Mirror Self
cards.text: True Self, Mirror Self cannot leave your hand. Does not count towards your hand size. Cards to the right of this card are in your True hand. Cards to the left of this card are in your Mirror hand. Forced - After you read Scenario Interlude: A Sea of Doors: Remove True Self, Mirror Self from the game.

cards.flavor: "Harness the flame, harness the mist!"
cards.name: Saturnine Sectarian
cards.text: Elusive. Forced - After Saturnine Sectarian attacks: Place 1 doom on it. Forced - After Saturnine Sectarian moves from the elusive keyword, if it is unengaged: Resolve its elusive keyword again.

cards.name: Power Failure
cards.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). If you fail, discard X [mystic] cards from your hand, where X is the amount of [mystic] assets under your control (to a maximum of 3). For each card you cannot discard, reveal the top card of your deck and remove it from the game (or draw it, if it is a weakness).

cards.flavor: "I knew this thing was old, but I didn’t think it was 'fall-apart-under-pressure' old."
cards.name: Rapid Deterioration
cards.text: Revelation - If Diving Suit is not in your play area, Rapid Deterioration gains surge. Otherwise, test [agility] (3). For each point you fail by, deal 1 damage and/or horror to Diving Suit.

cards.name: Shellshocked
cards.text: Revelation - Attach Shellshocked to the nearest non-[[Elite]] enemy. If there is no enemy in play, search the encounter deck and discard pile for one and draw it, attaching Shellshocked to it (shuffle the encounter deck). Attached enemy gets retaliate, +1 [per_investigator] fight, and +1 [per_investigator] health.

cards.name: Security Bot
cards.text: Bonded (Security Camera). Hunter. Elusive. Prey - Targeted investigator. Forced - When Security Bot attacks you, place a resource (from the token pool) on this card. For each resource, Security Bot deals +1 damage. Forced - After Security Bot is defeated: Set it aside, out of play.

cards.flavor: "Don't drink on the job they say. Well tonight, ain't no job big enough to stop that."
cards.name: Roaming Officer
cards.text:
Aloof. Patrol (Kashmir Restaurant).
Retaliate. Alert.
Roaming Officer's location gains +2 shroud.

cards.name: Cohen's Collection
cards.text: Cohen's Collection gets -1 shroud for each revealed location connected to it. Forced - After you fail a skill test while evading at this location: Increase this location's shroud value by 1 for the remainder of the round.

cards.flavor: Exotic relics likely smuggled in gather dust on broken pedestals, their once-glorious sheen dulled.
cards.name: Cohen's Collection
cards.text: The path leading to Cohen's Collection is blocked. As an additional cost for you to enter Cohen's Collection, investigators must spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group.

cards.flavor: That machine of Lamb's has taken your companions into the bowels of Persephone, leaving you stranded amidst the crazies. Is it using them as bait to trap you inside, or something more nefarious?
cards.name: Solitary Confinement (v. I)
cards.text: Forced - At the end of the round: Place clues on each revealed Prison Cell location until it has clues equal to its clue value.

cards.name: Big Sister
cards.text: Spawn - Above the leftmost Prison Cell location. Big Sister cannot attack, be attacked, be evaded, or be dealt damage. Forced - When targeted, place 1 clue you control on your location. Then, flip it to its doom side. Doom flipped by this effect can be discovered as if it were a clue.

cards.name: Frozen in Ice
cards.text: Revelation - Attach Frozen in Ice to your location. Limit 1 per location. Investigators at the attached location cannot move. [action]: Search the encounter deck for a non-[[Elite]] enemy and spawn it engaged with you. Forced - After an enemy attacks an investigator at this location: Discard Frozen in Ice

cards.name: Hall of Carvings
cards.text: The first [[True]] encounter card drawn during the mythos phase by an investigator at this location gains surge. Hall of Carvings gets +X shroud, where X is the highest [intellect] value amongst investigators at this location. If you witnessed time unfurling, choose the lowest [intellect] instead.

cards.name: Fort Frolic
cards.text: [reaction] After you enter Fort Frolic: Move 1 card from your True side to your Mirror side. Forced - After you fail a skill test while investigating Fort Frolic: Move 1 card from the top of your Mirror deck to the top of your True deck.

cards.flavor: "Why aren't you the new belle of the ball."
cards.name: Suffocating Pleasantries
cards.text: Revelation - Put Suffocating Pleasantries into play in your threat area. Forced - When you perform a move action, either spend 1 resource or take 1 horror. Then, place 1 resource token on Suffocating Pleasantries. When 3 resources are on Suffocating Pleasantries, discard it.

cards.name: Eternal Captivity
cards.text:
Peril. Surge.
You must either (choose one):
- Each investigator moves 2 cards on the left of
     Eminent Domain in their hand to the right.
- Draw 2 tokens from the lockdown bag and
     place them on 2 random [[Lower Level]]
     locations.

cards.flavor: A unit of henchmen march in unison, trampling over the Grand Hall's marble tiling, or the bodies of the deceased.
cards.name: Ryan's Court
cards.text: [free] Take 2 horror: Remove a token from any location in this court. (Group limit once per round).

cards.name: Ryan's Court
cards.text: Forced - After you fail a skill test at this location: Place 1 horror token on Andrew Ryan. [free] [[Miskatonic]], [[Police]], or [[Warden]] investigators at this location, take 2 damage: Either flip this location over or remove 2 horror tokens from Andrew Ryan. (Group limit once per round.)

cards.name: Dionysus Park Ruins
cards.text: Forced - After you enter Dionysus Park Ruins, if you did so by moving through 2 or more [[Ocean]] locations: Take 2 damage. [action][action]: Heal 3 horror. (Group limit once per round.)

cards.flavor: Flooded galleries lie in eerie silence, their murals peeling beneath drifting schools of fish. Bent carousel horses loom in the murk, awaiting passengers who will never come.
cards.name: Dionysus Park Ruins
The Tortured Artist
cards.text: Revelation - Discard X events from your hand or attached to your investigator. Then, test [willpower] (6). Reduce the difficulty of this test for each event discarded. If you fail, take 2 horror. If you succeed, search your discard pile for 2 events and draw them.

cards.flavor: "Set traps for unsuspecting enemies!"
cards.name: Cyclone Trap
cards.text:
Uses (3 Eve).
[action] Spend 1 eve: Attach to a connecting location.
[reaction] When a non-[[Elite]] enemy enters attached location, exhaust that enemy. It does not ready during the next upkeep phase. Return Cyclone Trap to your play area.

cards.flavor: It's a siren calling with a searchlight. Like a stalker in the night, pacing back and forth, its eye an omen of ill-intent.
cards.name: Siren's Call (v. I)
cards.text: If it is act 2a, Big Sister gains the following text: "Forced - After Big Sister moves to an empty location via its [[Surveillance]] keyword: Resolve its [[Surveillance]] keyword again. (Limit once per round.)" Forced - At the end of the round: Place clues on each revealed Prison Cell location until it has clues equal to its clue value.

cards.name: Flicker and Fade
cards.text:
Try as you might, you're unable to find your way out of Lamb's dingy gaol. Its concrete corridors calling you home. Manic cheers erupt from the throng of mindless prisoners, as metal clangs on metal, sparks and flames emitting from their cell doors. "Join us!," screams one. "Join the Family!," cries another. As the minutes and hours go by, so too does your sanity. Your delusions grow ever stronger, spurred on by a sense of overwhelming dread. Brilliant, blue butterflies appear above your head, fluttering in ever-expanding droves. Their luminescence a glitter across the room, consuming the space where you now rest in the fetal position. And as you do, the kaleidoscope of butterflies form a shimmer. A vision. A tear... Into another reality.
(→R3)

cards.name: The Bouncer
cards.text: Each enemy at this location gets -1 fight. [reaction] At the end of the enemy phase: Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, The Bouncer deals 1 damage to an enemy at this location. If you fail, flip The Bouncer over. Any investigator at this location may perform this test. Forced - If there are no investigators at this location: Flip The Bouncer over.

cards.name: The Bouncer
cards.text: Forced - After an investigator fails a test while attacking at any location, if The Bouncer is ready: Move The Bouncer once towards that location. [action] If The Bouncer has at least 2 damage on it: Parley. Test [combat] (3) to intimidate the Big Daddy. If you succeed, flip over The Bouncer (keeping all tokens) and attach it to your location.

cards.flavor: "Come, my child. Become one with The Family."
cards.name: Soul Harvest
cards.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (4). If you fail, discard 2 cards at random attached to your investigator card. If it is act 3a, discard 3 cards at random from your hand, instead.

cards.name: Lutece Twins Reference
cards.text:
Easy / Standard
[cultist]: Remove 1 doom from a location in the targeted Court, and move 1 doom from any one location to another location without doom on it.
[tablet]: Choose one: Remove 1 horror token from a [[Left]] or [[Right]] location in the targeted Court, or flip 2 locations over.
[elder_thing]: Remove 1 horror token from a [[Center]] location in the targeted Court. You may then test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, remove another.

cards.name: Lutece Twins Reference
cards.text:
Hard / Expert
[cultist]: Remove 1 doom from a location in the targeted Court, and move 1 doom from any one location to another location without doom on it.
[tablet]: Choose one: Remove 1 horror token from a [[Left]] or [[Right]] location in the targeted Court, or flip 2 locations over.
[elder_thing]: Test [willpower] (2). If you succeed, remove 1 horror token from a [[Center]] location in the targeted Court.

cards.name: Eye of the Beholder
cards.text: Revelation - Put Eye of the Beholder into play in your threat area. Each hunter enemy gains: "Prey - You." Each time an enemy engages you, place 1 resource token (from the token pool) on Eye of the Beholder. Forced - If there is a total of 3 resources on Eye of the Beholder, discard it.

cards.name: Disobeying Master
cards.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (6). This test gets -1 difficulty for each [[ADAM]] asset in your hand and play area (including permanents). For each point you fail by, discard 1 [[Plasmid]] asset from your hand and/or play area. If no assets were discarded in this way, remove a [[Gene Tonic]] permanent you control from the game.

cards.name: No Limelight
cards.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). If you fail, put No Limelight into play in your threat area with 1 resource (from the token pool) for each point you failed by. Treat your investigator's text box as if it were blank (except for [[Traits]]). Forced - At the end of the round: Remove 1 resource from No Limelight. When the final resource is removed, discard it.

cards.flavor:
"Even its shadow seemed wrong, as though cast from another world."
-- Dr. Brigid Tenenbaum
cards.name: The Great Pyramid
cards.text: [reaction] After you discover a clue from Fink Manufacturing: Reduce the shroud value of The Great Pyramid by 2 for the remainder of your turn. If you scaled the tetrahedron, reduce it by 3 instead.

cards.name: The Grand Hall
cards.text: The Grand Hall gets +2 shroud if C T H U L H U is targeting it. [reaction] After you enter The Grand Hall: Move 2 cards from your True side to your Mirror side.

cards.flavor: "Buy yourself time in dangerous situations!"
cards.name: Target Dummy
cards.text: Uses (3 Eve). [free] Spend 1 eve and attach Target Dummy to your location: For the remainder of the round, non-[[Elite]] enemies cannot engage or attack investigators at this location. Forced - At the end of the round: Return Target Dummy to your play area.

cards.name: Slugger
cards.text:
Permanent. Limit 1 per deck.
[action]: Place 1 resource on Slugger, as ferocity.
[reaction] During a skill test on a [[Melee]] asset you control, spend 1 ferocity from Slugger: If you succeed, this attack does +1 damage.

cards.flavor: As you enter Atlas' court, you catch glimpses of manic splicers scaling the scaffolding of the Grand Hall.
cards.name: Atlas' Court
cards.text: [free]: Draw the top card of the encounter deck: Remove a token from any location in this court. (Group limit once per round).

cards.name: Atlas' Court
cards.text: Forced - After you fail a skill test at this location: Place 1 horror token on Atlas. [free] [[Criminal]], [[Believer]], or [[Performer]] investigators at this location, discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until a treachery is discarded and draw it: Either flip this location over or remove 2 horror tokens from Atlas. (Group limit once per round.)

cards.name: Basement
cards.text: [action]: Test [intellect] (3) to comprehend the schematics inside the manual. If you succeed, place 1 resource (from the token pool) next to Elevator Shaft. (Group limit one success per game.) Forced - If you kept the water at bay, reduce the difficulty of the above skill test by 1. Otherwise, if you let the water flow, increase it by 1 instead.

cards.flavor:
"Stronger arm and sharper brain - that's why the future is Fontaine!"
- Fontaine Futuristics Jingle
cards.name: Basement
ADAM Containers
cards.text: Fast. Cannot be discarded. You get +1 [combat]. [action]: Parley. Test [combat] (4). Reduce the difficulty of this test by 2 for each other [[Possession]] asset in play with a memory on it. If you succeed, place a resource on ADAM Containers, as a memory.

cards.name: Analysis Paralysis
cards.text: Revelation - Put Analysis Paralysis into play in your threat area. Forced - After an investigator at your location discovers 2 or more clues during their turn: End their turn. [action]: Test [intellect] (3). If you succeed, discard Analysis Paralysis.

cards.flavor: Around you sits four rooms; their doors shut and secrets kept. Behind one such door, you, Booker, and all of Arkham hope to find Annabelle Peaslee and the caretaker holding out against the powers that be.
cards.name: Das Wunderkind
cards.text: Objective - At the end of the round, if Tenenbaum's Office has no clues on it, you may advance.

cards.name: An Unusual Lineup
cards.text:
"Stay back!" The matriarch of this facility howls, her voice as coarse as the wrinkles coursing through her skin. You instinctively reach out a hand. "I said, stay back! He's taken enough, these girls are all I have left." The Russian accent is thick and stilted. You acquiesce, halting your motions while continuing to reassure Tenenbaum that you mean her no harm. That you came from topside to rescue a child who had been abducted, and you have reason to believe she may be in these very halls. "One... one of mine? My little ones? But who?"
Read Scenario Interlude: Eeny Meeny Miny Moe in the Campaign Guide.

cards.flavor: You looked down, then back at your team, in a state of sheer terror. Whatever's down there, it's coming for you. And it's coming fast.
cards.name: Harbinger of the Abyss (v. I)
cards.text: Thälassárïth can be attacked by [[Spell]] or [[Firearm]] cards at connecting locations. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase, flip Thälassárïth over and move it up or down, whichever direction continues its current serpentine pattern. Forced - At the end of your turn, if you are at an Abyssal Currents location: Take 1 direct horror.

cards.name: Swallowed Whole
cards.text:
Raging currents, shifting structures, and a beast eager to protect its domain. It seems as though the trip was, after all, a futile one, as you collapse into yourself, besieged by the onslaught of pressure. The voices of your compatriots falling to a simmer, replaced by the faintest, mesmeric hum. It calls to you, from the beyond. Transfixed, you embrace the darkness that lies below. You welcome its gaping maw. And it welcomes you home.
Each investigator is defeated and suffers 1 physical or 1 mental trauma. (Note: Do not remove your health and sanity tokens as they are tabulated during the resolution of this scenario.)

cards.flavor: The compass moves without rhyme or reason.
cards.name: Captain's Compass
cards.text: [reaction] At the end of your turn, if you ended your turn exactly 1 location away from where you begin, exhaust Captain's Compass: Move back to the location you started this turn at. This does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

cards.name: The Tide Turns
cards.text: Surge. Revelation - Attach The Tide Turns to Thälassárïth. After Thälassárïth moves during the enemy phase, perform its movement again. During these moves, it targets the row above and below, in addition to its current row. Then, discard one copy of The Tide Turns attached to Thälassárïth.

cards.name: Eve's Garden
cards.text: [free] Take 1 damage: Move to The Atrium. [action]: Resign. You escape through the back entrance. You cannot resign while a non-weakness treachery is in your hand or under your control. While there are no clues on Eve's Garden, reduce the shroud value of each [[Upper Level]] location by 3.

cards.flavor: Here lies a frozen tomb of decadence, where boutiques and lifeless mannequins stand in eerie silence.
cards.name: Poseidon Plaza
cards.text: The path leading to Poseidon Plaza is blocked. As an additional cost for you to enter Poseidon Plaza, investigators must spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group.

cards.name: Damaged Doll
cards.text:
Throngs of little girls sit in cramped dormitories. Crayons are scattered on the ground, underneath drawings that line the walls. Docile and subservient, the girls pay you no mind. In the corner of one room lies an empty bed with the name "Sally" roughly scratched out of a name plate. Between the mattress and the wall you uncover pieces of a doll; discarded and torn.
If any investigator has the [[Cultist]], [[Cursed]], or [[Sorcerer]] trait, silently read the following:
Something about this doll, or rather what's left of it, doesn't sit right with you. Impossible angles jut out one eye, as the other rests in a filament of clouds.
Peril. Revelation - In your section of the Campaign Log, you must either (choose one): - Record that you accepted the omen. - Record that you ignored the omen.
Flip this card over.

cards.name: Damaged Doll
cards.text: Forced - When you gain control of Damaged Doll, flip it over and resolve its text. [reaction] When an enemy would move due to a forced ability, exhaust Damaged Doll: Cancel that ability and place 1 doom on Damaged Doll. [action]: Test [willpower] (4). If you succeed, remove 1 doom from Damaged Doll.

cards.name: Unmade Mind
cards.text: Revelation - Put Unmade Mind into play in your True threat area. [action]: Test [willpower] (6). Reduce the difficulty of this test by 1 for each card attached to Unmade Mind. If you succeed, discard Unmade Mind and shuffle each attached card into your Mirror deck. Forced - At the end of your turn: Attach a random card in your True hand to Unmade Mind.

cards.name: Faith Restored
cards.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). For each point you fail by, replace a [bless] token in the chaos bag with a [curse]. For each point that you cannot, add 2 [curse] tokens to the chaos bag instead.

cards.flavor: With her powerful words and soothing melody, Lamb intends to win over the hearts of the many lost souls before crushing them - and the "self" - under the weight of collectivism.
cards.name: Conversion Therapy
cards.text: Forced - At the end of the mythos phase, if Sofia Lamb is in play: Choose an investigator to draw the top card attached to Conversion Therapy and resolve its revelation ability. Then, place it on the bottom of the attached deck. Forced - If each location has doom on it, immediately advance.

cards.name: A Grand Metamorphosis!
cards.text: Through the power of word, Sofia Lamb has bent the masses to her whim. The many have become the one, so the Family may devour the self. Proceed to (→R5).

cards.flavor: Finding your way through Fort Frolic's many establishments is proving nigh-on impossible. What's up is down, what's down is up. The only way forward is through.
cards.name: Circuitous Pathways (v. I)
cards.text: [action] If you are at a [[Lower Level]] location, discard 2 cards at random from your hand: Swap your current location with another on the same "ring." (Group limit once per round). Objective - After the three "middle ring" locations are revealed, immediately advance.

cards.name: State of Mind
cards.text:
Your frantic search for an exit continues. Though each time a potential escape is in sight, the dimensions of Cohen's asylum change. "If it's a game you want, it's a game you'll get! His voice in a state of violent rage, the tremors from the ocean's abyss now well within these very walls. "Fort Frolic isn't a place, my wild bunny, it is a state of mind. Please, do tarry on to Poseidon Plaza. I'll even draw back the curtain for you."
Put the three set-aside Poseidon Plaza locations into play, as the "outer ring," one connected to each "middle ring" location.

cards.name: Smuggler's Hideout
cards.text: Security Camera ignores Smuggler's Hideout (it targets the next available location instead). [action]: Resign. "We can get out this way!" [action]: Search the top 9 cards of your deck for an [[Illicit]] or [[Fortune]] card and draw it. Shuffle your deck. (Limit once per round).

cards.flavor: A forgotten access tunnel for the parasites and petty thieves.
cards.name: Smuggler's Hideout
cards.text: Security Camera ignores Smuggler's Hideout (it targets the next available location instead). As an additional cost for you to enter this location, investigators at your location must spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group.

cards.name: Machine Buster
cards.text: Permanent. Limit 1 per deck. You get +1 skill value while performing tests on non-enemy scenario cards during your turn or while attacking [[Automaton]] enemies. [action]: Fight or Investigate. The difficulty of this test is equal to the shroud of your location. If you succeed, instead of dealing damage or discovering clues, you may discard a [[Surveillance]] treachery attached to your location.

cards.flavor: Above you lies a vast expanse of ocean. Unfathomable in scale, offset by the comparatively-puny receding skyline of Rapture. In-between here and there, a wall of black water, and the threat of a colossal black shadow looming within it.
cards.name: Rising Tide (v. II)
cards.text: Forced - At the end of your turn, if you are at an Abyssal Currents location: Take 1 direct horror.

cards.name: Covered in Darkness
cards.text:
As you latch onto the nearest man-made structure, its rigid design foreign to the nature that stews below it, a chill courses through your veins. You look around at the waters that have grown eerily still. As if they too sense a looming dread. "Riptide!," cries out Dyer, scrambling to press his back to a wall that may or may not hold him in place. The once-still waters suddenly thrumming this way and that. All because of the vibrations you soon feel pressing down on you from above. You tilt your head upwards, throwing caution to the wind. The bright lights of Rapture flickering in the distance, shrouded by a vast, black shadow moving in the foreground.
Spawn the set-aside Thälassárïth enemy at the top-left location with its [[Surveillance]] arrows pointing right, and shuffle both copies of Deep One Offspring and all 3 copies of The Tide Turns into the encounter deck.

cards.flavor: "Light up foes to a 1000 degrees! Warning: fire spreads!"
cards.name: Incinerate!
cards.text: Uses (3 Eve). [action] Exhaust Incinerate! and spend 1 eve: Fight. You get +1 [combat] for this attack. If you succeed, and that enemy is non-[[Elite]], move it to a connecting location. It loses hunter until the end of the round. Deal 2 damage to that enemy at the start of the next investigation phase.

cards.name: The Waters Are Never Still
cards.text:
The familiar streets of Arkham stretch beneath a sky of muted gray, the autumn wind carrying the scent of damp earth and fallen leaves. Life continues as it always has — cars rattle down cobbled roads, shopkeepers sweep their storefronts, and the distant toll of a church bell marks the hour. And yet, beneath it all, something lingers. In the shadowed corners where the gaslight fails to reach, a presence - ancient and unyielding, watching and waiting - persists. For eternity.
- Attach the set-aside Watchful Eye treachery to The Lighthouse, facing this location. - Place 1 set-aside [elder_thing] token on the current act. Then, if the act has 3 matching symbols, you may perform the resign ability below. - Flip this card back over.
[free]: Resign. You step through the door. Do not flip over this card. It is not considered empty.

cards.name: Sea of Doors
cards.text: [action]: Test [intellect] (6). Reduce the difficulty of this skill test by X, where X is the number of [[Extradimensional]] locations without clues on them. If you succeed, flip this card over.

cards.name: Pipe Burst
cards.text: Surge. If there are no [[Surveillance]] treacheries in play, search the encounter deck or set aside cards for one and draw it. Otherwise, add 1 resource token (from the resource pool) to the nearest [[Surveillance]] treachery.

cards.name: Bloodlust
cards.text: Permanent. Limit 1 per deck. [reaction] After you defeat an enemy: Heal 1 damage or 1 horror. Then, you may shuffle a card from your discard pile with a Fight action in its text box back into your deck.

cards.name: Memorial Museum
cards.text: Forced - At the end of the round, each Little Sister investigator at this location must discard one card beneath their investigator card. [action]: Test [agility] (9). If you succeed, remember that you found the Little Sister antidote.

cards.flavor: "Who watches over sleeping angels? I do, I do…"
cards.name: Memorial Museum
cards.text: [free] Spend 2 [per_investigator] clues: Either play a non-[[Item]] or [[Ally]] card (at no cost) or attach a card to your investigator (at no cost). (Limit once per round.)

cards.name: Acephalic Presence
cards.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (X), where X is the number of assets you control. If you fail, take 2 damage and move the farthest, non-[[Elite]] enemy once towards your location.

cards.name: Upper Concourse
cards.text: [free] During your turn, choose and discard 2 cards from your hand: Increase Oxygen Deficit by 1 [per_investigator]. (Group limit once per round.) Upper Concourse is connected to Lower Concourse for all [[Sorcerer]] enemies, or investigators with a macabre twig mask.

cards.name: Rolling Hills
cards.text: Forced - At the end of the round, if a [[Surveillance]] treachery is targeting this location, take 1 damage, which can only be assigned to you or an [[Ally]] asset. Each investigator who has a blossom from a rose gains: Ignore the forced ability above.

cards.flavor:
"Its surface absorbed light, as if it never even existed."
-- Professor Emeritus William Dyer
cards.name: Black Lake
cards.text: Black Lake gets +X shroud, where X is the highest [agility] value amongst investigators at this location. If you walked atop water, choose the lowest [agility] instead.

cards.name: Apollo Square
cards.text: [reaction] After you enter Apollo Square: Move 1 card from your True side to your Mirror side. Forced - After you fail a skill test while investigating Apollo Square: Move 1 card from your Mirror hand to your True hand.

cards.name: Spotlight
cards.text: Each Plaster Splicer enemy targeted by the Spotlight loses hunter. Forced - When targeted, if a hunter enemy is on the same "ring" as you, its location is considered to be connected to yours during the enemy phase

cards.name: Damage Research
cards.text:
Permanent. Limit 1 per deck.
Clues you control may be placed on your location to deal 1 damage to an enemy at your location. (Limit once per round.)

cards.flavor: Gaudy colors and flashing lights reflect off the pool of murky waters covering its mouldy-rug flooring.
cards.name: Sir Prize
cards.text:
[free] Take 1 damage: Move to The Atrium.
[action]: Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, attach a [[Pact]] treachery in your hand or under your control to Sander Cohen.

cards.flavor: Here lies a frozen tomb of decadence, where boutiques and lifeless mannequins stand in eerie silence.
cards.name: Poseidon Plaza
cards.text: The path leading to Poseidon Plaza is blocked. As an additional cost for you to enter Poseidon Plaza, investigators must spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group.

cards.name: Research Laboratory
cards.text: Forced - After you reveal Research Laboratory: Test [intellect] (4). - If you succeed, increase Oxygen Deficit by 1 [per_investigator]. - If you fail, decrease Oxygen Deficit by 2 [per_investigator]. If there are no clues on Research Laboratory, remember that you found a vial of chlorophyll.

cards.name: Rolling Hills
cards.text: Forced - At the end of the round, reduce Oxygen Deficit by 1 [per_investigator] if you are targeted by a [[Surveillance]] treachery. Each investigator who has a macabre twig mask gains: Ignore the forced ability above.

cards.name: Devout Follower
cards.text: Revelation - Put Devout Follower into play in your ally slot. If this would discard an asset you control, return that asset to your hand. While Devout Follower is in your play area, it is considered engaged with you. Forced - When you would play an [[Ally]] asset: Increase its resource cost by 2.

cards.name: Miasmic Sludge
cards.text: Revelation - If you are not at a [[Cell]] or [[Forbidden]] location, Miasmic Sludge gains surge. Otherwise, if you are at a... - [[Cell]] location, add 1 clue to your location and an adjacent [[Cell]] location. - [[Forbidden]] location, move 1 [per_investigator] clues from your location and/or a connecting [[Forbidden]] location to a [[Central]] location.

cards.name: The Space Between
cards.text: Revelation - Put The Space Between into play in your threat area. Forced - At the beginning of your turn: Choose a location other than your location. When your turn ends, if you did not play a card at the chosen location, draw the top card of your deck and remove it from the game. Then, discard The Space Between.

cards.flavor: "I want to take the ears off, but I can't!!!"
cards.name: The Rabbit Mask
cards.text: Revelation - Put The Rabbit Mask into play in your threat area. Cannot be canceled. Forced - After you perform an action or ability in the Rabbit Mask section of the Campaign Log (page 39) that matches one of your investigator's traits: Take 1 horror.

cards.flavor: The smell of fish wafts through the air, as aristocratic locals frolic about. Some even dawn masquerade masks.
cards.name: Kashmir Restaurant
cards.text: Forced - After you fail an investigation attempt, or succeed by 0, at Kashmir Restaurant, raise the shroud value by 1 until the end of the round.

cards.flavor: You recall the symbolic statue of Atlas - the main centerpiece of the cocktail lounge - from a visit to New York City. Here, its presence dominates the room as bioluminescent light from outside reflects off of its surface.
cards.name: Kashmir Restaurant

cards.flavor: Whatever plan you mustered up with Dyer and the team has fallen apart. Prime objective now is finding them.
cards.name: Jailbreak (v. I)
cards.text: Forced - After a [[Big Daddy]] spawns: Attach 2 random, set aside [[Mood]] treacheries to it. [free] If you are at a Prison Cell location with no clues on it: Draw the bottom card attached to it. If it is an enemy, spawn it exhausted. If it is an [[Ally]], add it to that investigator's hand (and shuffle any set-aside copy into their deck). (Group limit three times per round.) Objective - After each [[Resident]] ally is revealed, you may advance.

cards.name: Birds, Reunited in a Cage
cards.text:
"C'mon, let's get out of here!" Dyer exclaims, as DeWitt and Tenenbaum trail in his wake. Now united at the Command Center - Dyer and DeWitt up in arms on how to proceed - Tenenbaum interjects with gentle assertion. "Men, I... I think that thing out there might be..." before she can finish her sentence, all of Persephone shakes for a chaotic moment. A fuzzy shimmer runs across your eyelids.
Each investigator loses each of their clues. Reveal any unrevealed Prison Cell locations. Then, place each investigator at the Command Center. Place clues on Cell Block A and Cell Block B until each has clues equal to its clue value. Put the set-aside Operating Room, Simulation Room, Larva Nests, and Playroom locations into play. Locate the four set-aside story assets and shuffle them, attaching one facedown to each of the above locations.

cards.name: Moonbeam Fairy
cards.text: Revelation - Put Moonbeam Fairy into play in your threat area. Forced - When performing any action, test [willpower] (2). If you fail, cancel that action and discard Moonbeam Fairy. Forced - At the end of your turn: Discard Moonbeam Fairy.

cards.flavor: "Acta Non Verba."
cards.name: Booker's Broadsider
cards.text: Fast. Uses (6 ammo). [action] Spend 1-3 ammo: Fight. Draw X chaos tokens during this attack, where X is the amount of ammo spent. You get +X [combat] for this attack. If you succeed, deal X damage.

cards.flavor: Frozen in suspended animation, tied down in complete darkness, the only sound you hear echoing through the atrium is that of footsteps, quietly, gently, methodically, coming down the stairs.
cards.name: The Iceman Cometh (v. I)
cards.text: Forced - Do not draw encounter cards during the mythos phase. You cannot play cards or trigger actions that would require you to interact with the encounter deck. Only doom on this card counts towards the doom threshold. (Still remove all doom in play when this agenda advances).

cards.name: The Show Must Go On
cards.text:
"Foolishness! You think The March Hare can unfold without its leading actor in the proper attire? Where's the gusto, the glitz, the gaiety in that!?" Cohen's declarations sound through Fort Frolic's halls as a guffaw of manic laughs chirp all around you. "Where’s your rabbit mask, critique? We’re creating art here, not a travesty!"
Each investigator must draw 2 cards from the encounter deck. Didn't think you were getting away that easy, huh? Put the set-aside Rabbit Mask weakness into play under the control of the lead investigator.
If any investigator has the [[Artist]] trait, read the following:
"Well, well, well. A fellow luminary! What a pleasant surprise," Cohen remarks. "You shall be my muse."
Do not draw encounter cards as instructed above.

cards.name: The Watchful Eye
cards.text: Forced - When targeted, you cannot move until The Watchful Eye is no longer targeting you. [action]: Take 1 horror and rotate this card clockwise or counter-clockwise. Only investigators targeted by The Watchful Eye may trigger this ability.

cards.flavor: Two glowing, hollow eyes track your every movement.
cards.name: Vents
cards.text: [action]: Knock. Draw the top card of the Little Sisters deck. (Group limit once per game). [reaction] When you enter Vents, you may discard a card from your hand to immediately move to a connecting location.

cards.flavor:
"The Little Sister's Orphanage: In troubled times, give your little girl the life that she deserves. Boarding and education free of charge! After all, children ARE the future of Rapture."
― Public Address Advertisement
cards.name: Little Sister's Orphanage
Basement
cards.text: [action]: Test [agility] (3) to reroute faulty wiring and reinstall the control panel. If you succeed, place 1 resource (from the token pool) next to Elevator Shaft. (Group limit one success per game.) Forced - If you kept the water at bay, reduce the difficulty of the above skill test by 1. Otherwise, if you let the water flow, increase it by 1 instead.

cards.flavor:
"Stronger arm and sharper brain - that's why the future is Fontaine!"
- Fontaine Futuristics Jingle
cards.name: Basement

cards.flavor: "You even touch those slugs and your blood will turn into a furnace."
cards.name: Blood Aglow
cards.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (4). Decrease the skill value of this test for each [[ADAM]] asset you control. If you fail, take 1 horror and treat your investigator as if their printed text box were blank (except for [[Traits]]) until the end of the round.

cards.flavor: A lounge for Rapture's esteemed nobility, selling high-end, locally-sourced alcohols and spirits.
cards.name: Satyr Lounge
